Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Is it a thrilling opportunity in a dynamic environment which is constantly evolving what you are currently looking for?

Are you curious to see how a company that operates in the Insurance sector provides a great experience at a great price to its customers using cutting-edge technologies to create and sell its products? Then, we are happy to inform you that you have just got a ticket to the fast lane!

IT technology lies at the very core of everything we do and our Engineering and Product departments are composed by passionate and innovative people who never stop learning and developing their skills employing the latest stacks and methodologies.

At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career; learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.

You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development.

We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you  We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.

üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities  We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth; so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing  From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.

The Role

As a Data Analyst you will join the global Product Analytics team and play a pivotal role in transforming big data into actionable insights that can steer strategic business decisions all across the organization. You will work closely with stakeholders in Product, Engineering and Business teams to identify analytics opportunities, to understand the main quantitative factors that are influencing the company's performance and results, in order to facilitate data-driven decision-making.

In particular, this position is focused on the analytical support to the Claims domain.

Key Responsibilities

Analyse big amount of data in claims domain, distil insights, and make recommendations to drive product and business decisions
Improve stakeholder productivity and experience by identifying blockers and new efficiency opportunities
Assist Product teams in developing Data Model and Data Products according to the company's data strategy
Perform ad-hoc analyses to examine specific phenomena or validate business strategies

Requirements

You are our ideal candidate if you meet these requirements:
Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Maths, Data Science, Economics or related fields
High-level analytical, logical, and quantitative problem-solving skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and Excel

Nice to have

Knowledge of BI tools such as Tableau
In addition to the basic requirements, we will pay special attention to these characteristics:
Experience in manipulating and interpreting data from different sources
Experience in working in IT departments

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

If it sounds like we‚Äôd be a good fit for each other, join us in the fast lane!"

The successful candidate will be a key member of the Claims Management Information Team and should be passionate about data analytics, data visualization, problem solving and continuous improvements. MCC

Title:
Junior Business Intelligence Specialist
Junior Business Intelligence Specialist with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Meet Sievo
At Sievo, we help the world's largest organizations make effective and timely decisions by creating smart and seamless procurement analytics software solutions. Our solutions are built in-house with the focus on continuous development.

At the core of our success are talented and passionate people. Sievo prides itself in creating a collaborative, welcoming, and enriching environment. We put people first, celebrate diversity and drive innovation.
We are now looking for a Junior Business Intelligence Specialist to join our Solution Support team in Bucharest to enable the growth we are experiencing.

About Us
Solution Support is a team of highly driven individuals who hold the happiness of our customers dear to our hearts. We currently have team members in Helsinki and Chicago and are now looking for more team members to join us in Bucharest! We offer support to our global customer base with operative issues and questions, as well as design and implement more complex technical functionalities.

Sievo is one of the fastest-growing procurement software companies in the world, however we feel that we have just scratched the surface and want to have an even bigger impact on the market.

We have a passion for data and analytics, enjoy working with customers and helping them solve complex procurement analytics-related problems, possess a certain intellectual curiosity for learning new as well a drive to get things done. We do value getting the work done ‚Äì but also relaxing after. Join us now to have a front-row seat for this great growth adventure!

About You
As a Junior Business Intelligence Specialist, you will
Serve our existing, diverse customer base globally and support all the different solutions we offer
Be the first in line tackling the challenges our customers have, advise them when they have questions about our software, and implement configuration changes to their environments using SQL and Qlik BI tools
Actively communicate with our customers in writing through our customer support software and occasionally participate in customer meetings
Take the initiative to solve the support requests on your own or by cooperating with your teammates, Customer Success Managers, software development teams and directly with customers
Take part in the continuous development of our internal processes and ways-of-working
Work mainly during the daytime, but be available for evening shifts that end at 1 am to offer support for our customers in the Americas

What typically gives a good starting point for a Junior Business Intelligence Specialist?
Understanding of relational databases, SQL or some other programming language, and/or Qlik BI tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Independent working style and taking ownership of what you do
Ability to learn quickly and figure out how to use new software
Strong desire to serve and support customers
Good communication skills
Fluency in English, other language skills are appreciated
Also, basic understanding of the Procurement/Finance context is a plus

What We Offer
A great place to work in downtown Bucharest with a relaxed work environment
A highly international setting with exciting global customers such as Levi‚Äôs, Orkla and Carlsberg, and a group of great people with diverse backgrounds
A company culture that challenges you to exceed and enables you to learn
A caring manager and teammates who will support you in your growth
Freedom and responsibility. We are looking for people who yearn for this freedom, are able to make the most out of it and are willing to take on the responsibility
Awesome perks such as private medical subscription, flexible benefits package, referral bonus, extra 5 days of vacation, and many more!

The pay for this position ranges from 4500 to 5000 RON/net per month. This is a full-time position and offers a great starting point at Sievo for someone with strong analytical skills and a customer service mindset.

How to Apply
We would love to hear from you next!

Send us your CV and motivational letter through our recruitment system. And yes, bonus points for videos :)
The application screening is done on an ongoing basis, and the position will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate has been found. So, if we sparked your interest, don't hesitate to apply already today!


At Sievo, we celebrate and support differences and strive to create a culture where everyone feels valued and included. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against any individual in hiring or employment based on gender, gender identity or expression, age, ethnic or national origin, nationality, language, religion or belief, opinion, disability, state of health, sexual orientation, or other personal reasons."

Akamai Technologies is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. Title:
Data Analyst Sustainability (f/m/d)
Data Analyst Sustainability (f/m/d) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We are Neumann Kaffee Gruppe. And we love coffee.

For us at Neumann Kaffee Gruppe (NKG), everything revolves around coffee. As a globally active green coffee service group, our more than 3,200 employees in over 26 countries work with dedication for and with green coffee, which is always the focus of our services along the entire coffee supply chain. Our fields of work are just as diverse as our employees and we are proud to live this diversity.

Neumann Gruppe GmbH, the Headquaters of Neumann Kaffee Gruppe, is located in Hamburg. At NG, we coordinate the activities of the group and manage overall developments strategically. We also support the work of the group companies with various functional areas, such as Compliance, Controlling, IT, Legal, Tax, Risk Control, HR, and Communications.

Become part of our coffee family and start in our holding company, Neumann Gruppe GmbH, located in Hamburg HafenCity Hamburg as a

Data Analyst Sustainability (f/m/d).

In this role, you'll be an integral part of our sustainability team, serving as the primary liaison for all data analysis pertaining to sustainability and our diligence systems across the Group. If you're ready to tackle significant challenges in a dynamic environment, we'd love to have you on board. This position is initially offered on an 18-month contract.

Exciting tasks are waiting for you

Analyze: Drive sustainability analytics based on a common data platform, including, among others, the development of environmental footprint calculators, as well as data-driven services to create efficiencies in NKGs sustainability programs (NKG Bloom and NKG Verified), as well as partner projects and initiatives to advance sustainability along the coffee value chain.
Design: Combine data, effective visuals, and first-hand narratives to deliver effective dashboards and reports that inform decision making, monitoring and due diligence processes in our sustainability programs.
Innovate: Work closely with internal stakeholders and iterate data strategy to align on latest developments, technologies and processes across the coffee sustainability and traceability domain.
Contribute: Pilot, validate and document models and indexes in order to define epics and user stories that articulate work to be done by engineering to advance the data platform.
Act: Perform validation testing for the data platform (Incl. data integrations, bug fixes, and feature requests).
Guide: Contribute to common data pipelines and catalogue to make data discovery, ordering, and delivery seamless and scalable.
Collaborate: Liaise with internal stakeholders, third-party software and/or data providers to identify and propose promising solutions and data (e. g. computational agronomy, AI & machine learning) that augment value for stakeholders.


This Is What You Can Offer

Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Economics, Business, Statistics, Environmental Science, or a related field.
Background: Proven (good) experience in business intelligence, analytics, and statistical analysis, with a focus on sustainability data management. Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI, as well as statistical software such as R or Python.
Personality: Analytical working style, good communication skills, solution-driven mindset, service mentality and openness to work in a multicultural environment.
Internationality: You demonstrate strong intercultural skills and an excellent command of English; Spanish, Portuguese or German is a plus.
MS Office: You have a good command of the MS Office package, especially Excel. Experience with Microsoft Synapse is a plus.


Our staff appreciates

Scenic workplace: A modern atmosphere in a central location with Elbphilharmonie views awaits you.
Hybrid flexibility: Enjoy flexible working hours and mobile working options with our hybrid models.
Investing in you: Benefit from a ‚Ç¨ 2,000 annual training budget and numerous development opportunities.
Green commuting benefits: We support eco-friendly commutes with Deutschland-Ticket and JobRad subsidies.
Attractive benefits: Access a competitive company pension scheme and discounted lunch offers.
Team connection: Join us for summer parties, Christmas dinners, and coffee lounge chats in our family-like environment.


Have we sparked your interest?

We are pleased to receive your application documents.

Please get in touch with your first point of contact:

Fatma Kuyucuoglu"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
payabl. empowers businesses to grow through payments innovation and banking services. Our ambition is to expand our strong portfolio of global financial services we provide to business and make them all available in one place on our platform we call payabl.one.

As a licensed financial company with principal membership with card schemes, we specialize in global payments and providing businesses with multi-currency accounts. With offices located in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Limassol, and London, we are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. This role can be in one of our offices in Frankfurt, Limassol, Amsterdam, or London, it can also be remote anywhere in Europe.

This role is about: 

The Data Analyst role is responsible for collecting, processing data of business information systems to discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision-making. Furthermore you will identify challenges and opportunities within the organization and provide solutions that help achieve the business' goals. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits. You will be a driving force in data systems development, backing up suggestions with evidence.

You will: 

Analyse data, outlining challenges, opportunities and solutions based on the internal and external data
Filtering the data, handling missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance
Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyze data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends
Create visual representations of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make the data understandable at a glance
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the insights and findings from the data to stakeholders, which can influence policy and decision-making processes
Work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights


What we need:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent at presenting data analysis insights to any type of audience in a clear and actionable way
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in everything you do
Experience working with senior decision makers
Conduct data analysis with Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy), SQL, Excel
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) and databases (PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Apache Druid)
Ability to automate data reports, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in data delivery
Familiarity with tools and software that enable scheduling and automatic generation of reports (e.g., cron jobs, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Power Automate)
Experience with Event Tracking, conceptualizing product events, and product analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Matomo, etc.)


The perks of being a payabler:

üöó Drive in Style: After your probation, a sleek company car is all yours. 
Future-Proof Your Finances: Jump on board, and after your probation period, we'll kickstart your Provident Fund 
üå± Grow Without Limits: Our environment is all about nurturing your talents and fueling your ambition with endless opportunities for professional development. 
Speak Like a Local: Greek language classes, offered twice a week for all team members. 
üí≥ Shop and Save: Get exclusive access to a discount card at various local businesses. 
üåçThrive in a multicultural workplace that celebrates diversity and values your unique contributions. Here, every perspective is appreciated, and every voice is heard. 
 Lead the Charge in Pioneering Projects: Be at the forefront of innovation by playing a key role in groundbreaking projects. 
üèù Max Out Your Downtime: With 25 days off plus public holidays, and an extra 10 days for when you're under the weather, we make sure you have ample time to relax, recharge, and return brighter. 
üìö Support for Your Educational Aspirations: We're here to support your educational pursuits because we believe in investing in your growth. 
üçî Wolt Your Way Through Lunch: Enjoy a Wolt lunch allowance of ‚Ç¨150 per month

Ready to Join Us? 

Let's embark on a journey to redefine the landscape of payments together. We're not just offering a role; we're inviting you to be a part of something bigger. Join our team, and let's innovate, disrupt, and lead the future of payments. Together, we can make an impact that resonates. Welcome to the team!

If this role seems like a good match, please submit your resume all applications are treated with the strictest confidentiality. Please note that we may keep your CV for a period of one (1) year for future relevant job opportunities. For more information about how we process your data please see our privacy policy at https://www.payabl.com/privacy-policy"

Title:
Junior Business Insights and Data Analyst
Junior Business Insights and Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Business Environment

The Customer Support & Services Delivery (CSSD) Business Insights and Analytics is team within Digital and Transformation Organization focused on supporting CSSD Businesses with data, reports and insights to improve Customer experience and drive operational excellence through the right set of actionable metrics to accelerate innovation and transformation, in this case is specifically supporting Customer Care Center Organization.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting, and presenting data to support decision-making and provide insights to the organization. The role works with large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, helping businesses make informed choices and optimize their operations. The role utilizes various tools, techniques, and analytical skills to extract meaningful information from data and communicate their findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Responsibilities

Understanding business requirements, creating reports, analytics and business intelligence
Works with global reporting teams to set up and adapt standard reporting, based on business requirements.
Works together with Customer Care Center teams/internal customers to capture and met business requirements
Create reports and business intelligence to better understand operational performance of our Contact Centers
Provides insight on call drivers and customer satisfaction drivers
Analyze ways to avoid calls by providing solutions on the web
Identifies anomalies in data to enable issue prevention
Optimization and standardization
Identify improvement opportunities

Education & Experience Recommended

Four-year Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Work experience is not required, but appropriate internships related to the job content would be a plus.

Preferred Certifications

Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)

Knowledge And Skills

Data Analysis, Data Management, Data Modeling, Data Quality, Data Science, Data Visualization and Data Warehousing
Using data collection and analysis tools and software packages to gather, integrate and analyze data from multiple sources.
Strong analytical, statistical and problem solving skills.
Understanding of industry quality standards and methodologies.
Using empirical and root- cause analysis, modeling, and testing methodologies to identify areas for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English.
Ability to effectively communicate plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options at different levels.

What We Offer

Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world. 
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP‚Äôs own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning. 
An attractive benefits package:
Health & Life insurance 
Lunch at reduced prices at our canteen/ ticket restaurant vouchers 
HP product discount 
Work life balance / flexible working hours.
Women, Pride, Young employees, Sustainability and DisAbility! Just a few of our fantastic global business networks you can get involved with locally. 
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities, including our onsite HP Charity day.
Do you like to give back to the community? Then join one of our many volunteering teams or be a part of the incredible HP charity day held on site annually. 
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor) with 25+ regular coordinated‚ÄØactivities.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy, and general health.
Printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.
Dedicated lactation room.
Our Women Network organizes activities such as Networking, the promotion of STEM vocations, talks on, improving business acumen, work life balance and skills of the future, etc.

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance

Skills and requirements:

1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
Python/R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

Title:
Junior Data Analyst
Junior Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Are you passionate about data-driven decision-making and enjoy creating visually compelling stories?

Groupon is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who has a knack for uncovering insights through data analysis and translating them into actionable recommendations.

Responsibilities

Develop a deep understanding of our consumers and merchants and how they interact with each other and with our product
Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. 
Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to support business needs. 
Be a partner to business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
Empower the teams across Groupon Operations to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards. 
Lead data-related projects from conception to completion, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery. 

Qualifications

Proficiency in SQL.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Groupon‚Äôs purpose is to build strong communities through thriving small businesses. To learn more about the world‚Äôs largest local ecommerce marketplace, click here. If all of this sounds like something that‚Äôs a great fit for you, then click apply and join us on a mission to become the ultimate destination for local experiences and services.

Beware of Recruitment Fraud: Groupon follows a merit-based recruitment process without charging job seekers any fees. We've noticed an increase in recruitment fraud, including fake job postings and fraudulent interviews and job offers aimed at stealing personal information or money. For legitimate job openings, always check our official careers website at grouponcareers.com."

Title:

"About the job

Experian ist ein globales Daten- und Technologieunternehmen, das Menschen und Unternehmen weltweit neue Chancen er√∂ffnet. Mit unserer einzigartigen Kombination aus Daten, Analytics und Software haben wir uns auch in der DACH-Region als einer der f√ºhrenden Dienstleister f√ºr Risiko-, Fraud- und Identit√§ts-Management etabliert.

Unternehmen aller Gr√∂√üen und Branchen unterst√ºtzen wir, smartere Entscheidungen zu treffen, verantwortungsbewusster Kredite zu vergeben und sich sowie ihre Kunden vor Identit√§tsbetrug und Kriminalit√§t zu sch√ºtzen.

Wir investieren in unsere talentierten Mitarbeitenden sowie in neue, fortschrittliche Technologien, um die Macht der Daten zu nutzen und Innovationen voranzubringen. Wir besch√§ftigen 22.500 Mitarbeitende in 32 L√§ndern und sind ein FTSE 100-Unternehmen, das an der Londoner B√∂rse (EXPN) notiert ist. Unser Hauptsitz befindet sich in Dublin, Irland.

Stellenbeschreibung

Stellenbeschreibung, Sinn / Zweck Der Position

Wir suchen nach einem Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d), um unser Analytics, Consulting and Customer Services Team zu verst√§rken. In dieser Position arbeitest Du an vorderster Front mit, wenn wir unseren Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen mit Daten und Modellen dabei helfen, Kreditrisiken richtig einzusch√§tzen und smarte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Hauptaufgaben, Zust√§ndigkeiten

Title:
DATA ANALYST
DATA ANALYST
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description

This position is remote-friendly.

üßöüèª Our Data team

The Data team at Joko is turning mountains of data into actionable insights for all the teams! The Data team is part of our Operations department led by Quentin, our COO, and our mission is to empower the company to make informed decisions.

More Specifically, The Team's Responsibilities Are

Data for Business: We create top-notch reports and tools, making it easy for teams to dive into data and excel in their decision-making.
Help our stakeholders with the best data stack: We load and transform data, automate reports, and continuously improve our data stack. This allows teams to use valuable insights built on robust and scalable foundations.
Spread the data culture: At Joko, we have a strong engineering and tech culture across all teams, making it an ideal environment for our Data team to have a significant impact. We provide support and training on data tools to our stakeholders, and by closely collaborating with them, we ensure that our solutions align perfectly with their operational needs.

üéØ What You Will Do

As a Data Analyst, you will have a cross-functional role and collaborate closely with teams to understand our data and develop insights.

Deep-dive analyses: You will explore and analyse data to uncover trends, patterns, and potential issues that will help in the decision-making processes across all teams.
Reporting and Data Visualization: You will participate in creating content, such as dashboards and charts, using our data visualization tool. You will be involved in defining the report's content and constructing dashboards and charts to effectively communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders.
Data loading and transformation: You will be involved in loading and transforming the data as we have a ‚Äúfull stack‚Äù approach in Data at Joko. Of course, you will get some help on Data Engineering parts but you will be involved in the entire lifecycle of our data.
Interactions with stakeholders: You will work hand-in-hand with them to understand their needs, collect their feedback, and also evangelize data usage to help them make smarter choices.
Continuous Learning and Improvement: As ""never stop learning"" is one of our values, you will grow along the way and learn how to use analytical methods and the different tools that we use (and will use) in our data stack.

Preferred Experience

Experience: You have 1-3y of professional experience in data analysis (relevant internships can count).
Education: You graduated from an engineering or business school (or equivalent).
Mindset: You have an entrepreneurial mindset, you like challenges, you welcome feedback and you are willing to get better everyday to reach excellence.
Problem-solving & Analytical skills: You love solving complex problems and analyzing data.
Coding knowledge: Mastering SQL and Python is not mandatory, as you can still learn when joining, but it's a plus.
Business acumen: You can understand the needs of your business stakeholders and get the big picture of how the business is running.
Communication: You know how to present your conclusions clearly and synthetically (written and oral).
Languages: You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.

Recruitment Process

15-min call with the Hiring Manager
45-min personality interview with two team members
A case study followed by a 45-min debrief
45-min Founders interview
Reference calls

You might also be invited to meet other team members at the office for a coffee or a drink!

Additional Information

Contract Type: Full-Time
Location: Paris 
Possible full remote"

Title:

Languages and level:

English: Advanced (fluent level will be strongly valuated)

Personal Competencies:

Positive Energy
Process oriented and organized
Analytic mindset, Problem and result Oriented
Team Work 
Proactive
Digital mindset


What do we offer?

A stable company with constant evolution and exciting environment; 
Be part of a multidisciplinary team; 
Stay healthy and active with free gym and paddle courts at the office;
720 ‚Ç¨/month;
Monday to Friday from 8AM to 14PM or from 9AM to 15pm;
Casual and cool dress code;
Perfume Boutique: low-priced perfumes exclusively for our employees; 
Brand new offices in Sant Cugat (just 20 minutes driving from Barcelona city) with free outdoor parking. Ô∏èVery Close to ""Sant Joan"" FGC Train Station."

Title:
Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Marketing Data Analyst (Remote) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!
A little bit about us
Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.
How you will make a difference:
Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability 
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.


Requirements

Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.


Benefits

Perks of being one of us
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work 
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks
Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer
Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!
Location
You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.
If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions."

Title:
FX Data Analyst (Product)
FX Data Analyst (Product)
Job Description:
"About the job
At Kantox, we are looking for a FX Data Analyst (Product) to join our amazing Product Strategy team and help us to make our Clients' dashboards shine, build strong business cases together with our Sales team, and create tools to bring innovation and efficiency in the processes üöÄ

Meet the team: 

Simon - CPO

Andrea - FX Data Analyst Team Lead

Gabriela - FX Data Analyst

Lucas - Senior Product Owner

Ignacio - Product Owner

Laura - Senior Product Designer

Saagar - Product Designer

Mission:

The FX Data Analyst in Kantox blends product development with data analysis, offering a unique position to learn, which means great growth potential and many future opportunities.

The main goals of the role are:

Act as a Product Owner for our clients' Power BI dashboards. We want ALL our clients to have access to dashboards to track the performance and the value of our automation software. You'll formalise the go-to-market strategy, streamline the process, write specifications for the Data and the PowerBi teams, keep stakeholders in the loop, and coordinate the deployment of standard dashboards to as many clients as possible. By understanding clients' needs in detail, you'll also help shape our product development. Post-launch, you'll lead quality checks, train teams, and track usage metrics to ensure everyone gets the most out of our awesome dashboards
Play a key role in the Commercial Team, supporting in the initial phase the creation of business cases, i.e. providing insightful simulations through the internal tool and ad-hoc analyses. You'll collect and preprocess data from prospects, generate simulations, and deliver key KPIs to assess strategy effectiveness. Once you master the simulations, you'll shift focus to training and supporting the Sales team, empowering them to run simulations independently and assisting with the most complex and stimulating cases
Dive into prospects' FX exposure and trading data to deliver game-changing insights and tools for the Sales cycle. You'll exploit your tech skills into powerful tools, with the Bloomberg terminal as your secret weapon for top-notch analysis


Requirements

Must haves: 

Strong academic background in engineering, finance, economics or business administration with a relevant master's degree or similar
Knowledge and interest about trading and/or foreign exchange (FX) products
Proficiency with MS Excel / Google Sheets for data analysis
Basic knowledge of Power BI (or similar) interface and features
Basic SQL queries for data extraction and manipulation
Basic understanding of Python/R syntax and data structures
Proficient in English


Mindset:

Fast learner; you will go through an intensive training program during your onboarding
Tech-appetite!
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Hands-on attitude, very organised and able to meet deadlines


Benefits

What we offer

Competitive salary
Sponsored learning budget
Free private health insurance
Free Spanish, English and French lessons
Relocation package if needed
31 days of annual vacations
Gym discounts and free sports activities
Ticket Restaurant with monthly credit and regular cross-team lunches
Daily fresh fruit and a beautiful office with 360-degree views of Barcelona


Our culture

An environment of innovation, accountability, and constructive feedback
A diverse and multicultural team of over 40 different nationalities
Grow your role and build your career with our learning and development opportunities
A collaborative and inclusive culture of sharing and teamwork. Build connections for life
Hybrid working and flexible hours so you can work when and where you feel best
Some testimonials: ""The culture and the people at Kantox make me want to recommend Kantox as a place to work. There is a good balance between learning and growing and support from fellow team members. I feel like the people are very welcoming and make Kantox an easy place to feel at home."" 


About Kantox

Kantox is a leading fintech company developing sophisticated Currency Management Automation software solutions that help companies to automate their foreign exchange processes and leverage currencies for growth.

We are a 170-person strong team, split between London and Barcelona. So far, we've raised over ‚Ç¨30 million and became profitable in 2018. Thanks to our clients, we continue to grow at a fast pace. Clients in 75 countries have already exchanged more than USD $18 billion with us!

In October 2022, BNP Paribas signed an agreement for the acquisition of Kantox. Kantox will continue to operate as an independent company, now with the experience and market power of BNP Paribas behind it. The acquisition is subject to regulatory approvals and is expected to be completed in the coming months.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Kantox is deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion both in our hiring practices and in our experiences as a Kantox employee.

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and encourage all applicants regardless of race, religion, or belief (if any), color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity, pregnancy and maternity, sexual orientation, age, marital and civil partnership status, or disability status."

Title:
Internship: Service Data Analyst
Internship: Service Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Title
Internship: Service Data Analyst

Job Description

We are seeking a motivated intern to join our Service team in Milan, passionate about data analysis. This role focuses on managing the installed base data and generating insightful reports to support business development within a specific business unit.

Responsibilities:
Maintain and analyze installed base data, including equipment status, contract expiration, and sales opportunities, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Monitor and support automated processes for data updates and change requests, ensuring data accuracy.
Collaborate with customer service teams and sales organization to ensure data quality in SFDC (CRM platform Salesforce.com) and support opportunity management.
Analyze sales opportunities from installed base data and collaborate with the sales team to optimize these opportunities.
Support initiatives to drive growth within a designated business unit through data-driven insights and analysis.

Requirements:
You possess a University background in any engineering field, such as engineering management, data analysis, biomedical engineering, or similar disciplines.
You have advanced Excel skills and feel confident with working with numbers.
You are outgoing, capable of building relationships within a diverse team, and feel comfortable in a dynamic environment.
You are fluent in Italian and can easily communicate in English.

In return we offer you:
A full-time, remunerated, Milan office-based extracurricular internship,
Free lunches in the office's canteen,
Building your career in an international company that brings innovations that matter to you,
Fast-paced oriented work in an international environment.

About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.

 Learn more about our business.
 Discover our rich and exciting history.
 Learn more about our purpose.

If you‚Äôre interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here."

Title:
Business Data Analyst
Business Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
At SwissBorg, our mission is to build a spectrum of investment experiences that help people redefine wealth. Our app has over 790,000+ verified users, offering the best price and liquidity across 16 fiat currencies to buy 90+ cryptocurrencies. Users can earn yield, diversify their portfolios with our themed crypto bundles, and gain access to exclusive alpha investment opportunities. Our community is rapidly expanding, with more than $1.4 billion in assets held in the app and over 51,000 premium users.

Join us in shaping the future of finance, pushing the boundaries of what's possible, and transforming the way people manage their wealth. Whether you‚Äôre in Austria or Taiwan, and whether your portfolio is worth one dollar or a million, SwissBorg provides the best tools to learn about digital currencies and manage your wealth effectively.

Join the team to help revolutionise the world together!

We are seeking a talented and driven Business Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategies and driving growth.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of decision-making, unlocking valuable insights from data and transforming them into actionable recommendations. If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making, problem-solving, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!

What you might be doing:


Identify Business Opportunities: Take the lead in exploring new business opportunities for our products and services. Utilise your analytical skills to generate hypotheses and assess the potential benefits of each opportunity, providing valuable insights and driving strategic decisions
App User Activity Analysis: Dive deep into user activity within our app to uncover meaningful patterns, correlations, or bottlenecks. Your keen eye for detail will be essential in identifying areas for improvement and optimising user experiences
Data-Driven Insights: Leverage various data analysis techniques to transform raw data into actionable insights. Your ability to draw meaningful conclusions will be instrumental in guiding the company towards growth and success
Collaboration and Implementation: Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement and measure the impact of the most promising opportunities. Your role as a liaison between the data team and business squads will be essential in ensuring seamless communication and execution
Data Ambassador: Be the primary point of contact and ambassador for the data team within specific business squads. Your expertise will play a crucial role in aligning data-related objectives with overall business goals
Continuous Learning: Exhibit a hunger for knowledge and continuously strive to ask relevant and insightful questions. Embrace new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis processes




What you might bring:


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of delivering data-driven insights to influence business decisions
Excellent communication and presentation abilities to convey data insights in a clear and understandable manner
Proficiency in SQL 
Experience with data analysis in Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib) 
Experience with statistics (A/B testing, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing) is a plus
Ability to collect, organise, and analyse large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to detail. 
Independent and proactive, have the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment




Why you should apply: 


 Freedom to build the company of your dreams
 Learn with (super cool) experts in finance, engineering, AI, psychology and business
 BORG bonus based on our meritocratic system
 Flexible working hours
 25 working days of vacation + local holidays
 We'll provide you with a MacBook and a cutting edge tech stack to help you do your best work
 Annual company and team retreats - We'd love to see you at the next one!
 Continuous learning and development opportunities




If our job description speaks to you, but you don‚Äôt feel like you meet 100% of the requirements, apply anyway! You may have skills we didn‚Äôt even know we needed.

At SwissBorg, we embrace diversity. We strongly believe that getting the best outcome requires different perspectives and backgrounds. We‚Äôre committed to openness, curiosity and creating an inclusive culture because we know that diverse teams build better products and generate better ideas. We strongly encourage applications from everyone!

Familiarising yourself with our product is crucial for anyone looking to join our team. Please make sure to test the app, explore our blog for the latest developments, and follow our Careers Page, LinkedIn, and X for regular company updates!"

Title:
SQL Data Analyst
SQL Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Title: SQL Data Analyst/Developer
Years of experience needed ‚Äì 5+ Years 
Location: Barcelona, Spain.( Hybrid)
Type: Fulltime role

Job Description:
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.
 The key elements resource should have:
SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.
 Technical Skills: 
SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines
 Certifications Needed: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.
 "

Title:
Senior Data Analyst
Senior Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
ü™ê Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

‚ú® Malt is also‚Ä¶

 a tech company with a human approach
 a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
 committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
 committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
 a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
 backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France



Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! ü™ê

At Malt we believe that Ambition is the Way, so all lists of missions and responsibilities are non-exhaustive.

Explore your future career üî≠

You would be part of Malt‚Äôs data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ‚ú®

Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product 
Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations 
Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards. 
Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers 
Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt



About You üßë‚ÄçüöÄ

You have a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting‚Ä¶) 
You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you‚Äôve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts‚Ä¶ You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau‚Ä¶)
You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
You are fluent in English
You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow



What makes you different from others? ü´µ

You have good business acumen, but you also have a ‚Äúhacker‚Äù mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems 
You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player



How to join the mission? üöÄ

Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h) 
Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)



Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally üí´

 Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you‚Äôll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
 Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
 Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): ‚Ç¨9/day on your Swile card
 Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
 Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
 RTT: From 8 to 12 days off per year
 Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
 Malt sabbatical: Every three years, all Malters are entitled to a one month fully paid sabbatical leave
 Free books: If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt‚Äôs business, just tell us the books you‚Äôd like to read, and we‚Äôll order them for you‚Äîwithout any questions asked or approval processes to follow
 Remote work: Hybrid policy balancing on-site and home office
 Team building events organized every year



Ready? Get your ticket to Malt ü™ê"

Title:
Quality Data Analyst
Quality Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI 
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people! 

WHY JOIN US 
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with: 
*Canteen.
*Flexible working hours.
*On-site health clinic.
*Remote Working.
*Employee benefits.

DRIVE YOUR FUTURE 
Within the Quality team, the Quality Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing quality data and supporting quality improvement & innovation. He/she will have the opportunity to gain an overview from both a business and an industrial perspective, with the main aim of driving continuous improvement.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES 
*Acquire, filter and analyze the data from various data sources with methodic approach and with the aim of optimize efficiency and quality in the process.
*Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and prevent recurrence.
*Develop and implement quality standards and specific project for Quality, digital-oriented.
*Conduct analysis and evaluation of existing manufacturing processes, identifying areas for improvement and recommending appropriate solutions.
*Monitor and analyze process performance metrics and develop strategies to meet or exceed targets.
*Identify and implement process control measures, including statistical process control (SPC) techniques, to ensure consistent quality and reduce process variation.
*Perform process capability studies, statistical analysis and data-driven decision-making to achieve operational excellence and meet quality targets

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
*Master's Degree.
*Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve quality issues effectively.
*Good knowledge of English and Italian.
*Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques for quality improvement.
*Technical tools knowledge: JMP, Mathlab, MS Project.

WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION 
*Data-driven mindset and approach.
*Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
*Detail-oriented with good organizational and time management skills.

APPLY NOW, DRIVE YOUR FUTURE!
#WePirelli"

Title:

Platte Organisatie: Geniet van directe en duidelijke communicatie.

Contract: Een vaste rol binnen een vooruitstrevend team.

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring.

Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
HBO werk- en denkniveau.

Ge√Ønteresseerd?
Ben je klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je deel uitmaken van een vooruitstrevend team? Solliciteer nu bij Tremoot! We kijken ernaar uit om je aan boord te verwelkomen en zien uit naar jouw bijdrage aan onze gemeenschap!"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification

SQL Data Analyst
SQL Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
SQL Data Analyst/Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.
The key elements resource should have:
SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

Technical Skills: 
SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

Certifications Needed: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus."

Title:
Graduate Data Analyst
Graduate Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job


Descripci√≥n 





 Calling all Graduates! Are you looking for an opportunity to kickstart your career with industry leading training and mentoring? If so, then look no further‚Ä¶

We‚Äôre looking for Graduate Business Data Analysts to join our two-year Graduate programme, giving you experience working in a FTSE 100 listed software company.

Everything we do at Sage is designed to help business flow, to help business‚Äô make decisions faster and more accurate. As part of this, we rely on our team of experts to create, develop and maintain industry leading products. And that‚Äôs where you come in!

We‚Äôre on the hunt for our future top talent who can bring their skills and expertise to continue to drive us forward.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Data is at the heart of everything that Sage does, and the BI and Analytics Hub works horizontally across Sage to make sure we use data and insight to deliver our purpose to knock down barriers and create connections and opportunities for customers and colleagues. The BI and Analytics Hub supports designated teams to become a franchise, enabling them to produce value-driven data products, enhancing Sage‚Äôs capabilities in business intelligence and analytics to advance Sage‚Äôs overall data strategy.

You will work closely with a wide range of stakeholders to define and translate business needs in to project and data requirements. You‚Äôll perform data analysis and create visualisations using data storytelling techniques, using your skills to contribute to various success factors such as revenue and cost reduction, productivity savings, reduction of risk and contribution to our ESG agenda.

Throughout the 2-year Graduate programme and your career at Sage, we want you to be enthusiastic about your personal development, and continuously learn new things to strive for excellence. We expect a lot from our Graduates and will encourage you to bring innovative ideas to add real value for our customers, in an environment where ambition for future progression is rewarded.

 Responsabilidades principales  What are we looking for?

You‚Äôll need to be a Graduate, and whilst we‚Äôre open to any degree discipline, you‚Äôll need to be business minded, ideally with project management or process improvement understanding.

Alongside this, you‚Äôll also have

 A keen eye for detail and an inquisitive mind to help problem solve.
 You‚Äôll be resilient and determined, able to work in a fast paced, changing environment.
 As part of a global business, you‚Äôll be an effective communicator, able to collaborate with people from across the world.
 Adept at requirement gathering and the ability to collect, organise and disseminate large amounts of data.
 Able to present data and explain complex analyses in a clear manner.





These roles are based in Barcelona. You‚Äôll be in the office at least 2 days a week so will need to live in (or be willing to relocate to) an easily commutable distance.

Why you would love to join us?

 Great salary and performance annual bonus
 We take great pride in offering a comprehensive and structured development program, which includes engaging weekly training sessions designed for our Sage Ignite graduates.
 Diverse and Inclusive Work Environment, at Sage we are proud in encouraging a collaborative and inclusive workplace that celebrates diversity. Our Barcelona office is a vibrant multicultural environment, representing over 23 nationalities.
 We offer work-away program where employees have the chance to work from various locations around the world, this benefit is great way to enhance your professional experience and promote a global mindset.
 Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and technologies.
 Community: Make a difference to communities we live and work in, with your 5 volunteer days every year. How we are making a difference





https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/sage-foundation/

 Continuous Development: Unlimited access to Linkedin Learning and Sage University.





Career Growth: Long-term prospects for a professional career. Access to Talent Marketplace, an internal system that uses artificial intelligence to create a clear path for growth.

 Brand office space, locates at the heart of Barcelona‚Äôs 22@tech district, with great transport links.
 Reduced working hours on Fridays and in the summer (July and August).
 Flexible benefits that suit your needs.





What you can expect from the process:

 Apply online with CV
 Complete screening and video interview (You will receive a link to complete a video interview from the Outmatch platform)
 If successful at video interview stage, you will be invited to attend an assessment centre in the summer (the first week of September).
 Successful candidates will join us on 1 October 2024





Please note that due to the high volume of applications, there will be a delay in receiving a response from your video interview. We thank you for your patience.

Here at Sage, we are committed to inclusivity for all, so if there any adjustments that would help you thrive in the application process or beyond, please reach out to us at earlycareers@sage.com

Apply today!"

Title:
Interim Data Analyst
Interim Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Camino Search is partnering with a mid-market backed private equity backed technology business. The company is undertaking a strategic data project in collaboration with an external data consulting firm. We need a coordinator to liaise between the data consultants and the company's stakeholders, ensuring effective communication and collaboration. 

Key Responsibilities
Acting as a data partner to management to advise on strategic decisions using data
Become the go to expert on the cloud data platform
Collaborate with different functional teams (Finance, Sales, Product) to ensure data in the system accurately reflects the business
Maintain and enrich the data that lives in this system to ensure a high level of quality of information is available to management
Build out new re-usable data pipelines (SQL), management reporting (PowerBI/ ad hoc presentations)

Core Skillset
Strong analytical profile: An ability to dissect business problems through analysis end-to-end, i.e. to define an approach, execute it, and critically analyse its results. A general aptitude for numbers and data.
Solid technical foundation: strong SQL coding experience is a must, Azure or other cloud experience is nice
Finance experience: experience working with B2B SAAS metrics
Business acumen and commercial communication: Having a good sense for how technical aspects result in business impacts and the ability to communicate this effectively in non-technical language
Collaboration and team work: An ability to work in small, fast-paced teams engaging with many different stakeholders
An entrepreneurial mindset: the business is a fast growing technology company and as such is suited to someone with an entrepreneurial mindset."

Title:
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Job Description:
"About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? Join our team as a Junior Power BI Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge BI tools, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to innovative projects that shape our business strategy. If you are eager to grow your career in data analytics and possess a keen eye for detail, we invite you to be part of our forward-thinking team. Unleash your potential and help us unlock the power of data!

Responsibilities:

Design dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and build business intelligence reports according to the needs.

Clean and ensure accuracy and integrity of data; review data for inconsistencies or anomalies.

Maintain dashboards to identify reporting issues or gaps and drive timely resolution.

Prepare clear and concise reports.

Development, optimization, and support of existing analytical reports.

Identify opportunities for improvements.

Implement the best practices in collaboration with other team members.

Requirements:

Strong data visualization (experience with Power BI or similar tools) and presentation skills.

Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.

Excel knowledge (incl. pivot tables, dashboard creation).

Ability to work with large volumes of data; extrapolate conclusions from a variety of data sources, both quantitative and qualitative.

Strong DAX & SQL knowledge, Python will be an advantage.

English proficiency (Upper Intermediate or higher)"

Title:
Traineeship Data & Analytics
Traineeship Data & Analytics
Job Description:
"About the job
Als Trainee Data Consultant word je klaargestoomd van Junior Consultant tot Consultant binnen ons Data & Analytics team. Deze rol is geschikt voor jou als je graag met data aan de slag gaat.

 Verantwoordelijkheden

Als Junior Data Consultant maak je de data van toonaangevende opdrachtgevers waardevol. Jij helpt klanten om tot nieuwe inzichten te komen door data te modelleren en te visualiseren. Je maakt datamodellen met behulp van moderne tooling als Databricks & Azure Synapse Analytics, of je past AI of Machine Learning toe om voorspellende inzichten te geven. Je werkt tijdens dit proces nauw samen met de klant en jouw collega‚Äôs.

In onze open werkcultuur krijg je de kans om Data Engineering en Data Science te combineren met de zachtere skills die bij consultancy passen. Als echte data-fanaat kun jij de brug vormen tussen bedrijfsprocessen en data door ze overzichtelijk en waardevol te maken voor de klant met behulp van Data Science en Dashboarding.

Vanaf jouw eerste dag ga je aan de slag met state-of-the-art tooling. Omdat je werkt op projecten bij verschillende bedrijven, krijg je vaak met nieuwe mensen en met nieuwe tools te maken. Hierdoor blijf je je constant ontwikkelen en is jouw leercurve zo steil als jij zelf wilt.

Wat wij zoeken

Je bent begin 2025 beschikbaar voor dit traineeship;
Je hebt een afgeronde masteropleiding (bij voorkeur een b√®tarichting);
Je hebt interesse in technologie en blijft graag op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen;
Het liefst heb je ervaring met 1 of meerdere programmeertalen als Python, R, SQL etc;
Je bent proactief en ziet overal kansen om organisaties meer data-driven te maken;
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.

 Wat bieden we 

Dynamische werkomgeving: Een dynamisch werkomgeving die voortdurend leert en verandert
Levendige cultuur: Een levendige cultuur met maandelijkse leuke en sportieve evenementen
Uitgebreid trainingsprogramma: Een uitgebreid trainingsprogramma ter ondersteuning van jouw professionele groei en ontwikkeling
Vitaliteitsprogramma: Een vitaliteitsprogramma en fietsplan voor jouw welzijn, om actief en gezond te blijven
Emixa connect: Jong en jong van hart: Een gemeenschap die samenwerking, creativiteit en jeugdige spirit van de werkplek bevordert

 Over Emixa 

Ontdek het domein van digitale transformatie met Emixa, een bedrijf dat ervaren is in het stimuleren van innovatie en vooruitgang. Met een team van 530 professionals streven we ernaar om de maakindustrie naar nieuwe hoogten te tillen. We bieden een holistische benadering aan onze klanten om hun organisatie te versterken. Van gestandaardiseerde implementaties tot op maat gemaakt advies via managementconsultancy en het gebruik van unieke oplossingen zoals low-code. Sluit je aan bij ons op onze reis naar het worden van een toonaangevend adviesbureau in ons vakgebied.

Sollicitatieproces & contact

Het sollicitatieproces begint met een telefonische of online kennismaking. Daarna nodigen we je uit op kantoor voor een sollicitatiegesprek. Soms vragen we je een case of assessment te doen, waarna we bij een wederzijdse match een mooi aanbod doen."

Title:

(Junior) Data Analyst Geomarketing with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description

The purpose of the role is to manage a substantial amount of data, perform data preparation, statistical analysis and quality checks to update the GfK Geomarketing regional market data product portfolio and visualize regional data. GfK GeoMarketing provides regional data such as purchasing power or other socio-demographic data on granular level.
