Intitul√© du poste

PV Performance Data Analyst

Contrat

CDI

Temps de travail

Temps complet

Description De La Mission

Bouygues Energies and Services is a small branch within the Equans France and we specialize in energy and, more broadly, in electrical engineering for renewable energies. Our job is to design, build and maintain photovoltaic power plants such as shading systems and solar power plants, which can be on land or floating.

Equans France, in general, designs, installs, maintains, and operates technical systems and customized services in over 30 countries. These services enable customers to combine control over their energy consumption with quality of life and working conditions for their users.

Among the 27 000+ employees that are accompanying Equans France on its adventure, 550 of them is supporting the Energy Business of Bouygues Energies & Services.

New job opportunity : Equans Solar & Storage is hiring :

?? The PV Performance Data Analyst is a member of BYES International O&M team managing ca.1GWp of utility scale solar PV power plants. ??

? He/she will be an integral person in the day-to-day operation of solar farms, including assessing the performance of the solar farms, analysing operation data with a view to extract actionable insights, real-time monitoring when required and troubleshooting technical issues with the generating assets when required. ?

Title:
Data Research Analyst
Data Research Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Role

Our EMEA Data Team is looking for a Data Research Analyst to process our data across global markets. We are a team of data analysts who have effective relationships with other teams and are committed to deliver best quality data. As a Data Research Analyst in the Data Division, you will work closely with the Global Data Team and Local Business Representatives, taking responsibility for data coverage, quality, and timeliness to the highest standards. The Operation Data Analyst will form closer links with providers related to data acquisition processes and gain knowledge of our database. The position will be based in our Data and Development Center EMEA in Madrid.

Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with the global data teams
Data expert on investment data points, processes, methodologies, calculations & different fund structures
Manage business relationships with fund companies. Connecting with providers & setting up acquisition channels as well as acting as a point of escalation
Meet the predetermined production deadlines for internal and external clients
Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects.
Utilize project management methodologies such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues.
Collect and maintain Morningstar data, ensuring high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage.
Demonstrate a high sense of ownership of the issues in the data ticket queue to be responsive and provide timely updates, follow-up, expedition, and resolution.
Understand roles, responsibilities, and expertise of internal partners to expedite issue resolution.
Translate requests from internal clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.
Improve and document client use cases to ensure any new functionality meets and exceeds client expectations


Requirements

A bachelor's degree or equivalent is required
Proficient oral and written communication skills. 
Collaborates well in a team environment, have the ability to communicate and work with team members from diverse backgrounds, in a conscientious and inclusive way.
Sensitive to clients' needs
Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills, capable of handling high volumes of data and meeting strict deadlines
You will be collaborating with cross functional teams and leading from the front when it comes to Operational data, Performance data, etc, so experience within data methodology/quality and processes is a big bonus.
Previous experience in project management is preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel


Hybrid Work

Morningstar's hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. We've found that we're at our best when we're purposely together on a regular basis, at least three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you'll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

Albourne is a global financial services group of companies. Our objective is to advise our clients to be the best investors they can be. The company‚Äôs main areas of focus are fund research, portfolio and risk advice, FinTech and implementation. The Nicosia office opened in 1998 and it provides back office and IT services to the regulated companies of the Albourne group; it currently has over 300 dynamic employees and we are looking to have more to join our teams across various functions.

Role in Brief

You‚Äôll join a fantastic team that will provide the foundational structure to learn about the business and you will interact with numerous departments across the company. The role was previously pure data entry but has since evolved. As you learn and develop within the job, you will have the opportunity to get involved in other areas.

Insights to the Role

Processing of fund data and other information into Albourne‚Äôs proprietary database on an ongoing basis. Liaising with fund managers and third-party service providers to verify accuracy of information
Data scraping of information into excel-based reports
Answering internal and external queries related to fund data
Checking and importing data into the database which feeds into another teams‚Äô workflow

Who You Are

You should be fluent in spoken and written English
You could be a fresh graduate with a university degree in finance, economics, mathematics, or equivalent subject area
You could already be a working professional, with a minimum of two years‚Äô experience under your belt, working in a related field
You are comfortable working in a big team; able to communicate effectively and balance multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment
You are eager to learn and possess impeccable attention to detail

What We Offer

Support for professional qualifications (such as CFA and CAIA)
Career growth and tools for ongoing learning and development
Medical insurance for you and your dependents
Provident fund
Yearly bonus dependent upon performance and company growth
Opportunity for international travel (i.e., short periods of secondment to other Albourne offices)
5 additional service recognition holidays in surplus to standard annual leave
Albourne Training Days (minimum of 40 hours per year)
Free office parking

What You‚Äôll Enjoy

A supportive, multi-cultural work environment
Freedom to work independently, problem-solve and come up with creative solutions to complete tasks within required deadlines
Explore different roles within Albourne after you master your current role. There are excellent opportunities for horizontal and vertical career progression
Open plan office equipped with kitchen facilities and communal entertainment area
Fun social activities
Charity Day ‚Äì a day in the year to work on a cause you are passionate about
We are supportive of fitness, mental health and wellness; implementing company-wide sessions for people to partake in activities related to these areas
Albourne embraces diversity and equal opportunity for all its employees.
We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of cultural backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Successful candidates would be required to comply with the terms of Albourne‚Äôs compliance manuals and procedures.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted"

Title:
Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Job Description:
"About the job
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:

Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights. 
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations. 
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings. 
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments. 
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis. 
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued. 
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous. 
Some initial industry experience is a big plus. 

Your Contribution:

Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes. 
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights. 
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making. 
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges. 
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis. 
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations. 

Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Step into the future of fintech with Brite Payments! As our next Data Analyst, you'll play a pivotal role in advancing our innovative payment solutions through expert data analysis. Join our dynamic team in Stockholm, where your expertise will drive the evolution of Open Banking and A2A transactions. Your impact starts on day one, driving change in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

About Brite 
Brite Payments is a leading Open Banking-powered Account to Account (A2A) payment provider of Instant Payments and Instant Payouts. We provide a convenient transaction experience for consumers and reduce the risk in the payment process for merchants. Founded in Stockholm in 2019, Brite is committed to providing the best possible payment solution for everyone involved in a transaction.

The team behind Brite has worked with launching the first-generation of fintech companies before founding Brite. We know the market landscape, technologies, opportunities, and challenges. Now we channel all those experiences into developing modern solutions that will benefit both merchants and end-users.

Want to join us on our journey? The future is brite!
 What You Will Do:
As a Data Analyst at Brite, you will take on the essential role of Finance Data Steward, overseeing the development and maintenance of our Finance Data Warehouse reporting to the CFO. You will also collaborate with colleagues from various departments within Brite‚Äôs Virtual Data Team, to enhance Bri+te‚Äôs data handling and reporting capabilities. Your responsibilities will include:
Develop reports towards different stakeholders to boost our analytical capabilities and support decision-making processes.
Serving as the Finance representative, you will address data and process requirements for the introduction of new products and markets.
Conducting investigations into potential errors in various system-generated jobs.
Taking charge of regulatory reporting to both Swedish and international authorities, ensuring compliance and accuracy.
Responding to ad-hoc requests from a diverse range of stakeholders, providing critical data insights on finance-related topics.

Are You a Brite Mind?
We are seeking a brite mind who possesses the ability to operate independently, yet demonstrating exceptional stakeholder management skills, a proactive can-do attitude, and the ability to foster collaboration across different teams and departments. The ideal candidate will have:
University degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field.
Work experience as a Data Analyst or in a comparable role, with experience in a regulated industry being a plus.
Experience of working with large and diverse datasets
Strong SQL and Excel skills, along with data modeling capabilities; experience with DBT is a significant plus.
Proficiency in using dashboarding tools such as Tableau, Qlik, or Looker.
Excellent writing and communication skills in English
Interest in working with data across different dimensions, such as commercial, financials, operational dimensions.
Robust understanding of finance processes and at least basic knowledge of accounting principles.
Summer is here and vacation time has begun! This means our response time may be slightly longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and look forward to assisting you as soon as possible. Have a great summer!
What we offer
An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself
A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment where you will have the possibility to make an impact from your first day onwards
A flat organization, friendly colleagues, and fast decision-making
An environment where we start small and learn fast to do big things
A team that cares about sharing, collaborative work, and prestigelessness
... and you will be part of a growing team of fun and skilled people ‚ú®
 Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.

For this position, we are looking for someone who is currently located in/close to Stockholm."

Title:
Data Analyst | SQL
Data Analyst | SQL
Job Description:
"About the job
Discover TECKNOWORKS

TECKNOWORKS is a global technology consulting firm dedicated to optimizing client productivity and profitability. We empower businesses, from mid-sized enterprises to international corporations, with innovative tech solutions.

At TECKNOWORKS, we foster a culture of impact, enabling clients to excel through technology and innovation in their business and personal lives. Our commitment to team growth, risk-taking, and unwavering quality sets us apart, making us a company of excellence delivering exceptional results.

Job Overview:

We are actively seeking an experienced and highly motivated Data Analyst to contribute to our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst with a specialized focus on SQL and Snowflake, you will be instrumental in shaping data strategy, uncovering insights, and guiding critical business decisions. If you possess a strong background in data analysis, along with expertise in SQL and Snowflake, and are passionate about making data-driven decisions, we encourage you to apply.

Working hours: EST Time zone | 15:00 -23:00 Romania time

Requirements

 Collaborate with stakeholders to comprehend data sources, business objectives, and analysis requirements
 Prepare and cleanse data to ensure it is accurate, complete, and ready for analysis
 Apply your knowledge of healthcare analytics to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to improve healthcare outcomes
 Utilize your strong SQL skills to query and manipulate data effectively, creating reports and dashboards as needed
 Perform ad-hoc analyses on various datasets, contributing to informed decision-making processes
 Design and implement custom analytical solutions tailored to business needs and challenges
 Approach data with a critical and problem-solving mindset, identifying process improvement and optimization opportunities
 Handle and analyze large datasets efficiently, using tools like Snowflake to extract valuable information
 Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings and insights effectively


Key Skillset Required:

 Proven experience as a Data Analyst with a focus on SQL and Snowflake
 Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and manipulating datasets
 Experience in healthcare analytics is highly desirable
 Ability to perform ad-hoc analyses and design custom analytical solutions
 Proficient in handling and analyzing large datasets using Snowflake or similar tools
 Excellent data visualization skills

If you are enthusiastic about leveraging your SQL and Snowflake expertise to drive data strategies and contribute to informed decision-making, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Data Analyst (Mandatory Internship)
Data Analyst (Mandatory Internship)
Job Description:
"About the job
Overview

Bella & Bona is a food-tech business offering a workplace food program that office workers love and look forward to every day.

We're looking for talented and driven people who want to advance their careers and help us scale our business across Munich, Berlin, and Frankfurt!

Get exposure to a fast-growing start-up environment
Enjoy our delicious food at lunch
Join a fun and dynamic work environment

Your mission

Are you curious by nature and passionate about data, analytics, and digital marketing? We are looking for a rock-star Data Analyst Intern, who will offer analysis and insights to help us acquire customers at scale. As a Data Analyst Intern, you will help streamline and maintain reporting, data analysis deliverables, pipeline, and processes. You will extensively interact with other teams such as Sales, Sales Operations, Product, and Finance. Your input will help shape business decisions and marketing budget investments.

As a Data Science Intern at Bella & Bona you will:

Use data analysis and machine learning techniques to assist business processes
Perform analysis on user engagement 
Leverage data through SQL to understand and identify areas of growth for in-depth paid marketing channel performance across different regions and countries
Come up with your own projects identifying ways to improve sales 
Engage with stakeholders to understand business requirements
Create reports/dashboards to communicate your suggestions to other teams
Extract and analyze data to interpret the impact of tests on marketing performance (e.g. number of leads, cost per acquisition, pipeline growth, ROI) 
Forecast sales and dishes consumption
Create reports/dashboards using BI tools like Tableau by compiling data from different platforms (Hubspot, Google Analytics, etc.)

Your profile

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Maths, Physics, Business Information Systems, Statistics, or a similar field
Proficiency in data analysis and/or machine learning using programming languages (preferably Python or R)
Familiarity with query languages (SQL) and data visualization tools (like Matplotlib or Tableau)
Understanding of statistical concepts and experience with data modeling and statistical analysis 
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment
Likes to be challenged and is comfortable in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Fluent in English is required, additional languages are considered a plus

Why us?

Get exposure to a fast-growing start-up environment
Enjoy our delicious food at lunch
Join a fun and dynamic work environment

Bella & Bona's Team Culture

Result-oriented, Mission-Driven, and focused on the long term: we iterate fast in the short term, we are collectively focused on turning B&B into a Unicorn
Being a strong team player: we win as one global team and support each other in every case 
Positive, proactive, can-do, and ""no-bullshit"" attitude 
High level of energy and reliability to deliver in a fast-paced environment - this is not a slow 9/5 corporate environment. We focus on building an exceptional culture while remaining a very high-performance company. 
Willingness to learn, adapt, grow, and rolling up your sleeves: a continuous improvement mindset. We do in a month what other companies do in a year 
Strong customer-centricity: our mission is to leverage technology to delight office workers with healthy, delicious, and convenient meals

About Us

Bella & Bona venture-capital-backed food-tech business offering a workplace food program that office workers love and look forward to every day.

Our scalable dark kitchen operations and investments in data and technology automation allow to consistently deliver high-quality food, optimize health and nutritional values, while lowering cost, and considerably reducing food waste and CO2 emissions.

The company raised in January 2020 a $3 million round led by Plug and Play, with additional funding from Rovagnati, Ambrosi, and other investors with a strong entrepreneurial background (former or current Mckinsey, Google, Auto1, BCG, JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, Rocket Internet, Foodora).

We're looking for talented colleagues who want to advance their careers and help scale our business across Munich, Berlin, and Frankfurt!"

"About the job
Be a part of a revolutionary change

Times are changing at PMI. We‚Äôve chosen to do something big. The world expects us to act responsibly. And we are doing just that by transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose ‚Äì to deliver a smoke-free future.

This transformation will revolutionize every area of our business. The products we sell. Where we sell them. How they‚Äôre manufactured and delivered. The way we talk to our customers and engage with society.

It‚Äôs the perfect setting place to start your career. As you take your first steps, you‚Äôll have the backing of a multinational business combined with the freedom of a start-up. You‚Äôll bring a positive mindset and fresh perspective to projects that can make a huge difference to so many.

About The BRIDGE Program

You will be a part of the PMI‚Äôs family during your 6+6 months long, full-time internship. During the program you will perceive monthly scholarship of 944‚Ç¨ (gross salary). You will have the opportunity to benefit from the fully paid online Master, validated and recognized by Universidad Camilo Jose Cela and Fundaci√≥n Universitaria y de Empresa.

Who we‚Äôre looking for


 A recent degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Econometrics, Mathematics in Finance or similar.
 Working fluency in Spanish and English (C1 level and above).
 Advanced level of MS Office programs, Power BI is a plus. Ability to learn new programs quickly.
 Strong numerical, analytical and communication skills.
 You have a flair for creativity and are ready to bring and share your ideas to solve problems creatively.
 You have outstanding time management skills.
 EU Work permit.


Responsibilities

You will join Finance department to support diverse functions within the company. The team works closely with other teams across the world, among other local activities, our main objective is to act as a business partner providing financial guidance:

As a Finance Data Analyst Intern you will support the team in:


 Implementation of new budgeting processes
 Coordinate financial budget data gathering, tracking and summary with Regional Managers
 Actively monitor actuals performance vs forecast
 KPIs tracking and reporting aiming to give clear and comprehensive view of the expenses and headcount.
 Create reports in visualized formats through different tools (SAP, Power BI, Excel, etc)
 Prepare ad hoc analysis to support decision making in any other financial task.


Our success depends on the men and women who come to work every day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:


 Seize the freedom to shape your future and ours. We‚Äôll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
 Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone‚Äôs contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world‚Äôs best people and feel like you belong.
 Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business ‚Äìour staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
 Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future."

Title:
Data Quality - Internship
Data Quality - Internship with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
What's the role?

Within the Channel Department we are looking for a Data Quality Intern who can hit the ground running in a fast-paced, high-performing, international working culture.

Who is Hilti?

Hilti is where innovation is improving productivity, safety and sustainability in the global construction industry, and beyond. Where strong customer relationships are creating solutions that build a better future. Where there is pride and a sense of belonging across our 120 locations, carrying right into our lives and homes. Where people are exploring possibilities, leveraging their potential, owning their personal development and growing lasting careers.

What does the role involve?

You will support the Data Quality team in:

 Identifying and solving problems with data to deliver value 
 Creating and managing databases to ensure accuracy and reliability of customer‚Äôs data 
 Improving data quality and seizing new business opportunities by optimizing the process of sharing information with internal and external stakeholders through distribution lists in Access 
 Crafting data management-oriented solutions for specific activities: data quality controls, data integration, reporting to name a few 


At Hilti, you'll enjoy all the perks of being part of a big company, but with the autonomy of running a small business.

What do we offer?

You will join a structured training agenda which will allow you to carry out your daily tasks but also to discover many other relevant topics and activities such as: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI); Compensation&Benefits; Brand Identity; Trying our tools under the guidance of our trainers; During your internship, you will have scheduled touch points with your tutor.

We will provide you a monthly expense reimbursement (900‚Ç¨) ticket restaurant (7,20/day) Smart-working for 50% of your working time and flexible hours.

What you need is:

You are a data enthusiast and digital native with a passion for data analysis You are currently pursuing a degree/degree holder in Economics, Mathematics or Statistics You have a business and analytic background If you master the main IT tools such as Access, CRM, Excel is a plus You are proficient in Italian and English

Why should you apply?

We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative, more productive team. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork, ability and competitive drive."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Senior Data Analyst B2C
Senior Data Analyst B2C
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description:

Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)
Start date: ASAP
Languages: English is mandatory; French is a plus
Our client: Cloud Computing / Distributed Systems / AI - European Saas


Objectives of this Role:

Analyze and interpret market and user data to drive business decisions and improve product offerings.
Develop and maintain robust data architecture for efficient data processing and analysis.
Present data insights in a clear, actionable manner to stakeholders across the company.
Understand and navigate the complexities of app marketing and related data restrictions.
Support product development and commercial objectives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.


Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and manage backend data architecture to support analytics and reporting needs.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights about user behavior, product performance and growth roadmaps.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data in an understandable and actionable way.
Collaborate with product, business, engineering and management teams to align data initiatives with company goals.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data science, nalytics, and B2C app marketing and educate stakeholders on best practices.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices in data handling.
Augment the company with relevant Ai toolings to grow and scale with data insights.


Skills and Qualifications:

8+ years of proven working experience in data science, analytics, or a related field in tech/ cloud/ software domain.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Mixpanel, Domo or similar.
Solid understanding of backend data architecture and database management.
Ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear, concise manner.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills.
Excellent communication skills with proficiency in English.


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the B2C app companies, particularly with user data analysis.
Commercial acumen and the ability to align data insights with business objectives.
Understanding of app marketing strategies and associated data restrictions.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application in business contexts.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Fluency in AI-powered toolings to optimize productivity and efficiency."

Title:
Data Analyst Internship
Data Analyst Internship with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst Internship. Becoming the professional that you aspire to be

About The Internship

As a Data Analyst intern, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on mutiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Write efficient and scalable Python scripts for data processing, analysis, and automation
Work with JSON data structures for data interchange between systems and applications
Perform data analysis and modeling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities

Our story

Curiosity is one of the most helpful traits that will keep you sharp and optimistic. Always eager to learn something new. We stimulate that trait in every aspect of our daily work. Switzerland‚Äôs leader in telecommunications, known as Swisscom, continues to invest in future talents. We believe that these future professionals help to shape our world and the way we do our business. As an ICT provider that offers many different products to our highly diversified customer base, IT is key to serving our B2C and B2B customers. Currently, we are active in three countries when it comes to IT: Switzerland, The Netherlands, and Latvia. Besides our homeland, Switzerland, our local DevOps Centres in Rotterdam and Riga help us to provide quality software to support all of our projects. We work as one organization within these three locations and have an agile way of working.

Our promise

At Swisscom, we promise you that you will learn a lot of different things during your internship. With more than 60 nationalities working at our company, we are used to diversity and all its perks. We provide a professional and fun atmosphere in which to work and unwind. At Swisscom, it is the combination of your individual expertise and teamwork that will help us succeed. We respect each other, help each other out, and are not afraid to make mistakes. We make sure you can be the best version of yourself. Always.

Who are you?

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
Strong knowledge in Tableau for data visualisation
Programming skills in Python, with experience in libraries such as pandas, NumPy, and sciki
Familiarity with JSON for data exchange
Understanding of data analysis and modelling techniques
Ability to work with large datasets and perform complex data manipulations
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and teamwork abilities
Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment
You are already in the Netherlands
You are curious and responsible

Perks

750 ‚Ç¨ gross Monthly Allowance (Full time)
IT Equipment
Agile working environment and lean management instructor
Flexible working time model
Plenty of opportunities for training and personal development
International Environment
Holidays & time off

Contact

Do you have any questions or do you want to know why we love working at Swisscom? Feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager Pilar Moreno Alonso (pilar.morenoalonso@swisscom.com).

Please, submit your CV in English."

Data Analyst- English speaking permanent role near Mannheim
Data Analyst- English speaking permanent role near Mannheim

Create both standard and tailored report libraries.
Provide training and support to system users.

Title:
Business Data Analyst
Business Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Details ‚Äì Hospitality, Sports & Leisure is the platform responsible for managing the Hospitality, Sports & Leisure areas of Arrow Global in Portugal, being responsible for managing the main hotel units, located in Vilamoura, Carvoeiro, Lagos, Albufeira, Aroeira and Madeira, as well as golf courses and equestrian centers.

Further information available at https://www.details.net/

Due to the company‚Äôs continual growth, Details intends to select: Business Data Analyst 

Overall Purpose

We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Data Analyst to join our team in the hospitality sector. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analysing business data, identifying trends, and providing strategic insights to support informed decision-making. This position requires strong analytical skills, knowledge of data analysis tools, and a deep understanding of the hospitality industry.

Key Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources, including property management systems (PMS), reservation systems, CRM, and social media platforms.
Analyze business performance data, such as occupancy rates, revenue per available room (RevPAR), ADR (Average Daily Rate), and customer satisfaction.
Develop dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs and present insights clearly and actionably.
Identify market trends, customer behaviors, and opportunities for operational improvement.
Collaborate with marketing, sales, and operations teams to develop data-driven strategies.
Conduct competitive analysis and benchmarking to position the company competitively in the market.
Utilize statistical techniques and predictive modeling to forecast future demand and optimize resource allocation.
Assist in implementing and monitoring dynamic pricing and revenue management initiatives.
Perform ad-hoc analyses as needed to answer specific business questions and support strategic decision-making.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Business Administration, or related fields. A postgraduate degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Business Data Analyst, preferably in the hospitality industry.
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Knowledge of statistical analysis and predictive modeling techniques.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex data clearly and concisely.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Knowledge of property management systems (PMS) and CRM tools is a plus.


Local and Schedule:
Algarve"

Data Analyst Intern
Data Analyst Intern
Job Description:
"About the job
Chez Foxintelligence, nous sommes des amoureux de la data. ü§ì

Notre mission est de rendre les consommateurs et les marques plus intelligents, gr√¢ce √† une donn√©e de march√© r√©volutionnaire issue de l'intelligence collective. Pour les consommateurs, Foxintelligence rend accessibles et utiles leurs donn√©es transactionnelles issues de leurs bo√Ætes mail ou comptes bancaires. Title:
Data Analyst Intern
Data Analyst Intern
Job Description:
"About the job
üöÄ Founded in 2021, Echo's narrative is one of relentless growth, ambition, and promise. A cutting-edge startup at the forefront of Geospatial Data and Gen AI technologies, we have skyrocketed from 0 to 80+ employees in just three years!
Specialists in the location intelligence industry, we empower innovation by helping companies better understand the world around them.
In a world inundated with data, quality is crucial. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build Europe's most comprehensive, high-quality datasets, enriched with differentiating attributes that outmaneuver the competition.
We aren‚Äôt just about reliable data (read: unmatched quality) though.
Life at Echo is about individual growth, collective ambition, and a culture that values and celebrates diversity; With a ""people first"" philosophy guiding everything we do.
You'll be at the heart of innovation, tackling projects that shape our future, with the best people possible!

Your Role at Echo 
Are you a Master‚Äôs candidate passionate (ideally) about data analysis and programming? Join us for a six-month internship as a Data Analyst Intern. Dive into diverse datasets - geospatial, trajectory - using tools like BigQuery, Looker, Python, and Airflow.

Collaborate with ML experts, data engineers, scientists, and product managers on real-world projects. Apply data analysis techniques to solve business challenges and make impactful contributions to geo-spatial datasets.

This internship offers hands-on experience and a dynamic environment to explore and implement new algorithms, contributing to the scaling of our products. Make a real-world impact with your passion for data!

As such, your main responsibilities will be:
Collaborate closely with the sales team in order to deliver analytical geospatial samples for our clients and prospects using sql or python
Support the data team on the automation of the delivery process
Collaborate with the data science and product management team to find solutions to improve the data quality of our product
Work on several projects that aims to improve and optimize our geospatial products
Be proactive in investigating and testing new tools, processes, and technologies on an ongoing basis

What we‚Äôre looking for:
Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Data/Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction
Programming Languages: Python is a plus, especially Pandas for data manipulation and analysis and Airflow for data orchestration
Data Visualization: Knowledge in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Looker or Tableau..
Problem-solving: Adept in approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions
Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, in English
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced environment

Some preferred requirements:
Comfortable working with the Google Cloud Platform stack or another cloud environment
Experience with a version control system like GitHub or Gitlab
Experience with data engineering tools like Airflow
Experience with spatial-temporal datasets

Why us?
üåé A great diverse and international team based in Paris (25+ nationalities!)
üöÄ Impact and ownership mindset: at Echo we encourage everyone to take ownership of their projects
üéá People first company: without our people we have no business, we have dedicated a People Manifesto to them
üåÜ A contemporary office space in central Paris with a rooftop to admire the view
üíª Remote-friendly policy
ü•ò Free coffee, snacks on top of your lunch voucher card (Swile, 10‚Ç¨/ working day)
Still hesitating or feeling like you don‚Äôt check all the boxes? We encourage you to apply anyway! üôÇ
Best case scenario: we start an incredible collaboration. If not, you only invest a few minutes towards your application. We promise, you won‚Äôt regret it!

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of gender, sexual orientation, origin, disabilities, or any other traits that make you who you are."

Title:
Junior Data Analyst
Junior Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

, Job Description

The ISO unit of Verisk is looking forInsurance Data Analyststo support our large team of actuaries and data analytics experts, who create innovative analytic products based on our unique database of over 21 billion records spanning more than twenty lines of insurance.

You will play a hands-on role in developing new processes to create a wide variety of ISO‚Äôs analytic solutions including our advisory prospective loss costs and rating factors; analyses that underlie the development of our loss costs (such as distributions by peril, classification, or geographic area); actuarial projection of ultimate claims, and analysis of trends impacting premiums and claims; analytical data management, including smart data quality analytics, data aggregations provided to US state insurance regulators and analytic research & development.

A successful Insurance Data Analyst will possess excellent technical and mathematical skills, to manipulate data and derive analyses. Most important, though, is a sense of inquisitiveness about data, and the ability not just to manipulate data, but to also understand and preserve the business meaning behind it.

, Qualifications

Fluency in English is required (at least B2 spoken and written)
Knowledge of Excel (pivot tables, formulas, conditional formatting)
Attention to detail to follow elaborate instructions and to spot even little differences in data
Experience with big data sets (10 000+ rows)
Familiarity with SQL will be an asset but not required
Willing to work in a hybrid model as a full-time employee and grow within an insur-tech company
Ability to manage competing, high-priority demands and prioritize workloads while managing projects and multiple responsibilities against strict deadlines
Strong interpersonal/collaboration skills and ability to build relations with internal stakeholders

Additional Information

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work¬Æ for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work¬Æ Certification, we‚Äôve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companiesand by Forbesas a World‚Äôs Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We‚Äôre 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions‚Äî provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions‚Äî supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions‚Äî offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions‚Äî provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions‚Äî provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions‚Äî delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions‚Äì offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft‚Äî provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume."

Title:
Junior Data Analyst
Junior Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Intale is a VC backed retail-tech company that consists of gifted people that are not afraid to get their hands dirty.

Here we give superhero powers to small local retail stores, transforming them into a state-of-the-art, cutting-edge business. We have vowed to remove the slack and the fragmentation from offline retail. We achieve that through our platform that connects stores, distributors and retail manufacturers, creating a unique transparent marketplace.

Do you love helping businesses make data-driven decisions? Do you have a passion for analyzing data and finding trends?

Our team is expanding and we are looking to add a passionate Junior Data Analyst who who get his/her hands dirty with raw data, package it in meaningful ways and work with our key clients to deliver value adding actionable insights.

Your role will be to:

Develop a deep understanding our core data, structures and insight possibilities
Design categories and subcategories to slice and dice the data in meaningful ways
Ensure that the quality of the data is of the standards promised to our clients
Introduce the new products into our Universal Product database and set up the relevant processes and workflows
Extract the data and analyze it using a standard business intelligence tool


Requirements

You should have a genuine passion for data and data-driven decision making. Additionally:

Strong verbal and written communication skills (Greek/English)
Degree in statistics, math and/or computer science
Very good knowledge of MS SQL and/or MySQL
Very good knowledge of MS Excel
Experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) will be considered a plus
Expertise in Retail and/or FMCG Industry will be considered a plus
Flexibility in approach and innovative thinker


Benefits

Our people mean the world to us, and we only recruit the best. For the talents in our business, we offer great benefits and opportunities to develop with us.

Competitive package
Private health insurance plan
Training and advancement opportunities

Think you fit the bill? Tick the boxes, we need to talk."

Title:
Data Analyst Intern
Data Analyst Intern with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Mirakl is the global leader in platform business innovation. Mirakl's suite of solutions provides enterprises with a transformative way to drive significant growth and efficiency in their online business.

Since 2012, Mirakl has been pioneering the platform economy, empowering retail and b2b enterprises with the most advanced, secure and scalable technology to digitize and expand product assortment through marketplace and dropship, improve efficiency in supplier catalog management and payments, personalize shopping experiences, and boost profits through retail media.

Mirakl is trusted by 400+ industry-leading businesses worldwide including Macy‚Äôs, Decathlon, Kroger, Airbus, Toyota Material Handling and Sonepar.

Headquartered in Paris and Boston and with offices in 7 countries, Mirakl is recognized as a Great Place to Work company.

Your Impact:

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will have the opportunity to play a crucial role in accelerating the implementation of vertical go-to-market strategy at Mirakl.

Your role:

Harness advanced technologies such as Python (with a particular focus on using the pandas library to transform and analyze data), HTML, SQL, and API calls to generate scalable insights, ensuring their dissemination across Mirakl‚Äôs Go-to-Market resources (AEs, BDRs, Marketing, Partner ecosystem).

Accelerate the personalization efforts by collaborating with the BDR team to create Persona based outreach e.g. CEO, Head of ecommerce, Head Merchandiser etc.

Collaborate with our Platform Advisory Team to ensure we are integrating their market developed insights into all GTM resources

Currently pursuing higher education in Business, Economics, Finance, or a related field and looking for a 6 months internship based in Paris, starting in September 2024
Ideally, experience working on projects supporting sales teams (sales ops or revenue ops)
Proficient in Python (with experience using the pandas library for data manipulation),HTML, SQL, and APl calls
Fluent in English and in French

Ability to be laser focused on a singular task, and a tenacity to always solve the problem regardless of the hurdles faced

What We Offer:

Internship compensation: between 1200 ‚Ç¨ and 1400 ‚Ç¨ per month (depending on profile)

A tailor-made integration path to quickly gain skills
Empowering and evolving missions to get the most out of this experience

A healthy mind in a healthy body, take time for yourself with the Gymlib pass!

Hiring Process:

Two interviews where you will meet your future manager and a coworker. STAR methodology will be use
Welcome to Mirakl!


We welcome collaborators with their diverse perspectives and experiences to power us forward. These often far exceed conventional job requirements and help us create a culture of continuous learning. If you‚Äôre ready to join a hyper-growth company at the heart of digital transformation for the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking organizations, we strongly encourage you to apply to any of our roles, even if you think you‚Äôre not an exact match."

Title:

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Description

About Liferay

Liferay is a uniquely profitable B2B enterprise software company with 1,200+ fiery-eyed employees all across Europe, the Americas, the Middle East, Asia, and Africa. As a renowned provider of enterprise open source technologies, we have been recognized by Gartner for empowering businesses around the world to solve complex digital challenges. Liferay Experience Cloud is an all-in-one solution that unites our Liferay DXP and cloud platform capabilities with built-in analytics and B2B commerce functionality, reducing the time to market and allowing for accelerated innovation - serving notable customers across the globe such as Airbus, US Bank, Honda, and Desjardins.

But we don‚Äôt just make awesome software, we are also fueled by a greater-than-profit vision. By building a vibrant business, making technology useful, and investing in communities, we make it possible for people to reach their full potential to serve others. We give our employees five days off to volunteer at charities they‚Äôre excited about, and Liferay donates 10% of our profits to charities around the world. Oh, we‚Äôre also self-funded which gives us the freedom to work on whatever we think brings the most value to customers and communities in the long run!

About You And This Role

You have that rare ability to bridge two worlds, the human and the technical. You can draw out complex ideas

from stakeholders and distill them into achievable goals. You understand the synergy between requirements

and test plans and are experienced in driving product improvements from requirements gathering till

completion. You like being given the space to run in a global open source company to help deliver creations

that are intuitive and sharp. Sounds like you? Apply now and let‚Äôs chat.

Key Objectives

Support data collection efforts by identifying relevant data sources and working with stakeholders to understand their data needs.
Assist in data cleaning, transformation, and preparation for analysis using your SQL techniques.
Perform basic data analysis under guidance, identifying trends and patterns.
Support the creation of clear and informative reports and dashboards to monitor key metrics as well as maintain current dashboards and reports used to support critical business monitoring goals.
Convey insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations.
Collaborate with team members and cross functional teams to understand and support ongoing projects.
Assist in the development of self-service tools and internal documentation resources.
Seek opportunities to learn and apply new data analysis techniques and tools.
Contribute to a culture of data-driven decision making.

Required Qualifications

 3+ years of work experience in Data Analysis, Business Analysis or relevant experience in analytical tasks or projects working with data.
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders and prioritizing competing requests.
Experience rolling out BI tools/metrics at a global level managing relationships with cross functional teams
Excellent decision-making, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
Team player, with strong interpersonal skills and skilled in developing collaborative relationships.
Self-starter, quick learner, detail-oriented and proactive in completing responsibilities.
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Demonstrated experience in data analysis languages as SQL, Python and/or R
Story- telling and visualizing, experience in Tableau or otherBI/Reporting tools

Preferred Qualifications

BA/BS degree in Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar, or 5+ years of equivalent work experience.
Experience with JIRA 

What We Offer

Salary package w/ competitive benefits according to qualifications and experience
Opportunities to take responsibility, grow professionally, and Stay Nerdy
A positive and collaborative work culture
Check out what employees say about us on Glassdoor 
Working at a leading open-source company

Equal Opportunities Employer - Statement

Liferay is committed to the equal treatment of all candidates, customers and employees and to fostering a culture of dignity at work. Our operating procedure provides for equal opportunities in recruitment and employment with the aim to eliminate discrimination against any job applicant or employee on the basis of race, age, sexual orientation, gender, religion or beliefs, marital or civil partnerships status, family or dependency status, disability, pregnancy and maternity or membership of a traveling community."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Pluxee is a global player in employee benefits and engagement that operates in 31 countries. Pluxee helps companies attract, engage, and retain talent thanks to a broad range of solutions across Meal & Food, Wellbeing, Lifestyle, Reward & Recognition, and Public Benefits.

Powered by leading technology and more than 5,000 engaged team members, Pluxee acts as a trusted partner within a highly interconnected B2B2C ecosystem made up of more than 500,000 clients, 36 million consumers and 1.7 million merchants.

Conducting its business as a trusted partner for more than 45 years, Pluxee is committed to creating a positive impact on all its stakeholders, from driving business to local communities, to supporting wellbeing at work for employees while protecting the planet.

üöÄ Your next challenge 

Pluxee Data organization has chosen a decentralized Data Hub (central) & Data Spoke (local) organization where the Spokes are data factory teams covering multiple countries' Data needs and supporting business teams by delivering operations reporting, the ad-hoc analysis supporting decision making and advanced insights aiming at predicting clients, merchants, or consumers behaviors.

To support this objective, your responsibilities will encompass:
Data Analysis and interpretation: collecting and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends and insights relevant for business improvement.
Visualization and reporting: developing clear and informative dashboards and reports using data visualization tools to effectively communicate findings to business teams.
Decision support: providing ad-hoc analyses and statistical modeling to assist business teams in making informed decisions and defining key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure progress.

üåü You‚Äôre a match

Technical Skills:
5 years of experience as Data Analyst with at least 3 years in a permanent full time Data Analyst role. 
Experience supporting business areas in E2E Data Analysis and Visualization process, from gathering stakeholder¬¥s requirements to data collection, cleaning, analysis, and dashboard, reporting, and KPIs design and delivery.
+3 years of work experience using SQL on daily basis.
+3 years of work experience with Data Visualization tools, with at least 2 years experience using Power BI and DAX with advanced proficiency and storytelling skills.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, enabling advanced data analysis will be a plus Examples: Fraud detection, scoring, attrition.
Experience working with agile methodologies and tools such as Jira. 
Experience in finance or payment services companies will be a plus.
Excellent communication skills, oral and written, with the ability to interact with different types of stakeholders (technical, non-technical, C level).
Bilingual in French and Advanced level in English as will be working with Global teams.
Ability to work in a hybrid mode (3 days at the office and 2 days at home).

Soft Skills:
Effective communication: strong verbal and written communication skills in both French and English, adept at interacting with diverse stakeholders with varying cultural backgrounds and technical expertise.
Analytical thinking: highly analytical and detail-oriented, with a knack for problem-solving and extracting insights from complex datasets.
Proactive and motivated: proactive attitude, hands-on approach, and a high level of motivation to learn quickly and adapt to new challenges in an ever-moving domain.

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
About greenmetrics.ai

greenmetrics.ai is a Lisbon-based startup at the forefront of climate adaptation and environmental sustainability. We develop cutting-edge technological solutions using smart sensors, IoT connectivity and data analytics to collect and process environmental data, enabling our users to improve resilience against extreme weather events like floods, droughts and biodiversity loss.

We envision a future in which technology and human ingenuity are allies of the natural world, a future where data guides us on the path to a more sustainable, balanced and resilient way of living, preserving the delicate balance of our planet for future generations.

We are a bootstrapped, independent, profitable startup, with proven technology and systems operating in +15 cities in Portugal. We are starting our international expansion to Europe and Latin America and we need your contribution to help us accelerate towards our goals.


The Role

As a Data Analyst, your role will be central to leverage the power of data to drive climate resilience and adaptation strategies within the regions where we operate. You will integrate a small dynamic team that is revolutionizing climate risk management and adaptation.

You will have the autonomy to propose innovative data analytics strategies, generate insights that inform climate policy of cities and contribute to the development of cutting-edge climate risk assessment tools. Your work will help optimize our solutions and shape the decisions that steer our clients into defining adaptation actions and driving impactful change.

Whether developing data-driven solutions to address climate risks, scaling our current data analytics capabilities or proposing new data visualization strategies, your work will boost our understanding of the effects of climate change and enhance our ability to adapt to an increasingly uncertain landscape.


You will be responsible for:

Developing workflows to ingest, store, and process data from smart sensors (e.g. water flow level) and environmental monitoring systems (e.g. satellite observation).
Collecting data from public climate datasets to enhance our analytical capabilities.
Performing comprehensive analyses to identify patterns, trends, and correlations using statistical methods and Python libraries and tools.
Deploying innovative data analytics frameworks that account for future climate scenarios to conduct climate risk assessments and vulnerability analyses to improve adaptation efforts.
Creating visualizations to communicate assessment results and conclusions effectively.
Driving strategic projects and contributing to key decisions that directly influence the definition of adaptation actions.


Your profile:

A strong background in Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Environmental Science or any related field that provides a solid foundation for the role's responsibilities.
At least 2 years of experience working with data analytics or data engineering.
Proficiency with Python libraries and tools (e.g. Jupyter notebooks, NumPy, Plotly, GeoPandas) to explore, transform and load datasets and develop analyses.
A proactive and resourceful attitude to engage with stakeholders in obtaining new datasets.
Comfort in obtaining data from API sources and working with Git for version control.
Ability to create engaging and interactive visualizations to communicate complex data insights.
Excellent capacity to communicate complex data insights verbally and in writing in English.
Knowledge of statistical approaches such as Bayesian modeling is highly valued.
Experience using GIS, GDAL, Google Earth Engine for geospatial data analysis is a plus.


You are looking for:

Impactful purpose, by engaging in meaningful work that leaves a positive impact on our future.
Deep sense of ownership, participating in strategic meetings and decisions that will shape the future of climate risk management and adaptation strategies globally.
Freedom and flexibility, seamlessly blending your hybrid work environment between our office in Oeiras and any corner of the globe that fuels your creativity.
Connection with the innovation ecosystem, by gaining exclusive access to a thriving ecosystem of startups to expand your network, exchange ideas and spark collaborations through our incubation at Startup Lisboa.
Competitive compensation, as we ensure your efforts are rewarded with a competitive benefit package, setting the stage for a fulfilling experience that grows as we do.
A stake in our future, as we offer variable compensation aligned with the achievement of our ambitious goals, allowing you to secure a piece of the future we're building together.


Position Details:

Workload: Full-time
Application Start: 01/Aug
Application Deadline: 25/Aug
Planned start: Sep/24


Application Process:

No need to prepare a cover letter for this application but we will need a couple of things from you:
Linkedin/GitHub profile
Updated CV
Answers to 5 application questions

We know you are busy and we respect your time, so we prepared a short application form with the purpose of knowing you better, understanding your skills, strengths and interests so we can guarantee that we‚Äôre a match!

We want to make sure that you will feel motivated and excited about taking part on this journey. So we ask you to answer confidently and consider that there are no right or wrong answers to these questions.

This application form should take you less than 30 minutes to complete."

Title:
Internship ‚Äì Data & Analytics
Internship ‚Äì Data & Analytics with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
FINN drives change for people, organizations and the planet through frictionless mobility. Offering convenient and flexible car subscriptions, we bring a true e-commerce experience to car ownership and accelerate the advent of electric mobility. Join our fast-growing scale-up to make FINN the natural choice in Germany. We work with the best car brands in the world and are backed by leading global investors.

Your Role

As a Data Analytics Intern you will take responsibility for enabling FINN to make data-driven decisions. This includes taking on your own projects in making our objectives measurable or creating insightful analytics. You will also work at the intersection of Data and Business Development to drive initiatives based on the insights you gain. You will work with the most cutting edge tool stack available and can play a key role in establishing a data mindset in your team. You will work closely with the team, independently drive your projects and get the opportunity to contribute to a fast growing organization.

Your Benefits
