Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

üåç Ready to join the ultimate decision-making dream team? Hop aboard the Rocketship!

At Finder, we're not just about helping people save money, make money, and snag sweet rewards; we're also on a mission to inject some excitement into the daily grind.

With offices in Sydney, Toronto, New York, London, and Wroclaw, we've built a dynamic community of over 290 curious minds. But we're not your typical corporate clan. Diverse thinkers united by our core purpose to make money easy, we have a shared passion for turning the norm on its head.

If you're itching to shake things up, develop your expertise, and be part of a crew that values creativity, drive, and a good dose of quirkiness, then you might just be the missing piece to our puzzle. So why wait? Join us and let's navigate this wild world of decisions together! üöÄüåü

Role Overview

The role‚Äôs purpose is to supercharge Finder‚Äôs data capabilities through the design, deployment and improvement of data analytics capabilities.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our product teams with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-derived insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Finder, you will partner with stakeholders to build scalable infrastructure and a central hub of datasets and dashboards for the comparison business. This will support data-driven decisions and insights that translate directly to accelerate business growth and product improvement.

Work closely with the product, engineering, client services and publishing teams to support their decision making process with facts, insights and recommendations
Gather the requirements and determine the best course of action for analysis
Define a robust set of datasets and dashboards to support key business processes, e.g., forecasting, quarterly business planning etc.
Use the data to identify insights to inform hypotheses and test ideas.
Plan, and prioritise insights that drive Finder targets and ROI.
Analyse and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps
Build and maintain self-serve dashboards for internal and external stakeholders.
Train crew with dashboards / self serve analytics when needed.
Support company growth by discovering, analysing and communicating the critical user behavioural data

Desired Experience And Skills

Experience working with large-scale data sets
Experience of data analysis, cleaning or visualisation (for example using SQL, Python, spreadsheets or other technologies)
Experience in data modelling
Experience with Enterprise Digital Analytics such as Snowplow, GA360
Experience with modern data warehousing solutions (we use BigQuery)
Admirable team player qualities, including being collaborative, respectful, and service focused
A willingness to learn and apply various data analytics methodologies
A genuine passion for data and drive to communicate using data
Demonstrated analytical problem-solving skills and expertise
Demonstrated ability to pull apart complex data and communicate it to a non-technical audience

Preferred

Familiarity with dbt
Familiarity with GitHub
Deep understanding of building and maintaining data pipelines and assets, through robust change control.
Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, and bring clarity and structure as you go.
Ability to create and foster strong cross-functional networks and manage without authority.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.

Perks/Benefits

Vibrant office in the city center with a kitchen filled with snacks
Participation in our Finder Equity Plan (share options)
Organizational culture based on our core values
Multisport card
Access to training, development, and an extensive resource library
Private medical care
Lunch card
Hackofriday
Flexibility in when and where you can work with our hybrid policy, including opportunities to work abroad

Application Process

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you've been looking for, select the 'Apply Now' button below to submit your cover letter and resume. Use your cover letter to introduce us to you; we want to know who you are, what you've worked on and why you think you'd be a great addition to the Finder team.

Inclusion

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. Email talent@finder.com with any questions or feedback."

"About the job
üë∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Position Overview

üî© Our stack

PostGresQL
BigQuery
FiveTran
Segment
Looker

üèóÔ∏è Typical day at Colonies

When starting your day, you will take some news from your remote colleagues on slack while drinking your coffee.

You check your ongoing sprint with your teams to check any blocker.

You are alerted on slack that there is an error on a connector. It is your Duty week, so you take this incident in charge. You communicate on possible impacts, and when the system will be back to normal. You then go back to your planned daily tasks.

Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst (CRM Specialisation)

As Data Analyst with CRM Specialisation, you will contribute to the success of the Sales & Marketing teams of Everfield's portfolio across Europe:
Use your experience in Sales & Marketing analytics to present actionable insights to our Sales & Marketing teams (HQ & Portfolio).
Work with implementation partners and portfolio companies to ensure CRM systems are implemented in alignment with Everfield standards.
Cooperate with Data Engineers to create sustainable data pipelines from various CRM systems.

The company:
Everfield is a platform with a mission in acquiring, building and operating vertical market and specialist software companies, focused on European businesses. We invest in and provide support and best practices to software companies in order for them to live up to their full potential by offering a very established approach to promote growth.

Everfield seeks to deliver innovation and growth to its acquired companies by providing best practices and operational support to help identify opportunities and install proven methodologies to accelerate customer and market share. Everfield is located throughout Europe, with offices in UK, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Poland, Spain, and Latvia.

The team:
You will join the Business Intelligence (BI) team as the fourth member. Currently the team consists of two Data Engineers and a hands-on team lead. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfield‚Äôs portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.

The team builds pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.

The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company‚Äôs growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 16 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.

Responsibilities:
Requirements gathering
Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Create feature development and communication plans
Data Analysis
Perform Sales & Marketing analysis such as Cohort, Funnel, Pipeline coverage analyses, Revenue forecasting, etc.
Data Visualization
Design proof of concept solutions to showcase new features with shortened feedback loop
Create and maintain Power BI reports used by hundreds of users
Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation
Extract raw data from upstream sources
Improving data quality and efficiency
Data modelling and Transformation
Build data systems and pipelines based on a medallion architecture
Structure sales processes
Go beyond the data and work together with Everfield‚Äôs Sales Lead to structure sales processes in the portfolio companies
Support portfolio companies in implementing Everfield‚Äôs suggested data structure on CRMs and ensure consistency of definitions across the portfolio

Ideal candidate profile:
The position requires a self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach.
The candidate will have at least 3 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference.
Experienced with Sales analysis and business partnership with sales teams.
Relevant experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus-point.
Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas).
Experienced with data modelling.
Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative Agile development process.
Fluent in English.
Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together.

What‚Äôs in it for you?
Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
Working with the latest Data Analytics & Data Visualisation technologies.
Long term career opportunities.
Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio.
Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).

Continue the conversation
Interested? We would love to hear from you!

Apply now with your CV and if you are selected our Talent Acquisition colleague will contact you to schedule the 1st call and start our hiring process."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst *** Hybrid working *** Highly competitive benefits package

Parker Stewart is currently working with a large internationally acclaimed corporation who right now have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to join their growing IT team.

The role of the Data Analyst is to partner with business stakeholders and to work closely with the Data Engineering team to drive the consistency of information, implementing common frameworks and the reuse of information with a consistent approach to dashboard visualisations and metrics across the enterprise. As well as excellent technical skills, the ideal candidate will have a passion for analytics, strong business acumen and excellent stakeholder management skills.


What you will be doing;
Work closely with the Data Engineering Manager to design, develop and maintain certified Power BI workspaces, data sets, dashboards and reports
Drive the development, monitoring, review, and evaluation of new metrics, KPIs, key risk indicators, reports & dashboards, utilising data discovery techniques across complex data sets.
Work with colleagues to ensure consistent data governance policies and practices are implemented and maintained.
Responsible for all data documentation - Maintain data sources, data dictionaries, data mappings and master data management to create trusted and curated data.
Provide direction and design to strategic business programmes ensuring analytics requirements are captured and data visualisations are in place to help the business make informed decisions.
Drive a culture of continuous analytics improvement to advance data literacy across the organisation providing training programmes and support to business users to drive self-service adoption, analytics forum etc.
Work across several analytics projects, managing stakeholders and acting as scrum master, co-ordinating agile development cycles between business resources and the technical development teams.

Experience required:
Minimum two years of hands on experience in analytics roles, preferably dealing with diverse types of data - customer, transactional, operational, etc.
Third level qualifications in a relevant field of study eg mathematics, computer science, statistics, operations research, etc.
Expert knowledge of advanced visualisation techniques, reporting tools and analytical deep dives. Power BI is a must
Expert knowledge of data management and advanced analytics techniques used in the process of collecting, storing, and retrieving data. e.g. SQL, R, Python, SAS, VBA
Knowledge of process engineering with operational support systems
Ability to communicate and explain complex technical concepts and quantitative methods to a wide audience.
Experience of Agile project management methodologies and delivery experience.

For further information reach out direct to Christine McCarthy at Parker Stewart"

Description Du Poste

Dans le cadre de l'am√©lioration du pilotage des activit√©s d'Aix Marseille Universit√©, la DPCG (Direction de Pilotage et Contr√¥le de Gestion) et la DirNum (Direction du Num√©rique) portent le projet SID qui consiste √† la mise en place d'un syst√®me d'information d√©cisionnel qui aura pour mission de mettre √† disposition de l'ensemble des structures des tableaux de bord fiables et consolid√©s √† travers un portail d√©cisionnel.

Description Du Profil

Title:
Data Analyst (T&S)
Data Analyst (T&S) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Are you experienced in Big Data Analysis, with at least 3 years of solid experience, and looking for your next career move?! If so, we might have the right opportunity for you!!!

Our client is the market leader, that most can only dream of working with!


About Us:

We are dedicated to creating a safer, more secure digital environment for our users worldwide. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Big Data Analyst to join our Trust & Safety team.

Position Overview: You will play a critical role in forecasting future projects, improving processes, and conducting deep assessments of content to ensure safety and compliance. This role involves managing data pipelines, identifying new threats, liaising with various teams, and developing risk mitigation strategies. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, risk management, and policy development, with a keen eye for identifying and addressing potential threats.


Key Responsibilities:

*Forecasting and Project Planning: Analyze data trends and forecast future projects to enhance AI responsibility initiatives.
*Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate and improve processes to ensure efficiency and effectiveness in managing AI-related risks.
*Deep Content Assessment: Conduct thorough assessments of content to identify risks and ensure compliance with company policies.
*Data Pipeline Management: Oversee and ensure the smooth operation of data pipelines, including scanning for risks and issuing alerts for review.
*Cross-Team Liaison: Collaborate with other Trust & Safety teams, Project Managers, and the Legal team to ensure cohesive operations and identify emerging threats.
*Risk Mitigation and Policy Development: Assist in developing risk mitigation strategies and rewriting policies to address new challenges.
*Stakeholder Communication: Effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure clarity and alignment on objectives and processes.


Skills/Education/Experience:

*Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Quantitative field, or equivalent experience. An advanced degree is a plus.
*Minimum of 3 years of experience in a related field.
*Experience in Trust & Safety operations.
*Proficiency in SQL is essential.
*Experience with querying databases and understanding data trends.
*Knowledge of Python is a plus.
*Familiarity with Tableau or similar data visualization tools is a plus.
*Proven track record in building technical solutions.
*Experience in debugging and validating code is a plus.
*Excellent communication skills, particularly with non-technical stakeholders.



If the role interests you, please get in touch via email.
If you are interested in other roles or career change, please do not hesitate to contact me too.

Adecco is an equal opportunity employer!


Adecco Ireland is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy."

Title:
Data analyst
Data analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this mission, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Our pay packages are designed to attract and retain top professionals. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy) or fully remote.

Before you apply
Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

The selection process
We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply."

Title:
Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst  at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:

 You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information. 
 You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis. 
 You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats. 
 You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks. 
 You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper. 

Who You Are:

 You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate. 
 You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills. 
 You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work. 
 You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators. 
 You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc). 

Compensation and Benefits:

Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
Competitive compensation
A hybrid work model and a lovely office at the heart of Paris
Coverage for pr√©voyance et mutuelle
Meal vouchers
25 vacation days

We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer."

Title:
Junior Data Scientist / Analyst
Junior Data Scientist / Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future. 

About the Role
Nielsen measures the media-consumption habits of homes globally. Our data paints a rich portrait of the audience in those markets we measure. As a pioneer and industry leader in audience measurement for more than half a century, we take pride in our technology and processes, and we are constantly searching for new ways to advance our culture of innovation and growth. 
Our areas of expertise include researching hardware, software, quality controls and business rule changes that will improve the accuracy of our data reporting. 
In this role, you will learn and become an expert in Nielsen‚Äôs TV panel data, with a focus on Meter hardware and software used for data collection and crediting. You will help to design and execute analyses, develop necessary underlying data pipelines, and help to provide data-driven recommendations based on findings. 
This role can be based out of our offices in Koper or Ljubljana.

Responsibilities
Learn and become an expert in Audience Measurement, with a focus on streaming meter technology used for data collection and crediting. 
Contribute to analysis plan design, develop underlying data pipelines, execute analyses and summarize results
Identify, clean, and summarize data, potentially from disparate and complex data sources, to facilitate high quality analyses. 
Create simple, meaningful visualizations to help support data analysis and stakeholder communications 
Develop and share efficient code used for analyses
Incorporate quality checks to proactively detect and correct for errors throughout analysis. 
Provide clear data-driven recommendations based on research findings
Support senior team members in collaboration with department stakeholders (Engineering, Data Science, Technology, etc.). This includes providing status updates, developing timelines, sharing data, executing tests, presenting results, etc

Key skills
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Data Engineering or equivalent experience
Proven years of experience with the following: Manipulating, analyzing and interpreting complex data sources to tell a story from data through analyses; Programming in Python, PySpark and SQL for data pipeline development used to support analytics; Trending and visualizing data within Tableau; Experience working in cloud-based environments such as AWS
Able to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
Embraces innovation with a readiness to explore new solutions and a commitment to rapid iteration based on customer feedback
Demonstrates strategic thinking, understanding the broader impact of data insights on product and business objectives
Good level of English


Diversity
 Here at Nielsen, we believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Nielsen is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome applications from people that are excited to work for us, regardless of their background - so please get in touch!
 Nielsen provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to any protected characteristics under local law."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst 
Amsterdam - Hybrid 
Hourly Rate between ‚Ç¨72 - ‚Ç¨82 Euro - 40 hours per week 
Around 5 months - with a view for a extension 

The Data Analyst will support the product teams to ensure their roadmaps are data driven and support the implementation of a customer journey on site. You will work in close collaboration with tech and product leads to define a sustainable and scalable approach which would help integrating benefits to the user journey. The product vision that you will contribute to will be a long term one supporting the organisations vision.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for owning the design and delivery of parts of Data Analytics solutions based on business requirements, contributing to bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation with some supervision.
Responsible for working independently on consuming data, preparing it for analytical use and translating business problems to data stories. Can ask for guidance on more complex tasks.
Responsible for working within the scope of their team and delivering work that informs business decisions for the product / business topic they currently work on.
Responsible for leveraging foundational skills in data analysis and data visualization to answer business questions. They incorporate stakeholder requirements when creating intuitive and insightful visualizations that translate data into actionable insights.
Responsible for connecting and collaborating with stakeholders in operational and project-based roles under the guidance of a manager. Uses effective communication to address their needs and presents data insights in an accessible, business-friendly manner.
Responsible for being flexible in adopting existing internal Data Analytics approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
Responsible for growing their own craft skills while leveraging Data Analytics for impact on well defined business problems.
Responsible for supporting junior peers when opportunity presents itself through knowledge sharing and setting a good example.
Responsible for networking and proactively connecting with craft peers beyond the team's scope.
Must be familiar with the larger data ecosystem at the organisation and how it relates to the work they do.
Responsible for connecting with peers in related crafts (ie. Data Engineering) as needed on specific projects to ensure successful outcomes.
Must have high level knowledge about the goals of their area (ie. track / vertical).
Responsible for ensuring quality of their own work by validating it through peer review.
Skills:

Driven and results oriented personality
Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance
Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture
Analytical and curious mindset
Strong interpersonal skills

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
About The Job

As a Data Analyst you develop and manage the data landscape of the Wevelgem production site. Your mission is to enable optimisations and loss reduction. You work closely with the Operational Technology (OT) and Integrated Work Processes (IWS) teams. You navigate in the ecosystem of databases, historians, production applications and reporting tools. End-users consider you the reference for structured and validated data and rely on the data platform for their daily work.

About The Job

Your responsabilities include

Identify and prioritise profitable Use Cases based on production data. You work closely with business report developers and end-users. 
Develop a data strategy and data models
Identify necessary and missing data
Ensure availability and quality of the data
Interfacing with other internal and external production software platforms (examples Maecos, Bamboo LIMS and SAP)
Integrate model-based applications
Enable data pipelines for optimisations and predictions
Roll-out a reporting strategy based on Power BI
Build important dataflows and datasets to provide consumers with well-modelled and validated data
Develop and promote report templates
Structure Power BI Workspaces and Apps
Develop and implement concepts for data security and privacy
Governance and migration of Excel applications
Implement small changes to critical applications
Lead migrations towards supported corporate applications
Operational management
Management and governance of the Wevelgem data landscape
Cooperate with the OT Applications team
Lead knowledge transfer of data analysis and visualisation
Lead the Power BI community to promote best practices
Connect with other Danone organisations (e.g. IT & Data team and other sites)
About You

You combine data-technical and communication skills

Interest in a production environment and the work processes of the end-users is essential
You are able to think theoretically on Bachelor or Master level, and have at minimum a first experience in data analysis
A good knowledge base of Microsoft datatools such as Power BI, Excel, Powerquery
You master SQL to develop queries and stored procedures
Knowledge of Python, R and Machine Learning concepts are a plus
You can bridge the gap between technical specialists, operational management and end-users
You take the lead to identify Use Cases together with the end-users
You enjoy working on multiple project simultaneously. You can manage the portfolio based on importance and added-value. 
You are an excellent communicator in English, Dutch or French are a plus

About us

Alpro, the European plant-based pioneer of Danone, brings health through food to as many people as possible by producing healthy, tasty plant-based food and drink in a way that respects the planet. One Planet. One Health.

Our delicious plant-based products are made from soya, almonds, hazelnuts, cashew, rice, oats or coconut.

We want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world and because of our efforts to combine social and environmental goals with financial success, Alpro is B Corp certified.

More info on www.alpro.com

We offer

By joining us you will become part of one of the leading and most innovative food companies in the world.

We believe that everyone has talent, something which comes natural to you. Your uniqueness is something which brings both excellence as well as energizes you.

We are proud to be an equal employer. We are convinced our differences make the difference and that an inclusive working environment will drive our growth as a business, as teams and as individuals. We will therefore consider all applicants for employment fostering an inclusive working culture that is accessible for all.

Did you know that as a B-Corp certified company, Danone Benelux meets the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability?

Our core values - Humanism, Openness, Proximity and Enthusiasm embody the way we aspire to behave in everything we do. If you are an energetic person who believes in these principles, then Danone is the right company for you! Join our dynamic team and help us make our vision a reality by playing a key role in the performance of Danone and all its brands.

What‚Äôs next?

Hit the ‚ÄúAPPLY‚Äù button. To comply with GDPR regulations, we cannot process your personal data without given consent. Therefore, we strongly recommend applying directly via our careers website. Your application will be reviewed by our Recruitment Manager Anitia Casier anitia.casier@danone.com"

Title:
Data Analyst with Python (Big Data)
Data Analyst with Python (Big Data) with verification

Product Data Analyst To Retail Bi & Analytics ‚Äì Decide & Go Value Stream
Product Data Analyst To Retail Bi & Analytics ‚Äì Decide & Go Value Stream with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.

The mission of the Retail Unit at Sales is to grow and transform the portfolio by building exceptional store experiences ‚Äì securing high productivity, financial resilience and a strong brand. This is done through holistic retail strategies, fueled by tech innovation and enabled through our global network of teams and partners.

Job Description

The Retail BI & Analytics team is a team gathering data competencies within the newly formed Retail unit including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Analysts. The Product Data Analyst works closely together with the product teams, structured as Value Streams, within the Retail Tech department. The role includes supporting the Value Stream in setting KPIs and creating business cases for the products in that product area, as well as conducting data analysis, A/B testing and creating the BI reports needed to evaluate the product performance and guide the Value Stream‚Äôs work forward.

As a Product Data Analyst working towards the Decide & Go Value Stream, you will be a key enabler to explore and support data driven product development for the checkout products in store: physical and self-checkout, as well as mobile checkout solutions. You will build BI dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs, perform A/B tests, provide analysis and insights to support your colleagues with data and insight-driven decision making on strategic directions.

In the role you will:

Be a crucial person for your colleagues to understand how our product development impacts the business
Proactively support product development with analytical insights and recommendations which helps to drive innovations and achieve strategic advantage
Perform analysis on large sets of data to extract impactful insights that will inform and guide development efforts within the Value Stream as well as supporting in creating and following up on business cases related to the products within he Value Stream
Support the product teams within the Value Stream with setting KPIs and following up on performance through reporting and A/B testing
Translate business requirements into analytical requirements and design analytics and reporting solutions together with global business stakeholders as well as regions to maximize their impact
Interact and influence the analytical community within H&M to explore and enable new data areas to realize even more business potential


Qualifications

As a person we believe that you are a true role model of H&M values and that you are an ambitious, flexible and communicative team player. Your positive drive and curiosity sees the potential and opportunities in our way of working and wants to understand, test, scale and learn. By having a business and customer-oriented mindset with the motivation to constantly improve, achieve targets and drive agenda forward you are key player in the team. You like taking responsibility, prioritize and enjoy working in a changing environment

Additionally, we see that:

You have an academic degree in a quantitative field, such as engineering, business, economics, finance or math/statistics
You have developed strong analytical skills through relevant work experience with at least three years of experience working as Data Analyst, Product Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar roles
You are experienced in using programming languages like R or Python for data analysis
You have deep knowledge in how to use tools such as Power BI and SQL and are confident in working with large data sets and extracting data by writing complex queries.
You have experience in A/B testing
You are a clear communicator who can easily translate complex analytical methods to business stakeholders and are comfortable in presenting results of your analyses to different stakeholders
You are a team player and enjoy sharing your knowledge with colleagues


Additional Information

This is a permanent role, based in Stockholm and reporting to Tobias Klingberg, Head of Retail BI & Analytics. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV through this job posting. If you have any questions about the role and/or the process, please contact Sarah Assem.

H&M Group is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age. 

At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Why kindly ask you to not attach cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases."

Title:
Sportsbook - Data Scientist
Sportsbook - Data Scientist with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
The Wow

The Sportsbook Area with Product Development is now hiring! We have a world-class Sportsbook, developed in-house by our dedicated Sportsbook tech team and growing at a very rapid rate, expanding not only in new markets but also as a B2B product. Having our product available in different parts of the world and offering sports all around the world requires to have support around the clock.‚ÄØOur Product Development organisation is truly Global with cross functional teams spanning 5 Tech Hubs. These can be found in Malta, Budapest, Stockholm, Tallinn and Athens.

At Betsson Group we work with a Hybrid Work From Home (WFH) model, giving you the flexibility of working 3 days in the office and 2 days at home.

Key Responsibilities

Identify, analyse, define and understand business problems.
Collecting, cleaning, and preprocessing data to ensure its quality and reliability to build solutions.
Prototype data science models.
Use exploratory analysis methodologies to identify patterns and trends to use with the right statistical methods (clustering, PCA, regression, significance testing).
Work with descriptive and predictive analytics (e.g. linear regression & propensity models, customer segmentation, data mining and trigger identification).
Work with the Machine Learning Engineer, within the data function, to implement and productionise the models whilst monitoring the performance.
Evaluating the performance of models and refining them as needed
Presenting the results and suggestions to relevant parties by using easily understandable visuals and concise reports
Working with teams across different functions to implement solutions based on data analysis

You are good at

Communicating with commercial stakeholders, explaining data concepts in a non-technical language.
Working in a dynamic environment with a very flexible approach.
Being a team player. Collaboration between teams will be essential in this role.

What we are looking for

Keen interest in Sports and Casino to establish which models should be used in the correct context.
Degree or MSc/PhD in a quantitative area such as Statistics, Maths or Economics.
Experience delivering complex data science and analytics projects within organisations.
Great understanding of statistical methods and machine learning models.
Has good understanding in at least one analytical language (Python, R, SPSS).
Experience manipulating large datasets using SQL or similar.

What we offer

Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you‚Äôre a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you‚Äôll fit right in.

Challenge accepted?

Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about

If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV in English.

By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy"

Title:
Student Assistant Insights and analytics
Student Assistant Insights and analytics
Job Description:
"About the job
About Us

Since our launch in 2009, Puregym has been pioneering the model for affordable, flexible, high-quality gyms and our mission to inspire a healthier nation by helping more people in more places live healthier lives has led us to be Denmark‚Äôs leading gym chain with over 160 sites. Alongside our Danish success, we are also a leading international operator with 360+ clubs in UK, 40+ clubs in Switzerland and new openings in the USA, Saudi Arabia and UAE.
We are driven by the passionate people of PureGym, who create brilliant environments for our members and the communities we serve. Our unique ""Everybody Welcome"" approach provides a friendly, warm and welcoming environment for our members and our ambition to double in size over the next few years gives a great opportunity for our teams to grow and accelerate their careers.


Role Purpose

We are a value business, focused on making gyms and fitness accessible to as many people as possible. Data is at the heart of how we run our business, starting from where to open our gyms, through what we offer within them through to how we engage with past, current, and future members. Combining the data from our over 2 million members with data about locations, operations, and performance allows us to unlock industry leading insights and drive a better member experience and commercial performance.
Data is a core competitive advantage to use as market leader, helping us guide decisions at scale and personalisation at the member level. To unlock the value of data, PureGym has built a Group Insights & Analytics function, comprised of an Insights, a Data Engineering, and a Data Science team, recognising the importance of close collaboration of data teams to quickly and efficiently deliver business value.
We are looking to hire a Student Analyst into our Insights team, which includes:
Delivering parts of data-driven insights projects across the entire PureGym Group
Maintain and develop our suite of Business Intelligence dashboards serving insights to the PureGym DK organisation
Undertake deep-dive data analyses to better how we can a improve the member experience and create business value
Leverage PureGym's unique data assets and work with Azure Databricks technology, leveraging modern cloud-native technologies and data lakehouse architecture
Opportunities to work with our data scientists and data engineers to get a broad exposure to data projects and applications

The person

We are looking for:
Currently studying for a degree in data science, economics or similar with a strong quantitative focus.
Proficient in Python and SQL.
Experience building data visualisations
Knowledge of data scraping is a plus.
Innovative and curious: constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; always interested to find new and better methods and technologies.
Excellent organisational and time management skills, with willingness and ability to take ownership of projects.
happy to work 15 hours per week


Please make sure you apply with an English CV"

‚Ä¢ Conduct ad-hoc analyses and present findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.
‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
‚Ä¢ Participate in the evaluation and implementation of new BI tools and technologies.

What your background should be:
‚Ä¢ A degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field is desirable.
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience in data, reporting and analytics, with a proven track record in Power BI, SQL and Python.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate previous experience working with ETL processes and tools
‚Ä¢ Previous experience in the financial services industry is desirable.

If you're passionate about technology and thrive in a fast-paced environment, Apply now!"

Title:
Junior Data Analist
Junior Data Analist
Job Description:
"About the job
Leasen: het is meer dan een auto afhalen. Het is een samenwerking die allerlei vormen en maten aan kan nemen, met verschillende wensen bij elke afspraak. Je kunt hierin heel veel aanbieden, en dat is wat ze hier doen. Maar klantvriendelijk zijn vraagt om goede collega‚Äôs.

Wat doen ze hier?

Leasen is lang niet voor iedereen hetzelfde. De ene organisatie wil een volledig wagenpark, de ander wil een enkele heftruck. Ieders eisen, wensen en budget zijn anders en daar is service voor nodig. Flexibiliteit is iets waar het bij veel leasepartijen nog aan ontbreekt, maar dat is niet overal het geval.

Hier hebben ze meer dan je gebruikelijke auto van de zaak. Deze organisatie is echt een partner voor operationele, financi√´le √©n equipment lease. Je kunt hier inderdaad ‚Äògewoon‚Äô een wagenpark opzetten, maar ook een heftruck leasen. Afhankelijk van de precieze wensen van de aanvraag kunnen ze van product tot service en oplevering helemaal met je meedenken. Daardoor hebben ze al jaren stevige groeicijfers.

Mooi! En wat kan mijn rol hier worden?

Als Junior Data Analist haal jij de beste customer insights naar boven. Je focus ligt echt op de klantdata, en je analyseert welke ontwikkelingen nodig zijn om de klanttevredenheid effectiever en effici√´nter te verhogen. Hiervoor gebruik je de vrijheid om je kennis en ervaring te gebruiken binnen het CX team. Binnen dat team is het doel om dagelijks impact de maken op de klantervaring, en dat kan niet zonder jou.

Kennis en ervaring gebruiken, zei je?

Hiermee bedoelen we in ieder geval twee jaar werkervaring in data. Als je ervaring hebt met Customer Experience heb je extra voordeel maar dat is niet verplicht. Met een sterk analytisch vermogen en oog voor detail glippen er geen kansen tussen jouw vingers door. Werken in een team versterkt jouw productiviteit en inspelen op de wensen van een klant is voor jou de norm. Bovendien spreek en schrijf je vloeiend Nederlands.

Check, check en check. En wat krijg ik ervoor terug?

Het maandsalaris tussen de ‚Ç¨2.750 - ‚Ç¨3.900,- maar kan zo oplopen als je wat ervaring hebt. Vakantiegeld en pensioenregeling komen hier nog bij en de collectieve zorgverzekering staat voor je klaar. De kilometervergoeding is 0,23 cent en thuiswerkvergoeding is aanwezig voor als je liever weinig reist. Klaar om aan de bak te gaan? We gaan graag met je in gesprek!"

Title:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Business Intelligence Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Beyond, we power the business of Short Term Rentals through our cutting-edge, full-stack Revenue Management System. Venture-backed, we pioneered this space and have grown to be the globally dominant leader - obsessed with delivering value and performance to our customers. And the way we've been able to achieve those heights is our belief that People are the most important part of any business - starting with ours. We employ over 170 Beyonders across the globe who share in our commitment to making Beyond the best place to work.

It's with that in mind that Beyond is looking to add an Associate Business Intelligence Analyst. Reporting to our Director, Revenue Operations, you will play a critical role in delivering actionable and meaningful metrics to both internal and external stakeholders. Your primary objective will be to provide comprehensive insights that enable our internal teams to gain a holistic understanding of how our products and services connect with each other, and with our customers.

To excel in this position, you should possess a strong technical background and a proven track record in developing reporting, business intelligence, and data solutions. We‚Äôre looking for someone hands-on, results-oriented, and eager to work cross-functionally.

Before reading further‚Ä¶
Beyond is passionate about diversity and cultivating our team‚Äôs potential. If you‚Äôre hungry for a good opportunity, but don't meet every point in this job description, please apply anyway!

As our Associate Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll be responsible for:
Data, Data, & more Data - Analyze & optimize our current data transformation pipelines. Create new data models to support business insights & monitor data quality.
Technical Partnership - Partner closely with other Tech, Product and Data engineering teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics, projects & new data initiatives.
Harvesting insights - Enabling effective decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Business Expertise - Leveraging a deep, data-driven understanding of the key drivers and metrics underpinning Beyond‚Äôs products and business lines to draw insights and make recommendations that will help the company grow and scale effectively.
Showing the way to key stakeholders - Conduct deep-dive analysis with complex SQL queries and translate requirements into effective & innovative data visualizations and solutions in Mode. Partnering closely with our GTM, Finance & Product teams to support their business objectives through analysis.

So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be an:
Innovator - Insights without action are lost opportunities and you regularly seek new information, try new approaches, and want to increase the pace of learning
Storyteller - You love telling stories with data, and have a playbook for how to bring people along in the process
Explorer - You seek information that challenges assumptions and delight in finding insights that are not obvious.
Advisor - You have the ability to distill and share key data and insights that lead to better decision-making and strategy

Now that we‚Äôve told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:
2+ years of experience working in a Business Intelligence / Analytics environment.
Strong data modeling & proficiency SQL skills with experience working with complex & large data sets.
Experience harnessing data from multiple sources and making it usable and accessible for non-technical users.
Hands-on experience with data transformation tools, query engines and data visualization tools (dbt, airflow & Mode are what we use)
Experience articulating business questions, and using available data to find answers that translate into business recommendations.
You have exceptional business intuition and conceptual thinking, with the ability to readily map business processes to the appropriate metrics.
Experience with dbt / Python is a plus

So what can you expect after you apply? Your application will be personally reviewed by a member of the Beyond hiring team and if there is a match in your experience and the role, you will:
Have a video conversation with someone on our Recruiting team. This is a high-level conversation about your experience and interest, but also an opportunity for you to learn more about us
Interview with our Director, Revenue Operations & BI
Complete a technical assignment
Meet with our team for deeper dive video conversations
Interview with our Chief Revenue Officer
Interview with our Chief Technology Officer/Cofounder

Company Values:
We are serious about our core values: We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It, We're Curious. If those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.

Benefits:
Beyond offers a wide variety of benefits like: stock options, unlimited PTO, private health insurance and more! You can learn more about our benefits by visiting our careers site!

We Care about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:
Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints, and believe that our ability to help short term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond."

Title:
Business Data Analyst
Business Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Business Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising!

WHO WE ARE
Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.
We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.

KEY FIGURES
2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers
2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth
2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +10 countries & +230 Seedtaggers
2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market + 400 Seedtaggers

YOUR CHALLENGE
You will get full ownership of our business data, and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratization of data inside the company, and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.

YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF
You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications / education in Data / Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders

It would be a big plus if you
Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modeling
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders

SEEDTAG PERKS
üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities
üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, Mexico..., üèñÔ∏è)
üçΩÔ∏èüöò Access to a flexible benefits plan with restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten tickets and discounts on medical insurance
‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life
üèã Gympass
üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses
üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)
üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!

BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG
Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject ""that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done"". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.

Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!"

Title:
Data Analyst - Credit
Data Analyst - Credit with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need

Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class=""postings-link"" href=""https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates"">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application."

Title:
Data Analyst - Sales & Operations
Data Analyst - Sales & Operations with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Do you want to work for some of the world‚Äôs leading audio brands? Become a part of the HARMAN team and get to work for JBL and Harman/Kardon. 

By joining HARMAN, you'll dive headfirst into the exciting world of headphones, portable speakers, party boxes and other audio technologies, and contribute to the success of Harman Lifestyle EMEA business. The consumer audio industry is fast paced, fun and dynamic and we‚Äôre looking for someone who is proactive, loves to work with a lot of different stakeholders from all over Europe and has creative ideas.

You will join our Program Management department based in Amsterdam, The Netherlands in the position of: 

Data Analyst - Sales & Operations

About the Role:

We have channel data‚Ä¶.and lots of it! Channel data is the reported sales as well as inventories of Harman products by Harman‚Äôs customers - what we need is accurate and actionable insights from this data. That is where you come in. You are passionate about data and know how to structure it and improve associated data quality KPI‚Äôs. Primarily you are ensuring Harman leadership and other stakeholders consume accurate and qualitative channel data. You will be collaborating with regional sales teams and various functional stakeholders around the globe to make sure data from our customers is accurate, complete and on time. Second to that you will be working on recurring reports and development of new reports and applications of Channel data. to At all times will you be a champion of the selected Business Intelligence tooling. While eager and driven, you will be patient tutor for all in the organization to develop their ability to proficiently work with data.

What You Will Do:

Monitor data compliance ( on time, accurate and complete) metrics for our customers. 
Monitor and action data processing accuracy in our data enrichment and transformation processes. 
Data reconciliation and data anomaly analysis. 
Interact with regional stakeholders on improving customer data quality. 
Creating and automation of recurring Channel Data reporting. 
Support analysis of Channel Data and other data sources. 
Support broader application of Channel Data in the organization. 
Be a go to persona and evangelist of our Qlik Business Intelligence tooling ( reporting & data visualization). 
Support data management in small scale analytics projects. 
Support business users with business case development for Analytics applications and projects. 
Validate results of initiated analytics projects. 

What You Need:

3+ years experience in similar roles such as Business Analyst, BI Analyst or Data Analyst
Master/Bachelor of Business Administration or equivalent
Familiarity with analytical and database tools
Experience in data quality or general data management
Experience in development of data visualization
Ability to interact with a variety of stakeholders in different locations and levels
Knowledge of/or willingness to learn (basic) programming
Experience in a Project driven environment is a strong preference
Experience with the Qliksense ecosystem is a strong preference. 
Able to work & contribute in a small dynamic team
Able to work in a a diverse, multi-cultural and multi regional team
Positive, energetic, can-do attitude, self-starter, accountable and takes ownership
Fluent in English (both written and verbal), other European languages an advantage

What makes you eligible:

Be willing to work (flex policy) in an office in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 
Willingness to travel 10% of the time. 

What We Offer:

HARMAN is offering a unique opportunity for growth and development in the dynamic and exciting world of consumer electronics. 
We provide a flexible work schedule that allows you to work from home, while also enjoying a fantastic new office at Houthavens, Amsterdam. 
At HARMAN, we value diversity and inclusivity, and foster a friendly and supportive global working atmosphere. We believe in investing in our employees through career development opportunities, professional training, and competitive market-based compensation. As part of our commitment to employee well-being, we also offer a commuter travel package, environment allowance, and interesting collective health insurance scheme, pension, and employee discounts on world-class HARMAN/Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.). 
As a HARMAN employee, you will have access to professional development opportunities through HARMAN University's business and leadership academies, internal talent management leadership acceleration programs, and our ""Be Brilliant"" employee recognition and rewards program. 

And a few reasons you might love it:

We're seeking talented and passionate individuals to join our team and help us transform the way people experience sound. As a global leader in the audio industry, HARMAN offers the chance to work with iconic brands like JBL, Harman/Kardon, and AKG, as well as cutting-edge technology and industry-first features. 
We value excellence and brilliance in all of our 30,000 employees and we're looking for talented individuals who share our passion for innovation and superior sound technology. If you're looking for a career full of brilliant possibilities and the chance to work on industry-first features, then HARMAN is the place for you!

Don't miss out on the chance to be part of a culture that values excellence and brilliance in all of our employees. Apply now and take the first step towards a career full of brilliant possibilities! https://jobs.harman.com/en_US/careers

We look forward to receiving your application! Send your application with your resume and letter of motivation. We will process the applications as we receive them.

For more information about the position or the recruitment process, feel free to contact our Recruitment department on: conor.kelly@harman.com or call +31 6 48 449 645

Join HARMAN and discover a world of endless possibilities!"

Title:
Marketing Data Analyst
Marketing Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Summary:
You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.
- Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.
- Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.
- Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.
- Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.
- Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.
- Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.
- Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.
- Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.
- Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)
- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
- Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.
- Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
- A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.
- Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment."

Title:
PV Performance Data Analyst
PV Performance Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
D√©tail de l'offre

Informations g√©n√©rales

R√©f√©rence

Equans_56627

Date de parution

31/07/2024

Description Du Poste

Fili√®re M√©tier

R√©f m√©tier Bouygues SA - TRAVAUX

Intitul√© du poste

PV Performance Data Analyst

Contrat

CDI

Temps de travail

Temps complet

Description De La Mission

Bouygues Energies and Services is a small branch within the Equans France and we specialize in energy and, more broadly, in electrical engineering for renewable energies. Our job is to design, build and maintain photovoltaic power plants such as shading systems and solar power plants, which can be on land or floating.

Equans France, in general, designs, installs, maintains, and operates technical systems and customized services in over 30 countries. These services enable customers to combine control over their energy consumption with quality of life and working conditions for their users.

Among the 27 000+ employees that are accompanying Equans France on its adventure, 550 of them is supporting the Energy Business of Bouygues Energies & Services.

New job opportunity : Equans Solar & Storage is hiring :

?? The PV Performance Data Analyst is a member of BYES International O&M team managing ca.1GWp of utility scale solar PV power plants. ??

? He/she will be an integral person in the day-to-day operation of solar farms, including assessing the performance of the solar farms, analysing operation data with a view to extract actionable insights, real-time monitoring when required and troubleshooting technical issues with the generating assets when required. ?

 Main Duties & Responsibilities:

1 Remote monitoring of global solar O&M portfolio with a focus on data analytics.

2 Collection, triage and analysis of data from sites as well as maintenance operations (may occasionally require liaison with on-the-ground teams and/or O&M managers).

3 Coordinates the onboarding of newly connected plants to our hypervisor in the agreed timeline.

4 Fault analysis and categorisation of failure modes, statistical analysis.

5 Availability and Performance Ratio calculations, eventually developing a standardised calculation method/format to benchmark all sites with the same calculations following best practice guidance.

6 Comparison of actual performance data with forecasts (Availability, Performance Ratio, Yield).

7 Development of in-house tools for data analytics that can be used across a diverse portfolio of assets.

8 To be an ""embassador"" of performance team across the PV wider team.

9 To keep abreast of technological and commercial market developments and to inform senior management of any salient information.

 Person Specification:

1 Degree in Engineering or Physics.

2 Good English level.

3 Knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Power BI optional).

4 Organisational skills, reporting skills, attention to detail and good communication.

5 0-3 years' experience in PV and/or SCADA and/or Data Analyst: Knowledge in HV electrical, SCADA systems and photovoltaics is a bonus, but a self-learning, problem-solving personality is a must.

6 Familiarity with databases and big data management are welcomed. ???

GUYANCOURT
