Title:
Data Analyst Internship
Data Analyst Internship with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst Internship. Becoming the professional that you aspire to be

About The Internship

As a Data Analyst intern, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on mutiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Write efficient and scalable Python scripts for data processing, analysis, and automation
Work with JSON data structures for data interchange between systems and applications
Perform data analysis and modeling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities

Our story

Curiosity is one of the most helpful traits that will keep you sharp and optimistic. Always eager to learn something new. We stimulate that trait in every aspect of our daily work. Switzerland‚Äôs leader in telecommunications, known as Swisscom, continues to invest in future talents. We believe that these future professionals help to shape our world and the way we do our business. As an ICT provider that offers many different products to our highly diversified customer base, IT is key to serving our B2C and B2B customers. Currently, we are active in three countries when it comes to IT: Switzerland, The Netherlands, and Latvia. Besides our homeland, Switzerland, our local DevOps Centres in Rotterdam and Riga help us to provide quality software to support all of our projects. We work as one organization within these three locations and have an agile way of working.

Our promise

At Swisscom, we promise you that you will learn a lot of different things during your internship. With more than 60 nationalities working at our company, we are used to diversity and all its perks. We provide a professional and fun atmosphere in which to work and unwind. At Swisscom, it is the combination of your individual expertise and teamwork that will help us succeed. We respect each other, help each other out, and are not afraid to make mistakes. We make sure you can be the best version of yourself. Always.

Who are you?

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
Strong knowledge in Tableau for data visualisation
Programming skills in Python, with experience in libraries such as pandas, NumPy, and sciki
Familiarity with JSON for data exchange
Understanding of data analysis and modelling techniques
Ability to work with large datasets and perform complex data manipulations
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and teamwork abilities
Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment
You are already in the Netherlands
You are curious and responsible

Perks

750 ‚Ç¨ gross Monthly Allowance (Full time)
IT Equipment
Agile working environment and lean management instructor
Flexible working time model
Plenty of opportunities for training and personal development
International Environment
Holidays & time off

Contact

Do you have any questions or do you want to know why we love working at Swisscom? Feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager Pilar Moreno Alonso (pilar.morenoalonso@swisscom.com).

Please, submit your CV in English."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Hybrid role based in Warsaw, Poland

Role Overview üöÄ

At Uncapped, we help ambitious founders realise their dreams. We are growing rapidly and have a high-profile role to help drive our expansion operations around the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Uncapped.

As part of Uncapped team; you will be involved in building the next generation of products suited specifically for the needs of fast paced digital entrepreneurs. As we continue to expand globally; our goal is to have a team who are capable of getting the most out of our internal data and creating high-level business intelligent streams, while keeping our products ahead of the competition and powering new and exciting services that solve real problems for our customers.

As a dedicated Data analyst within our core product, you will be involved in regularly conducting analysis for all stakeholders. Your daily work will impact how and what we build; as well as drive the direction we are heading as a business. You will dive deeper into crucial team metrics, drive best practices and help scale our data governance. The insights generated from your datasets will crucial and used by the rest of the company to enable our growth globally.

About Uncapped üë´

Founded in 2019, Uncapped is the fastest, most affordable way for growing online businesses to fund marketing and inventory. The company was born out of frustration with the limited financing options available for UK and European entrepreneurs to finance growth.

Uncapped provides working capital loans to brands and retailers around the world, doing between $10m and $100m in turnover.

Uncapped has raised VC funding from most notable investors including Lakestar, Mouro Capital, Global Founders Capital, White Star Capital, Seedcamp, and All Iron Ventures.

What You Will Do ‚úçÔ∏è

Work closely with back-end developers to use existing infrastructure to collect data and surface insights to key stakeholders
Work with the Leadership team to define and create KPIs for tracking business metrics
Dig into our data to supply key stakeholders with data and insights to support their decision making
Ensure the performance and high quality of analysis by conducting data integrity checks and peer code reviews
Help resolve data queries through your own analysis, or by providing the infrastructure for others to resolve their issues themselves
Contribute by asking, learning, helping, growing


Our Tech Stack üíª

You will work with these technologies:

High proficiency in SQL
Google Cloud Platform for all of our analytics infrastructure
Dbt-like tool and BigQuery SQL for our data modelling and warehousing
Dataform for managing data pipelines
And, anything else you need.. 


Requirements

Who you are üëÄ

Someone experienced with getting messy data into shape for analysis
You have strong SQL skills and are adept at data visualisation
Experience working in a highly regulated environment (e.g. finance, gaming, food, health care)
Have previously used dbt, dataform or similar tooling
Used to AGILE ways of working (Kanban, Scrum)
Product-minded, always thinking of how their actions will ultimately impact the customer
Takes initiative and is adaptive and flexible


Benefits

What we offer üéÅ

At Uncapped, our people make us successful. We are a start-up with big goals, and we work hard, so we want to give everyone the benefits they really want. We are continually adding to this list as new people join -- here are some of the things you can expect:

Unlimited holiday: we believe that well-rested and happy people make the best employees
Competitive compensation plan
Personal growth fund: Raise your game from great to spectacular
Monthly recognition and awards: Celebrate wins big and small
The opportunity to make a big impact every day on the lives of European and US entrepreneurs
Optional workspaces in Warsaw, London and Atlanta


We can only consider applications from candidates who are eligible to work in Poland without requiring visa sponsorship.
Desired Skills and Experience
Analyst
data
data analyst
dataengineer"

Title:
Data Analyst - Barcelona (Remote)
Data Analyst - Barcelona (Remote)
Job Description:
"About the job
Gridwise is on a mission to improve the way people and goods move. We started by empowering the gig workers themselves who move us and our goods with our market-leading gig worker mobile application. Over time, we‚Äôve expanded our efforts to enable other key enterprises who impact people and goods movement - service providers, enterprises, retailers, and more - through our Gridwise Analytics mobility insights platform.

As the leading business application for gig economy drivers, Gridwise helps them maximize their earnings and track their performance across gig platforms, all in one place. We're a rapidly growing, venture-backed company that's developed market-leading solutions to enable gig workers and enterprises to leverage the most powerful gig mobility data insights in the industry.

By equipping one of the largest gig-driver networks in the mobility industry, representing 10% of all US gig drivers, Gridwise has amassed the most comprehensive gig mobility dataset out there. This means we're uniquely positioned to make waves in a $50B data-as-a-service opportunity through our B2B offering, Gridwise Analytics.

At Gridwise, we're on a mission to become the go-to operating platform for gig drivers and offer solutions that empower the entire ecosystem, improving the way people and goods move. We're proud to support a growing community of independent workers who are revolutionizing the mobility industry, one trip or delivery at a time.

The Role

Gridwise is seeking a highly motivated and versatile Data Analyst to join our Gridwise Analytics sales team to assist with the successful execution of prospecting and closing new customers and ensuring existing customer success. You will also support our go-to-market team by producing compelling data analyses and content that can be leveraged for inbound sales lead generation and establishing a strong industry presence.

You will combine your technical and analytical skills, your ability to clearly communicate compelling insights from data, and your business acumen to help our customers understand mobility trends and enhance their overall business intelligence and operational decision-making. You will work closely with our product and go-to-market teams to deliver data-driven insights that have a real-world impact for existing and future customers, and assist our success team to ensure that existing customers are maximizing value and ROI from our analytics products.

Must be willing to work US hours

What You're Responsible For

 Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns from our gig mobility datasets to support the prospecting and closing of new Gridwise Analytics customers
Create compelling analyses, reports, data visualizations, and dashboards to communicate meaningful findings both internally and externally
Develop hypotheses on how trends/insights from our data may impact customers and their industries, and communicate potential opportunities from this insight
Conduct analyses to answer specific customer questions and provide actionable insights and recommendations to customers that helps them maximize ROI from our data
Work with our success team and prospective customers throughout the data/product evaluation phase of the sales process to ensure the full potential of our data is realized
Support marketing and sales strategy development by demonstrating to marketing and sales teams how our analytics data can solve industry-specific pain points
Contribute to external-facing content such as customer proposals/presentations, technical documentation, blog articles, social media posts, white papers, and other marketing or sales collateral

What We're Looking For

4+ years of experience working as an Analyst capacity in support of a data product
Strong proficiency in SQL and ability to interact directly with databases, warehouses, and other cloud data stores
Proficiency in Python programming for data access, manipulation, analysis, and visualization
Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and communicate results with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively present findings and interact with both technical and business stakeholders
Ability to research and identify market trends, understand customer challenges, and present findings to internal and customer stakeholders

Exceptional candidates may have

Experience analyzing or working within the gig economy and mobility industries
Proficiency working with large geospatial and geographical datasets
Prior experience at early-to-mid stage startups or financial service firms
Experience supporting go-to-market and sales for data analytics products

Gridwise could be a good fit for you if you:

Are a self-starter who enjoys having autonomy in how they work
Want to work with authentic people who embody diversity and are true to ourselves
Want to be at a company that values your professional growth and empowerment
Are looking for a cohesive team that cares about each other‚Äôs well-being

Why do people work at Gridwise?

We are a remote-first culture - you work where you want and have flexibility on schedule
You're surrounded by smart people who work their ass off - and have fun while doing it!
Your work has a direct impact on the lives of gig workers and the way people and goods move at scale
Your professional growth is one of our core company values and is invested in by us

What We Offer

Competitive salary & equity
Work from home budget or paid membership at a remote coworking office
Flexible hours & lenient vacation policy
Monthly rideshare and delivery credits
Coffee subscription
Premium laptop/equipment"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst | Python, SQL | FinTech Company

Salary: circa 85k Gross Lev Annually (DOE) with a 10% bonus
Hybrid: 1-2 days in Sofia - flexible on this

I am seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join a prestigious FinTech company that delivers SaaS products offering real-time market feeds and pricing information comparable with platforms like Bloomberg and Reuters. With around 800 employees globally and headquartered in London, the company is at the forefront of financial technology.

Role: The Data Analyst will join a greenfield team and project in the midst of a new data ecosystem being built from scratch. This is a private equity investment-approved transformational project that is a great opportunity to help in many projects and set up foundations, frameworks, and CI/CD principles, from scratch. There are 8 people in the team working globally and the hiring manager is looking to bring this up to 15.

Python and/or SQL.

SQL

Power BI

My client is keen to get the Data Analyst on quickly so apply ASAP or get in touch!

Data Analysis & Reporting Internship
Data Analysis & Reporting Internship
Job Description:
"About the job
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

Work Schedule

Other

Environmental Conditions

Office

Job Description

Do you have a passion for innovative ideas and groundbreaking discoveries?

With over $1 billion invested annually in R&D, at Thermo Fisher Scientific you'll help solve some of the world's toughest challenges, from giving cancer patients hope, ensuring safe drinking water and helping law enforcement tackle cases through forensics. We empower our teams to put science into meaningful action and give our R&D colleagues the autonomy, resources and tools they need to take science a step beyond.

Location/Division Specific Information

We are a part of Thermo Fisher Scientific's Service group in the Materials and Structural Analysis Division. Our team operates across multiple locations, including Eindhoven, The Netherlands; Brno, Czech Republic; and Portland, OR, USA.

How to make a microscope?
Landing page Materials and Structural Analysis Division

Position Overview

Join our Serviceability team as a Service Readiness Automation Intern and gain hands-on experience in exploring data, developing interactive data visualizations, generating actionable insights, and communicating findings to team members. This position provides an outstanding opportunity to collaborate with industry experts, develop technical skills, and make meaningful contributions to our organization's success.

Key Responsibilities

Design and develop reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights.
Assist in sustaining and improvement of existing reports.
Collaborate with domain experts to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Engage in communication with end users and assist in training to ensure accurate interpretation and utilization of reports.
Document processes and methodologies for report development and maintenance.

Desired Qualifications

Currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree, preferrably in areas such as IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Willingness to learn, great work ethic.

Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a team environment.
Strong organizational and communication skills.
Proficiency in English, both spoken and written.

Benefits

Gain practical experience in report development, and project support with an opportunity to learn from industry professionals. We offer competitive remuneration and a range of employee benefits. Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects.

Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. A one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status."

Title:
Data Scientist - Product Analyst
Data Scientist - Product Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Hey, you!

Every month we have millions of sessions and hundreds of thousands of users on the platform. Our apps have more than a million downloads. Customers create thousands of orders every day in multiple countries.

But we want more and we need your help to achieve it.👍

What does a customer usually buy after adding cart eggs or tomatoes?

Which is the main cause of dropout of our customers during their navigation?

Which are the main optimizations of our shopper operations we could work on?

To answer all these questions (and a lot of other ones) to improve our product and solve the problems of our customers, shoppers and partners we‚Äôre looking for a Product Analyst to join our Data Science team.

This is a remote job opportunity for candidates based in Italy or in the Schengen area.

Who we are🌍🛒

Everli is Europe‚Äôs leading marketplace for online grocery shopping and one of its fastest growing scale-ups(part of the annualFinancial Times rankingfor four years in a row).

We are on a mission to deliver customers peace of mind with a trouble-free grocery experience they love and trust. We achieve our growth through a culture that iscollaborative,transparent,data-drivenandfocused on our mission.

Our rapidly growing and diverse international team (20 nationalities and counting) has offices located inItaly(with headquarters in Milan & Verona).

What You Will Do

You will join a distributed team of data scientists with decision-making autonomy: you will be responsible for your work
You will explore our data in order to find and test new product ideas: from customers‚Äô and shoppers‚Äô behaviors to logistic optimization and many others
You will support the Product team and stakeholders in deep diving their hypothesis and pursuing a data driven approach in order to prioritize activities and features

What We Offer

We offer a full-time permanent contract. The gross annual salary (RAL) is in the 32.000 - 42.000 EUR range. In addition to that, we have plenty of cool benefits:

Welfare Budget. You can use this credit for a wide selection of services (education, public transport, vacations and entertainment, wellness, culture etc)
Home Workstation Budget. You can purchase items you will use to build your own home workstation (such as an ergonomic chair, desk PC screen, desk footrest, desk lamp, mouse, mousepad, keyboard, professional headphones PC adapter)
Mental Health Support. You can start a psychotherapy path with Unobravo, with Everli fully covering the first five sessions of therapy
Discount on your grocery with Everli.com. Anytime you use our service to get your grocery, you can apply a reserveddiscount on your basket

What You Bring

Love for data and algorithms: you are proud of your work
2+ years of experience with data analysis and exploration
Experience with basic statistical techniques (i.e. clustering, hypothesis testing, ‚Ä¶) and desire to explore and learn new ones
Knowledge of technologies in our stack: Python, AWS, MySQL
Experience with BI tools like Tableau and Quicksight is a nice to have
Good understanding of business problems and ability to translate them into data analysis
Great communication and synthesis skills working closely with product managers, other teams and both internal and external stakeholders
Analytical, detail-focused mindset, but always looking at the big picture
Team player: you work well with other people within and outside the tech team
Positive & chill vibes. Meme skills is a nice to have 😁
Being able to legally work in Europe: you are the holder of an EU Passport or you are the holder of an EU residency permit or you are the holder of a Schengen Work Visa

Everli is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We foster an inclusive and diverse workplace. No matter who you are, what you look like or how many years ago you started your career: you will always be welcome in our team. Just like in a grocery store, diversity is richness!

Powered by JazzHR

j31dX1QqcT"

Title:
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Job Description:
"About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? Join our team as a Junior Power BI Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge BI tools, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to innovative projects that shape our business strategy. If you are eager to grow your career in data analytics and possess a keen eye for detail, we invite you to be part of our forward-thinking team. Unleash your potential and help us unlock the power of data!

Responsibilities:

Design dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and build business intelligence reports according to the needs.

Clean and ensure accuracy and integrity of data; review data for inconsistencies or anomalies.

Maintain dashboards to identify reporting issues or gaps and drive timely resolution.

Prepare clear and concise reports.

Development, optimization, and support of existing analytical reports.

Identify opportunities for improvements.

Implement the best practices in collaboration with other team members.

Requirements:

Strong data visualization (experience with Power BI or similar tools) and presentation skills.

Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.

Excel knowledge (incl. pivot tables, dashboard creation).

Ability to work with large volumes of data; extrapolate conclusions from a variety of data sources, both quantitative and qualitative.

Strong DAX & SQL knowledge, Python will be an advantage.

English proficiency (Upper Intermediate or higher)"

Title:
Product Data Analyst
Product Data Analyst

Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Similarweb is the leading digital intelligence platform used by over 3500 global customers. Our wide range of solutions power the digital strategies of companies like Google, eBay, and Adidas.

We help our customers succeed in today‚Äôs digital world by giving them access to data-driven insights, competitive benchmarks, strategic analysis, and more. In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven‚Äôt stopped growing since!

We are looking for a talented and dedicated data analyst who will be a part of the Data Integrity team.

As part of this role you will help us analyze large and complicated datasets. Conduct Data Investigation through a large variety of data processes and algorithms. And create tools for auto-analysis.

What does the day to day of a Data Analyst at Similarweb look like:

Launch Data Investigation for understanding discrepancies or inconsistencies in our data.
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and data mining to turn data into insights. 
Build and maintain tools to provide better and faster data support for our customers.
Conduct research and develop tools which will ensure the quality of Similarweb‚Äôs data and algorithms.

What will I bring to the team?

At least 3 years of work experience as a Data Analyst in an Online/Tech company.
At least 1 years experience in Python scripting 
Experience with SQL for data analysis 
Knowledge and understanding of the statistical principles, concepts, methods, and standards
Hadoop/Spark/AWS Infrastructure experience - Big Advantage
BA/B.Sc. in engineering, statistics or equivalent.
Excellent verbal and communication skills (in English) - Must
Team player, autodidact, fast learner with excellent analytical, research and business skills.
Passionate about data.

*All Similarweb offices work in a hybrid model, so you can enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the benefits of building face to face connections with fellow Similarwebbers.*

About The Team

Our Data Integrity team is located in Israel HQ offices managing all the data related issues. As we are a ‚Äúone stop shop‚Äù for data integrity, we take pride in our professionalism in multiple areas of our product, our knowledge sharing between the members of the team. Every member who will join will feel right at home and find out how much we learn from each other, and we are looking forward to enriching our family!

Why You‚Äôll Love Being a Similarwebber

You‚Äôll actually love the product you work with: Our customers aren‚Äôt our only raving fans. When we asked our employees why they chose to come work at Similarweb, 99% of them said ‚Äúthe product.‚Äù Imagine how exciting your job is when you get to work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world.

You‚Äôll find a home for your big ideas: We encourage an open dialogue and empower employees to bring their ideas to the table. You‚Äôll find the resources you need to take initiative and create meaningful change within the organization.

We offer competitive perks & benefits: We take your well-being seriously, and offer competitive compensation packages to all employees. We also put a strong emphasis on community, with regular team outings and happy hours.

You can grow your career in any direction you choose: Interested in becoming a VP or want to transition into a different department? Whether it‚Äôs Career Week, personalized coaching, or our ongoing learning solutions, you‚Äôll find all the tools and opportunities you need to develop your career right here.Diversity isn‚Äôt just a buzzword: People want to work in a place where they can be themselves. We strive to create a workplace that is reflective of the communities we serve, where everyone is empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race, gender, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, age, religion, spirituality, identity and experience. We believe our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global, more diverse, and more digital every day.

We will handle your application and information related to your application in accordance with the Applicant Privacy Policy available here ."

Title:
Data Analyst (Remote)
Data Analyst (Remote)
Job Description:
"About the job
About Ignit

Ignit innovates the digital world. We are a team of creative, open-minded experts who work daily on solutions to help our clients grow their business. We are driven by people, technology, and culture.

By taking full ownership and leadership in designing, developing, and quality-assuring complete solutions we ensure the satisfaction of our clients.

We exist to help our customers bring their ideas to life and our success lies in working closely with customers and understanding the context of their business. We innovate with you and for you. With the best digital minds, we combine design and technology to transform ideas into reality. Using agile methodologies, we create great user experiences on mobile, web, and cloud.

We're looking for a Data Analyst

In this role, you will be responsible for turning data into information, information into insight and insight into understandable and strategic decision for some of the global products that we work on. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions. With us, you‚Äôll work with top-notch technologies utilizing cloud providers like AWS, Google and visualization tools like Looker and QuickSight.

Your daily tasks on the job / You are responsible for

Interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques and providing ongoing reports regarding products performance 
Gaining product and consumer behavior insights from real data and finding patterns and relationships in data 
Identifying, analysing and communicating findings through effective data visualizations and reports 
Ensuring the quality, reliability of created reports and workflows 
Collaborating with other teams of engineers, developers, architects, data engineers, data scientists and marketers across various projects and stages in the project lifecycle 


Must have technical skills:

Excellent knowledge of SQL 
Experience with relational and non-relational databases, i.e. Google BigQuery 
Experience in data visualization using tools like QuickSight, Looker 
Team-minded with good communication skills 
Experience in working in an agile, international surrounding 
Strong analytical thinking and structured problem-solving skills 


Nice to have:

Knowledge in any other AWS, Google cloud services.

Equipment supplied:

MacBooks, monitors, headphones, etc. Basically, whatever you need to stay at your best.


Methodology:

Agile Management: Scrum, Agile 
Issue tracking tool: Jira 
Knowledge repository: Confluence 


Pay range (gross):

Mid 2200 - 3500 EUR
Senior 3500 - 4600 EUR


Benefits:

Competitive salary
Yearly bonus
Christmas allowance
International projects
Large scale projects, impact on millions of consumers around the world
Subsidized recreation
Educational budget
Paid additional health insurance, including an annual medical examination
Paid sick leave


Perks in the office:

Free coffee, fruits, and snacks
No dress code
Startup atmosphere & flat organization
Fun and games budget"

Title:
Traineeship Data & Analytics
Traineeship Data & Analytics

HR Data Analyst
HR Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
We are looking for a talented HR Data Analyst to join our team in our Paris or Montpelier office (Hybrid work possible).

You will report to the Global Rewards Director and your main goal will be to shape and infuse a data-driven culture within the HR department of Teads. You will promote data accuracy, drive digitalization, and provide actionable insights to support strategic HR decisions.

What will you do?

As an HR Data Analyst attached to the Total Rewards team, your goal is to help infuse a data-driven culture in the HR department of Teads.

Data Management: Maintain and clean HR databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Optimize data flows and ensure compliance with data protection standards.
Reporting & Analytics: Clean and maintain the HR database using our HRIS and other HR systems (e.g., BambooHR, ATS, Performance Management), improve, optimize, streamline, and automate HR data flows through the integration of multiple APIs, ensure employee data processing adheres to stringent data protection standards for various strategic and legal requirements (e.g., audits, shareholders, leadership, HR, unions, stakeholders), and develop a deeper understanding of internal and external data management, including predictive models.
Insights & Performance: Deliver HR Key Indicators aligned with HR Roadmap, and Business strategy ensuring harmonized analytics across 35+ countries and diverse markets. Maintain, and improve BI Dashboards to support stakeholders in the decision-making regarding People & Reward management (salary cost/budget, reward campaigns, staff HC/mouvements, surveys‚Ä¶) and ad hoc analysis. Make recommendations to assess people and rewards program's effectiveness for continuous improvement.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Build strong partnerships with HR, Finance, IT, Innovation and other key contributors. Manage stakeholders‚Äô expectations to ensure a cohesive alignment of practices with overarching business strategies and financial considerations.

What will you bring to the team?

Master's Engineering degree in Technology, Business Intelligence, Data Science (Bac +5) with a strong interest in HR. 
Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets (AppScript/TypeScript) or Excel (VBA-SQL), Database management (Access levels, data accuracy) and Data visualization tools (Looker, PowerBi‚Ä¶).
Fluent English with excellent communication skills
First experience in BI, Reporting, Data Analytics as an intern and/or apprentice would be appreciated.
Passionate about agile methodologies.
User support-oriented mindset and proactive approach.
Curious, fast learner and strong attention to details.
Experience with data architecture, managing multiple APIs, HR information system (Core, ATS, ideally Bamboo, Greenhouse and/or Anaplan) will be a plus

About Teads

Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media. As an end-to-end solution, Teads‚Äô modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies.

For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world‚Äôs best publishers and content providers. Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.

Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Description

About Liferay

Liferay is a uniquely profitable B2B enterprise software company with 1,200+ fiery-eyed employees all across Europe, the Americas, the Middle East, Asia, and Africa. As a renowned provider of enterprise open source technologies, we have been recognized by Gartner for empowering businesses around the world to solve complex digital challenges. Liferay Experience Cloud is an all-in-one solution that unites our Liferay DXP and cloud platform capabilities with built-in analytics and B2B commerce functionality, reducing the time to market and allowing for accelerated innovation - serving notable customers across the globe such as Airbus, US Bank, Honda, and Desjardins.

But we don‚Äôt just make awesome software, we are also fueled by a greater-than-profit vision. By building a vibrant business, making technology useful, and investing in communities, we make it possible for people to reach their full potential to serve others. We give our employees five days off to volunteer at charities they‚Äôre excited about, and Liferay donates 10% of our profits to charities around the world. Oh, we‚Äôre also self-funded which gives us the freedom to work on whatever we think brings the most value to customers and communities in the long run!

About You And This Role

You have that rare ability to bridge two worlds, the human and the technical. You can draw out complex ideas

from stakeholders and distill them into achievable goals. You understand the synergy between requirements

and test plans and are experienced in driving product improvements from requirements gathering till

completion. You like being given the space to run in a global open source company to help deliver creations

that are intuitive and sharp. Sounds like you? Apply now and let‚Äôs chat.

Key Objectives

Support data collection efforts by identifying relevant data sources and working with stakeholders to understand their data needs.
Assist in data cleaning, transformation, and preparation for analysis using your SQL techniques.
Perform basic data analysis under guidance, identifying trends and patterns.
Support the creation of clear and informative reports and dashboards to monitor key metrics as well as maintain current dashboards and reports used to support critical business monitoring goals.
Convey insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations.
Collaborate with team members and cross functional teams to understand and support ongoing projects.
Assist in the development of self-service tools and internal documentation resources.
Seek opportunities to learn and apply new data analysis techniques and tools.
Contribute to a culture of data-driven decision making.

Required Qualifications

 3+ years of work experience in Data Analysis, Business Analysis or relevant experience in analytical tasks or projects working with data.
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders and prioritizing competing requests.
Experience rolling out BI tools/metrics at a global level managing relationships with cross functional teams
Excellent decision-making, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
Team player, with strong interpersonal skills and skilled in developing collaborative relationships.
Self-starter, quick learner, detail-oriented and proactive in completing responsibilities.
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:

BI Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
We are looking for a highly experienced BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team. The candidate is expected to live and breathe data and must be adept in SQL along with being an expert in data visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI.

You‚Äôre an all-around BI person. You‚Äôre the sort of person to deliver powerful data viz and tell unique stories through data. You‚Äôre the person to deliver great recommendations to data modeling and reporting solutions. Most of all, you must have a certain level of attention to detail in spotting data inconsistencies.

You will have an opportunity to:
Work with a range of business verticals in providing state-of-the-art dashboards, ensuring a consistent design and developing a key approach for analytics
Create recommendations for data modeling design for reporting solutions 
Break down implementations in tangible modules
Use your expertise in database concepts and data warehousing
Identify points to improve the ways we deliver solutions to stakeholders

To be successful in this role, you need to have:
Experience working with BI Tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or other related software
Experience working within the BI domain
Advanced skills in designing, implementing, and optimizing data sources
Experience in Dashboards/Reports performance tuning
Understanding of data representation design
Advanced SQL skills to query complex databases from different transactional systems and data warehouses
Experience deploying secure enterprise self-service reporting services using various data visualization tools
iGaming experience is an advantage

Working in a brand-new office in Tallinn √úlemiste City

Our Business Intelligence team makes information accessible. Together with the right technology, we deliver the foundation for highly automated and effective CRM solutions.

As we strive to achieve our mission, we reaffirm our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI). Title:
Product Data Analyst To Retail Bi & Analytics ‚Äì Decide & Go Value Stream
Product Data Analyst To Retail Bi & Analytics ‚Äì Decide & Go Value Stream with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.

The mission of the Retail Unit at Sales is to grow and transform the portfolio by building exceptional store experiences ‚Äì securing high productivity, financial resilience and a strong brand. This is done through holistic retail strategies, fueled by tech innovation and enabled through our global network of teams and partners.

Job Description

The Retail BI & Analytics team is a team gathering data competencies within the newly formed Retail unit including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Analysts. The Product Data Analyst works closely together with the product teams, structured as Value Streams, within the Retail Tech department. The role includes supporting the Value Stream in setting KPIs and creating business cases for the products in that product area, as well as conducting data analysis, A/B testing and creating the BI reports needed to evaluate the product performance and guide the Value Stream‚Äôs work forward.

As a Product Data Analyst working towards the Decide & Go Value Stream, you will be a key enabler to explore and support data driven product development for the checkout products in store: physical and self-checkout, as well as mobile checkout solutions. You will build BI dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs, perform A/B tests, provide analysis and insights to support your colleagues with data and insight-driven decision making on strategic directions.

In the role you will:

Be a crucial person for your colleagues to understand how our product development impacts the business
Proactively support product development with analytical insights and recommendations which helps to drive innovations and achieve strategic advantage
Perform analysis on large sets of data to extract impactful insights that will inform and guide development efforts within the Value Stream as well as supporting in creating and following up on business cases related to the products within he Value Stream
Support the product teams within the Value Stream with setting KPIs and following up on performance through reporting and A/B testing
Translate business requirements into analytical requirements and design analytics and reporting solutions together with global business stakeholders as well as regions to maximize their impact
Interact and influence the analytical community within H&M to explore and enable new data areas to realize even more business potential


Qualifications

As a person we believe that you are a true role model of H&M values and that you are an ambitious, flexible and communicative team player. Your positive drive and curiosity sees the potential and opportunities in our way of working and wants to understand, test, scale and learn. By having a business and customer-oriented mindset with the motivation to constantly improve, achieve targets and drive agenda forward you are key player in the team. You like taking responsibility, prioritize and enjoy working in a changing environment

Additionally, we see that:

You have an academic degree in a quantitative field, such as engineering, business, economics, finance or math/statistics
You have developed strong analytical skills through relevant work experience with at least three years of experience working as Data Analyst, Product Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar roles
You are experienced in using programming languages like R or Python for data analysis
You have deep knowledge in how to use tools such as Power BI and SQL and are confident in working with large data sets and extracting data by writing complex queries.
You have experience in A/B testing
You are a clear communicator who can easily translate complex analytical methods to business stakeholders and are comfortable in presenting results of your analyses to different stakeholders
You are a team player and enjoy sharing your knowledge with colleagues


Additional Information

This is a permanent role, based in Stockholm and reporting to Tobias Klingberg, Head of Retail BI & Analytics. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV through this job posting. If you have any questions about the role and/or the process, please contact Sarah Assem.

H&M Group is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age. 

At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Why kindly ask you to not attach cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases."

Title:
Product Data Analyst
Product Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families worldwide raise amazing kids through playlearning‚Ñ¢.

Through play and interactive technology, Lingokids delivers premium, modern learning through educational subjects and life skills so kids can thrive as confident, conscious, resilient, lifelong learners ‚Äî ready for school and today‚Äôs ever-changing world.

Are you ready for Playlearning?‚Ñ¢

We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Product Data Analyst to join our team who is passionate about analysing data, identifying trends, and making recommendations to improve our growth strategies. As a key member of our team, you will work closely with Product Managers to improve user experience.

Responsibilities
Analyse user and interaction data to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to product usage and growth.
Collaborate with product managers to develop A/B testing strategies, implement tests, and analyse results to optimise product features and user flows.
Create reports and dashboards that track key performance indicators (KPIs) for product and monetisation.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on data analysis to drive product improvements and growth strategy adjustments.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, tools, and practices related to product led growth and monetisation.
Own analytics projects E2E. Define business problems, translate into data approaches for yourself and more junior members of the team, and deliver insight and tools that will drive change.

Desired experience
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Marketing or a related field.
Proven experience working in a similar role, focusing on product or monetisation and data analysis in a fast growth business.
You have deep expertise in data focussed tools (e.g., SQL, Python) and techniques, and have a history of delivering impactful projects form from start to finish.
Experience with data analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Looker) and A/B testing tools and techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and persuasive manner.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Creative problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
You‚Äôre a bright, high calibre candidate who enjoys working in a warm, fast-paced and collaborative environment.

English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English so, we don't care about certificates, but we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.

You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. We have become a fully remote company so, we believe that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.

Experience working closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine requirements and bring them to life is a must.


Life at Lingokids
üè° Remote working: you can choose to work remotely from within your country or visit our offices if you live in Madrid.
‚öñÔ∏è Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.
üìà Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.
üåç Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.
üìö Professional growth: up to ‚Ç¨2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.
üí¨ Language lessons: language learning is what we‚Äôre all about! We‚Äôll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.
ü©∫ Health Insurance: we offer an optional health insurance through Adeslas, featuring competitive rates to ensure your well-being.
üß† Mental Health Support: we offer you 4 free TherapySide sessions to support your self-awareness and well-being
üí≥ Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll (we use Cobee).
üç≤ Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60‚Ç¨ allowance on your Cobee card for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services.
üñ• Home office setup: you'll have a 400‚Ç¨ allowance in your first payroll to set up your home office and a 35‚Ç¨ monthly allowance for remote expenses.
üôå Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360¬∫ assessment every 6 months.

If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!"

Title:
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Job Description:
"About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? Join our team as a Junior Power BI Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge BI tools, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to innovative projects that shape our business strategy. If you are eager to grow your career in data analytics and possess a keen eye for detail, we invite you to be part of our forward-thinking team. Unleash your potential and help us unlock the power of data!

Responsibilities:

Design dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and build business intelligence reports according to the needs.

Clean and ensure accuracy and integrity of data; review data for inconsistencies or anomalies.

Maintain dashboards to identify reporting issues or gaps and drive timely resolution.

Prepare clear and concise reports.

Development, optimization, and support of existing analytical reports.

Identify opportunities for improvements.

Implement the best practices in collaboration with other team members.

Requirements:

Strong data visualization (experience with Power BI or similar tools) and presentation skills.

Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.

Excel knowledge (incl. pivot tables, dashboard creation).

Ability to work with large volumes of data; extrapolate conclusions from a variety of data sources, both quantitative and qualitative.

Strong DAX & SQL knowledge, Python will be an advantage.

English proficiency (Upper Intermediate or higher)"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst

Business Data Analyst
Business Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
At SwissBorg, our mission is to build a spectrum of investment experiences that help people redefine wealth. Our app has over 790,000+ verified users, offering the best price and liquidity across 16 fiat currencies to buy 90+ cryptocurrencies. Users can earn yield, diversify their portfolios with our themed crypto bundles, and gain access to exclusive alpha investment opportunities. Our community is rapidly expanding, with more than $1.4 billion in assets held in the app and over 51,000 premium users.

Join us in shaping the future of finance, pushing the boundaries of what's possible, and transforming the way people manage their wealth. Whether you‚Äôre in Austria or Taiwan, and whether your portfolio is worth one dollar or a million, SwissBorg provides the best tools to learn about digital currencies and manage your wealth effectively.

Join the team to help revolutionise the world together!

We are seeking a talented and driven Business Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategies and driving growth.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of decision-making, unlocking valuable insights from data and transforming them into actionable recommendations. If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making, problem-solving, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!

What you might be doing:


Identify Business Opportunities: Take the lead in exploring new business opportunities for our products and services. Utilise your analytical skills to generate hypotheses and assess the potential benefits of each opportunity, providing valuable insights and driving strategic decisions
App User Activity Analysis: Dive deep into user activity within our app to uncover meaningful patterns, correlations, or bottlenecks. Your keen eye for detail will be essential in identifying areas for improvement and optimising user experiences
Data-Driven Insights: Leverage various data analysis techniques to transform raw data into actionable insights. Your ability to draw meaningful conclusions will be instrumental in guiding the company towards growth and success
Collaboration and Implementation: Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement and measure the impact of the most promising opportunities. Your role as a liaison between the data team and business squads will be essential in ensuring seamless communication and execution
Data Ambassador: Be the primary point of contact and ambassador for the data team within specific business squads. Your expertise will play a crucial role in aligning data-related objectives with overall business goals
Continuous Learning: Exhibit a hunger for knowledge and continuously strive to ask relevant and insightful questions. Embrace new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis processes




What you might bring:


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of delivering data-driven insights to influence business decisions
Excellent communication and presentation abilities to convey data insights in a clear and understandable manner
Proficiency in SQL 
Experience with data analysis in Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib) 
Experience with statistics (A/B testing, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing) is a plus
Ability to collect, organise, and analyse large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to detail. 
Independent and proactive, have the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment




Why you should apply: 


 Freedom to build the company of your dreams
 Learn with (super cool) experts in finance, engineering, AI, psychology and business
 BORG bonus based on our meritocratic system
 Flexible working hours
 25 working days of vacation + local holidays
 We'll provide you with a MacBook and a cutting edge tech stack to help you do your best work
 Annual company and team retreats - We'd love to see you at the next one!
 Continuous learning and development opportunities




If our job description speaks to you, but you don‚Äôt feel like you meet 100% of the requirements, apply anyway! You may have skills we didn‚Äôt even know we needed.

At SwissBorg, we embrace diversity. We strongly believe that getting the best outcome requires different perspectives and backgrounds. We‚Äôre committed to openness, curiosity and creating an inclusive culture because we know that diverse teams build better products and generate better ideas. We strongly encourage applications from everyone!

Familiarising yourself with our product is crucial for anyone looking to join our team. Please make sure to test the app, explore our blog for the latest developments, and follow our Careers Page, LinkedIn, and X for regular company updates!"

Title:
Junior Data Analyst
Junior Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
PIPECARE POLAND is currently looking for Junior Data Analyst to join our office in Warsaw.

By providing technology and service focused solutions to the international arena of the oil and gas industry, the PipeCare Group of companies has been helping our customers ensure the integrity of their pipeline and facility assets for over 20 years. Due to our global focus and international growth, Pipecare is seeking experienced Junior Data Analyst to support our continued growth in Europe.

The general role for the Junior Data Analyst includes assisting the DA department to identify the obstructions in the pipeline in dedicated software. The responsibility of the Junior Data Analyst is to ensure that all DA tasks and DA projects related to his/her local subsidiary are executed according to the plan, corporate standards and policy approved by the Corporate Office.

Key Responsibilities & Authorities

 Checking the data quality of ILI runs
 UT Data Analysis
 Reviewing the software inter phase
 Reviewing software user manuals
 Preparing/Reviewing DAD quality documentation
 To ensure accurate tool sensitivity values are provided to TM in Tool Checklist
 To prepare a specific Run assessment report
 To identify obstructions in the pipeline; to produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report (if applicable)
 To inform HO-DAD about the results and/or to implement the results into the reports
 To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
 To alert the R&D regarding the software problems
 To update the documentation
 To produce updated standard quality procedures
 To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding the software problems
 Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role

Accountability

 Assisting Data Analysts to identify the obstructions in the pipeline
 Ensure that all tasks and projects related to his/her local subsidiary are executed according to the plan, corporate standards and policy approved by the Corporate Office

Skills/Experience Required

 High school diploma or higher (preferred but not limited to from petrochemical background; pipeline integrity; GIS field, etc.)
 Process analysis, requirement / functional specification development experience
 Quality assurance of databases, reporting experience
 Experience of working on large, complex and multiple databases
 Proficient in using analytical tools and instruments for instance Excel, Microsoft Access, Minitab and SPSS
 High ability to work with numbers
 Strong written and verbal communication skills
 Analytical mind which is able to process information logically
 Professional level of English language

Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Powered by JazzHR

Title:
QHSE Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d)
QHSE Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d)
Job Description:
"About the job
MISSION: data analysis support to the Global SVP of QHSE

Tasks

Creation/generation of database models, statistics and data analysis.
Drawing conclusions and reporting on the data obtained.
Making presentations of the analysed data in computer programmes. Drawing clear and concise ideas that are easy to interpret and visualise. Making graphs, tables...
Finding information on different platforms to subsequently analyse and extrapolate it.

Your Profile

Having finished a degree in Engineering, IT or similar studies in the last three years ago.
High English Level
Willingness to do an Internship.

Title:
Internship: Data Scientist - Quantitative Investment Research (m/f/d)
Internship: Data Scientist - Quantitative Investment Research (m/f/d)
Job Description:
"About the job
Your Mission

This internship provides you with the opportunity to become part of our Asset Allocation Team with a focus on data science for quantitative investment strategies.

The Asset Allocation Team identifies relative performance opportunities in international multi-asset markets for tactical portfolio decisions. Applying Machine Learning to Asset Pricing problems helps us to discover non-linear relationships between the macroeconomic environment, market sentiment, and systemic risk.

During your internship, you will work closely with our specialists in quant finance and machine learning engineering. Within our supportive team environment you will have the opportunity to take ownership and full end-to-end responsibility.

Your tasks

Work intensively on the development and continuous enhancement of our cutting-edge, ML-based, systematic investment strategies as part of our Asset Allocation Team
Be involved in the further development and implementation (e.g., conducting experiments as well as evaluations) of our hypothesis-driven research agenda along key building blocks (e.g., data, transformations, model(s), targets) relevant for product performance
Work closely with our senior quant finance and machine learning experts
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code in Python

Your Skillset

Currently pursuing a degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or Economics/Finance with quantitative focus
Solid knowledge of data analytics in Python as well as corresponding state-of-the-art tools and frameworks
Experience in working with data, building quantitative models, data-driven decision-making
Strong foundation in or willingness to learn software engineering principles, and a commitment to developing high-quality code that aligns with industry best practices
Proactive and independent workstyle
Strong interpersonal skills and a real passion for working in a team environment
Passion for quantitative investing
Fluent in spoken and written English, good communication skills
Bonus: Proficiency with Git, the distributed version control system that‚Äôs integral to collaborative coding endeavors

Why us?

An exciting and involving role with significant impact on shaping the future of AI-based sustainable investing
A company culture that is based on a spirit of cooperation and is characterized by a high level of quality awareness, openness and attention to detail in all areas of our work
The opportunity to work in an interdisciplinary team with our experienced quant finance, software engineering and machine learning experts
A modern loft office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg, healthy food (including coffee, juices, fruit, vegetables, sandwiches) and high-end hardware from Apple 
Internal workshops, unique learning possibilities across a wide range of domains as well as amazing team events
Benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Fitness First as well as corporate benefits

About Us

We are a deep tech pioneer, providing AI-based investment solutions to our clients. Building on the best practices of quantitative asset management we tap the potential of machine learning for sustainable investments on capital market.

Our interdisciplinary team consists of experts in the fields of finance, computer science, software engineering, machine learning as well as mathematics, physics, and neuroscience. Ultramarin is embedded in the global AI community, through a close exchange with leading universities and as a member of Inquire Europe.

To date Ultramarin is one of the leading drivers for AI-based analyses and decision-making processes in asset management. Ultramarin has been founded in 2017, is headquartered in Berlin, with additional locations in Frankfurt and Munich, and is backed by leading international business angels and VCs."

Title:
Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do

Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making


Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English


What We Offer

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child‚Äôs sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to ‚Ç¨1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners"
