Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst

Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification

Data Analyst/Data Scientist with Python and SQL
Data Analyst/Data Scientist with Python and SQL with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

Mobica | Be Extraordinary_

Mobica helps businesses build pioneering experiences for their customers. Headquartered in Manchester UK with offices across Europe and US, we partner with businesses across multiple industries - from aerospace to finance and semiconductors to automotive - providing them with access to incredible talent and engineering expertise across the entire technology stack

Mobica Way

Well-known Clients and Projects focused on the Technologies of Tomorrow - our work is already all around you. Almost all of our long term customers are instantly recognisable global brands developing some of the most interesting products and services you are using today and will use in the future. Our expertly crafted software underpins many of today‚Äôs amazing customer experiences. When you join us, you'll be both challenged and supported, and you'll be a part of something extraordinary. 
Empowered Mobicans driving their own careers ‚Äì we empower our people to develop their skills and move forward in their careers. Our people are treated like partners, are encouraged to share knowledge and push the boundaries. We are there to help you with the opportunities to advance, learn and grow.
Ideas are prioritised over Hierarchy and Biases - in Mobica you are listened to and valued. We are building open communication and a safe environment. We've made it our mission to create a working environment where all team members feel welcome, protected from discrimination and have access to equal opportunities. 
We believe that employees should be happy ‚Äì Mobica is a place where talented minds are recognised, nurtured and valued. We are early adopters of the hybrid working practices, you define the way where you work more productive - at home or in the office - we will create the environment for that. In addition to the competitive salary you are getting access to a range of virtual, offline and on-site events and platforms where you can learn, brainstorm, challenge, express yourself or simply have some fun and get new friends. Fruit and snacks are in the office to make your mood good. 

Job Description

Join a team at the forefront of technology and innovation, committed to reshaping the landscape of internet connectivity. We're part of a pioneering company recognized for delivering fast, reliable, and fairly-priced internet services across the United States, leveraging the latest technologies and methodologies. Our mission centers on providing an unmatched online experience, marked by rapid service delivery, cutting-edge speed, and unwavering reliability.

Position Information

As a Data Analyst within our dynamic team, your role is pivotal in enhancing the security and efficacy of our data management systems. You will be instrumental in conducting full lifecycle data analysis, from gathering requirements and designing algorithms to developing and optimizing our database pipeline architectures. Your insights will drive improvements and inform strategic decisions, ensuring our data processes align perfectly with business objectives.

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement algorithms to transform vast datasets into actionable insights.
Develop, test, and maintain robust database architectures to support our analytical needs.
Collaborate closely with engineering leads, product managers, and architects to ensure the seamless execution of projects.
Engage in continuous learning to stay ahead of emerging technologies, assessing their potential impact on our operations and spearheading their integration.
Ensure the integrity and availability of data, actively monitoring system performance and recommending solutions to enhance data management practices.

Qualifications

Qualifications:

5+ years of experience working as Data Analyst
Proven expertise in SQL, Python, numpy & pandas and experience working with massive datasets.
Experience in data modelling, statistics
Strong background in developing applications on Linux platforms.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies, emphasizing rapid development cycles and continuous improvement.
A Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Information Technology, or related fields.

You will be required to attend the team calls twice a week in the evening hours due to PST time zone of the customer.

Additional Information

We offer

Competitive salary package
Flexible working hours
Opportunity to work from home
Training and mentoring programs
Ability to advance your technology skills
Variety of projects with the cutting edge technologies at the core
Private medical care and life insurance

Diversity and Inclusion Statement

We aim to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people we can find, from a range of backgrounds and cultures. Inclusivity and equality are cornerstones of our Mobica community and a big part of what makes us so brilliant to work with. Here, dedication and performance are valued and rewarded regardless of nationality, gender, age, religious beliefs or other personal characteristics. Here, diversity is celebrated and everyone belongs.

‚ÄúThe benefits of having a diverse workforce from different backgrounds, recruited and developed only on the basis of ability, is a core personal belief for me - so I join with other members of Mobica‚Äôs leadership in promoting a commitment to recognise equal opportunities and rights for our talented individuals. Every Mobican can expect to be treated with dignity and respect regardless of personal characteristics or beliefs.‚Äù

Gary Butters

CEO

Mobica | Be Extraordinary_

Join the visionaries - Be Extraordinary"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
What is your role?

Would you like to be a part of the discussion about the best way to run the dairy business of the future? Would you find it interesting to figure out which performance indicators are key to ensuring that dairy farmers too can run their businesses optimally? Does clearly identifying the mutual correlations within all our data on animal health, automated feeding, reproduction and rations sound like a stimulating challenge to you? Do you also have ample experience of data analysis (agricultural industry, robotics, machines or IoT devices) and are you looking for a meaningful job in which you can make an essential contribution to an innovative and sustainable mission?

If so, please read on!

Thanks to the more than 30,000 (real-time) users of our management system, we already have plenty of big data on hand. As a data specialist, you will know better than anyone how to identify the correlations that will form the starting point for new plans and ideas. Quite cool, isn't it? As well as deploying your in-depth expertise on data analysis, you will be helping your team to monitor the progress of their project and the quality of their solutions.

Good communication skills are essential, as is an ability to tell a story in an inspiring fashion.

Since you will be collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science departments, some knowledge of these areas is also desirable. If you would really like to make a difference and feel this challenge is right up your street, we would love to hear from you!

What is your experience?

Education to higher vocational or university level.
Capability to think conceptually and advise stakeholders accordingly.
Experience as a Data Analyst (knowledge of dairy farming data would be an asset).
Experience in visualisation (acquired by working with e.g. Tableau, QlickView or PowerBI).
Experience with processing data (SQL, Python).
Experience with PySpark would be a great asset!
Knowledge of statistics and research methods.
You can translate questions from stakeholders into solutions.
You can advise stakeholders on how to use the insights you generate.

What do we offer you?

To address the food demand and challenge for 2050, it is crucial to handle people, animals, and the environment responsibly. For us, this means being a reliable long-term partner for our customers and passing on the world to the next generation through sustainable product development. You can contribute to realizing this dream.

What can you expect in your role as a Data Analyst?

Working in an international work environment within one of the most innovative organizations in the Netherlands and also the largest robot producer in Europe. 
Excellent employment conditions, including up to 8 weeks of vacation and a salary of up to ‚Ç¨5300,- with room for growth within the scale. 
Opportunities for growth where you are in charge of your own development. 
Space and freedom to innovate, bring in new ideas, and undertake initiatives. We not only offer this, but we also genuinely expect it. It's up to you to come up with ideas and implement them. 
A team with enthusiastic, helpful colleagues, collaborating with product development, procurement, and other stakeholders. 
Our Lely Academy offers various training programs, such as personality training or more job-relevant training. If you want to develop yourself but it's not in the curriculum, you discuss it with your manager. 
The #FitatLely program with our own Lely Gym. A volleyball court, basketball court, football table, and ping pong table where you can challenge your colleagues or take a break from work. 
Lease-a-Bike scheme to lease a new bike affordably. 
Additionally, enjoy the services and wide range of coffee and tea from our personal barista at the Lely Campus, who makes the tastiest cappuccinos from fresh milk, directly from our own farmer from the Lely Orbiter, for example. 
A healthy work-life balance with a hybrid policy where you are 60% on Campus. This is flexible and can be arranged in consultation with your manager. Prefer more time on our modern Campus? You are always welcome (between 06:00 a.m. and 08:00 p.m.).
Moreover, we love to celebrate. Whether it's an anniversary or our Christmas party, at Lely, we know how to celebrate! For a feel of the atmosphere, check out this video: 

If you want to know more about working at Lely or about the vacancy, please contact me or respond via the button.

Recruitment & selection agency, consultancy, and/or staffing agency? 

We appreciate the interest, but we recruit all our candidates directly. We understand that as intermediaries, you want to present candidates for our great positions and contribute to our ambitions, but this is not how we have set up our recruitment process. This means that all unsolicited profiles offered on Lely vacancies will be treated as direct applications.

About Lely

Lely, founded in 1948, directs all its efforts towards creating a sustainable, profitable and enjoyable future in farming. Circling the cow, the company develops premium robotics and data systems that increase animal welfare, flexibility and the production on the dairy farm. For more than 75 years, Lely has been leading in the sale and service of automated milking systems to successive generations of dairy farmers across the globe. Every day, Lely inspires her employees to offer customers innovative solutions and be a reliable partner for long-term advice and support. With her Head office in The Netherlands and a worldwide network of dedicated Lely Center locations for tailor-made sales and support, the Lely Group is active in more than 40 countries and employs around 2300 people."

Title:
Power BI Data Modelling Analyst
Power BI Data Modelling Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Power BI Data Modelling Analyst 
Any location within Spain 
Hybrid/Remote way of working

Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true impact? Do you enjoy working on projects that combine data and business intelligence? Are you a storyteller, familiar with the use of data and interactive visuals to translate patterns and insights into creative business reports?  If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!

As our future Power BI Data Modelling Analyst:

You will be responsible for the modeling and consumption of Data using MySQL and/or Oracle.
You will collaborate on the creation of data models in Power BI, cooperating with the data engineers of the data virtualization layer to establish a consistent data flow end-to-end.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of data flows using Power Query and M language in Power BI.
You will interact with the customer to get the functional requirements and translate them into technical ones.
You will be responsible for the maintenance of the data models in Power BI following best practices and standards across the industry.
You will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports and dashboards in Power BI, including design, implementation, testing, security level, and data modeling.
You will interact with the stakeholders to detect and solve issues or needs related to the platform.

Your profile

You have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Telecommunications or Computer Engineering, and at least 1 year of experience with Power BI, preferably within the IT and/or consultancy industry and working on projects related to data and data warehouse in Microsoft Technologies, so the Power BI Portal holds no secrets for you, making you familiar with:

Configuration and maintenance of the connection gates (professional and personal) of Microsoft Power BI and administration of licenses, users, and workspaces.
You manage the functionalities of Power BI and the allowed codes, including the use of SQL.
You have experience with the creation of ETL Workflows with a graphical interface and M language in Power BI. Dataflow modeling.
You have experience with the application of relations and hierarchies in Power BI for the materialization of detailed models.
You have knowledge of DAX Language, Calculation Groups, and experience in the creation of Power BI measurements, columns, and data transformations.
You know how to model, cleanse, and ensure the quality of data, keeping control of missing data, mistakes, inconsistencies, or inadequacy.
You have participated in the designing of models for analytical data exploitation according to the functional requirements. All of it while following good corporate practices, and adapting to different levels of normalization, preferably in the STAR model without ambiguity or redundancies.
You have experience working with Microsoft Fabric.
Experience working with agile methodologies.
Power BI certifications and experience with other BI tools will be highly valued.

You were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt regardless of the environments you are required to join.

What is in it for you?

When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification.

Shape your world and achieve together

We want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.

About Fujitsu

Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.

More information: www.fujitsu.com"

Title:
Business Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Business Data Analyst (f/m/d) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Position Overview: Business Data Analyst with focus on reporting
In the role of a BI Developer, your will craft and maintain dynamic dashboards and reports through Yellowfin BI. Working in sync with stakeholders, you‚Äôre tasked with guaranteeing precise data and providing insights that prompt action. Your expertise in data analysis, SQL, and visualization techniques will be pivotal in fostering data-driven choices and elevating the user interface.
Are you driven by a passion for cloud solutions, data instruments, data integrity, and analytics to propel business achievements? Then, we‚Äôre eager to connect with you.

Your mission: 
Your mission is to turn data into actionable insights by creating interactive and user-friendly dashboards and reports, empowering informed decision-making.

Your key responsibilities:
Design and Development: Craft interactive dashboards and reports utilizing Yellowfin BI, ensuring they are user-friendly and visually compelling.
Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical specifications and enjoy our international team.
Dashboard Design: Create appealing designs that tell a true data story instead of just summarizing numbers.
Data Analysis: Ensure data accuracy and integrity in reports and dashboards and troubleshoot wherever things went wrong.
Innovation: Push us to the next level of how we can enable our users to take data driven decision

Your experience:
Proven experience as a Business Intelligent developer or similar role (at least 4 years of experience)
Mastering BI Tools like Looker, Tableau, Microstrategy or Power BI (Yellowfin is a plus)
Solid programming skills in Javascript and SQL for querying and managing data (React knowledge is a plus)
Experience with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes
Understanding of data modeling, data architecture, and data governance
An innovative mindset, problem-solving abilities and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights
Previous experience in the retail and/or e-commerce sector would be a valuable asset
English language proficiency for effective communication within our international team -> it's a plus, if you know German
Bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant field (Computer Science, Data Engineering, etc.)

Join us at Emnos Analytics and be part of a dynamic team that is revolutionizing retail through the power of data. If you are passionate about data engineering, have a knack for turning raw data into valuable insights, and want to shape the future of retail analytics, we want to hear from you üôã

About Emnos Analytics:
Emnos Analytics is a market-leading provider of analytical, AI-based B2B platforms tailored for retailers and their suppliers. We are at the forefront of innovation in the e-commerce and retail sector, dedicated to empowering our clients with data-driven insights to enhance their decision-making processes. With offices in Porto and Munich, we are a diverse and dynamic team working together to shape the future of retail analytics."

Title:
Business Intelligence Analyst
Business Intelligence Analyst

Fraud Data Analyst
Fraud Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Overview

Shift4 (NYSE: FOUR) is boldly redefining commerce by simplifying complex payments ecosystems across the world. As the leader in commerce-enabling technology, Shift4 powers billions of transactions annually for hundreds of thousands of businesses in virtually every industry. For more information, visit www.shift4.com.

Shift4 (NYSE: FOUR) is boldly redefining commerce by simplifying complex payments ecosystems across the world. As the leader in commerce-enabling technology, Shift4 powers billions of transactions annually for hundreds of thousands of businesses in virtually every industry. For more information, visit www.shift4.com.

Responsibilities

Daily monitoring and investigation of suspicious transaction, merchant and third-party activity
Effectively liaise cross-teams and cross company, identifying fraud risk and implementing best-in-class monitoring reports and fraud mitigating procedures.
Strong analytical ability to be able to look at fraud trends within our entire portfolio and at merchant level.
Discuss fraud trends and processes with partners and merchants, discuss action plans and work with them to make recommendations
Perform analysis of purchases/transactions, real-time or near real-time or via company‚Äòs proprietary Business Intelligence tool to identify fraud and chargeback risks
Regular preparation of reports to facilitate the explanation of fraud risk findings. Liaise with Card Schemes including, Visa and MasterCard, regarding fraud and risk-related matters
Be knowledgeable in Scheme chargeback and fraud programs
Monitor and manage the Card Scheme programs including timely review of breaches, investigations, submission of appeals, submission of data to Card Schemes, and reporting to senior management as per internal process.
Work closely with the risk team to identify problematic merchants that need to be closely monitored.
Work closely with the fraud prevention manager to assist with adapting and building the fraud tools used by the team on a daily basis.
Other ad hoc tasks delegated by the manager.

Requirements

Possess 2+ experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Oracle BI, SAP, Qlik, Tableau or SQL.
Hold a Degree qualification in Banking & Finance, Statistics, Data Analytics, Economics or related discipline.
Strong analytical and intuitive investigative skills.
Have previous work experience in a fraud/investigative function gained from working in either Payments or Banking industries.
Have advanced MS Excel Knowledge.
Be excellent at communicating in English ‚Äì Both verbal & in writing.
Be able to work under minimal supervision / high degree of independency allocated and have strong independent decision-making capabilities.
Card transactions Acquiring background highly advantageous
Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize workflows

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class."

Title:
Threat Intelligence Analyst
Threat Intelligence Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
CyberProof is a cybersecurity service and platform company whose mission is to help its customers react faster and smarter, staying ahead of security threats by creating secure digital ecosystems. CyberProof automates processes to detect and prioritize threats early, responding rapidly and decisively.

CyberProof is part of the UST Global family. Some of the world‚Äôs largest enterprises trust us to create and maintain secure digital ecosystems using our comprehensive cyber security platform and mitigation services.

We're on the lookout for a dynamic Threat Intelligence Analyst to join the heart of our SOC team, diving deep into technical research and intelligence analysis across the diverse landscape of cybersecurity. You're set to be a key member of our committed team, offering premium threat intelligence services that are specifically customized for a leading entity in the insurance sector.

Your main tasks and responsabilities will be:

Collect and analyze information about cyberattacks, attack vectors, new vulnerabilities, exploits, campaigns, and trends.
Investigate the activities and identities of cyber threat actors and make predictions about cybercriminals and their future activities.
Create threat intelligence reports and presentations to communicate analysis results to government decision-makers, security officials, and senior corporate executives.
Stay informed about the current open-source threat landscape and computer networking/infrastructure concepts.
Identify, organize, catalog, and track adversary tradecraft trends, even with incomplete data.
Use threat intelligence data to influence enterprise architecture or product development decisions.
Clearly articulate and tailor technical content for various audiences on a weekly brief.
Travel twice a year for company events.

What do we expect from you?

Technical Skills:

At least 2 years of work experience in the cybersecurity field.
CTI background ‚Äì a must.
Knowledgeable about the current open-source threat landscape and computer networking/infrastructure concepts.
Highly competent with OSINT tools (e.g., Buscador, Trace Labs, OSINT VM, OSINT Framework, Maltego, Shodan, social media scraping tools).
Experience conducting research and threat intelligence investigations, including IoC investigation and virtual HUMINT in dark web forums and DM platforms.
Able to identify, organize, catalog, and track adversary tradecraft trends with incomplete data.
Experience in gathering dark web intelligence.
Strong analytical skills.
Experience with developing Python scripts ‚Äì an advantage.
Experienced using threat intelligence data to influence enterprise architecture or product development decisions.
Proficient in English (written and verbal) ‚Äì a must.

Soft Skills:

Ability to work under pressure and solve problems to achieve goals. 
Responsive and able to handle emergencies and urgent incidents.
Collaborative, with the ability to work with multiple teams.
Self-motivated, driven to succeed, and willing to challenge yourself and explore new scopes.
Ability to present complex technical topics simply to top executives.
Willingness to work remotely with an international team.

What do we offer?

23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days.
Office hours. Remote work within Spain. 
Numerous benefits (Heath Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurances).
`Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Heath Care Plan‚Ä¶)
Free access to several training platforms
Professional stability and career plans
Referral program
The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.
Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime‚Ä¶)

Join us at CyberProof to be a part of a dynamic team dedicated to securing digital ecosystems worldwide. Apply now to make a significant impact in the field of cybersecurity."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Description

By becoming a part of Adlook, you'll be entrusted with analytical responsibilities spanning diverse global markets. Your contributions will extend to large-scale projects focused on leveraging data to enhance performance understanding and streamline internal processes through automation.

This role holds pivotal importance in an environment where success hinges on delivering precise insights and grasping critical performance metrics, particularly as Adlook undergoes substantial growth.

Responsibilities

Utilize SQL and/or Python to perform in-depth analysis using databases like Google Big Query
Assist local teams in achieving outstanding outcomes by offering insights and recommendations
Design, execute, and report on A/B testing and Brand Lift studies
Develop and maintain customized reporting and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker Studio, or similar platforms
Collaborate closely with Sales and Platform Managers to deliver exceptional Analytics service to clients
Aid Sales in establishing test protocols for client projects
Conduct meta-analysis across campaigns to extract insights regarding campaign performance and user behavior
Propose and implement processes to enhance the efficiency of internal workflows

Requirements

1-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in roles involving data analytics, focused on deriving insights and generating reports from real-world data
Proficiency in technical skills, including intermediate-level SQL and/or basic-intermediate Python coding necessary for data analysis. Proficiency in SQL is essential for utilizing BigQuery effectively
Ability to frame unstructured problems using available data, coupled with skills in visualizing and communicating results. Proficiency in traditional office applications like Excel and PowerPoint (or their Google Suite equivalents) is required
Understanding of basic statistics and hypothesis testing, including A/B testing and statistical significance
Familiarity with online media and/or e-commerce, encompassing expertise in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe), digital media sales models (CPM, CPC, CPA), and analysis of on-site user behavior
Fluent in English with the ability to present findings in a pedagogue manner
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field (or non-quantitative field with significant quantitative experience). A Master‚Äôs Degree or certifications in analytics, data science, or digital media/marketing are advantageous but not mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, or Looker Studio

Why Adlook

Be part of a company shaping the future of digital marketing
Impactful role in a strategic entity of the Adlook group
Flexible working arrangements
Exposure to a fast-paced and growing online advertising sector
Work in a truly international environment with a dynamic, open-minded team

What We Offer

Ability to join a young and fast-growing global organization with offices across EMEA, US and LATAM
You will get to work with amazing people in one of the fastest growing sectors in online advertising
Opportunity to work in a truly international environment
Friendly atmosphere while working with a dynamic team of open minded professionals with passion for internet technology and advertising solutions
Opportunities for professional growth
Competitive compensation and benefits"

Title:
Marketing Data Analyst
Marketing Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job


Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like

Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards

What we are looking for in you?

Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your primary responsibilities will be:

Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges

What we're looking for:

Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Strong communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)

It would be great if you also have:

Knowledge of financial markets (options, futures, etc.)
Familiarity with financial products

If it seems like a match, don't wait! Apply now and show us what you've got üî•

At LYNX, we value your growth and development; we'll provide you with a supportive work environment and opportunities for your professional development.

Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience;
Pension scheme that is fully paid by LYNX;
Free lunch from our cook or lunch ticket, fresh juices & fruit;

Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨ 2,000 per year;

Relaxed and informal working environment. 

About us:

""LYNX helps you invest in yourself""

""Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family""

""The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work""

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Description

Are you an experienced data analyst looking to make a move to an innovative, forward-thinking tech company? Do you enjoy creating innovative analysis, finding impactful insights and answering key business questions? Good news! 1WorldSync is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Portugal team in Lisbon or Porto.

1WorldSync is the industry leader in product content management. With 600 employees across the US, Brazil, Canada, France, Portugal, Switzerland, Germany, and the UK, we‚Äôre seeking a Software Engineer to support our growing global team.

Role

Reporting to the Director, Data & Analytics, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in our Data team. Your primary responsibility will be to collaborate with various departments including Product, Sales, Customer Success, and Engineering, to develop and implement automated, data-driven solutions and analytical tools that empower users to make effective decisions, both internally and externally to the company. You'll contribute to enhancing operational efficiencies and informing decision-making processes across the organization. As a Data Analyst, the successful candidate will:

Develop data-driven dashboards using Python, BigQuery SQL, and Power BI.
Conduct in-depth analysis of extensive datasets, extracting insights into patterns, trends, and seasonal fluctuations.
Perform ad-hoc analyses to address immediate business needs.
Identify opportunities for process optimization and implement automated solutions aligned with predefined objectives.
Apply analytical techniques to tackle operational challenges.
Assist in eliciting data requirements from cross-departments, including Customer Support, Product, Finance, Engineering and Sales teams.
Update, remove or archiving data flows in the context of Data Analysis, where applicable.
Maintain proper documentation for all queries, script and other tools used/developed, including processes and procedures.
Guide the data side process of performing A/B tests to aid in critical business decisions, including all related analytical work.
Translate Business Requirements into detailed functional specifications, training programs and process documentation. 
Follow security processes for the development of analytical tools/dashboards, including the operations and administration of related systems where these will be made available (e.g. Power BI).
Communicate and collaborate with internal and external customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements.
Assist in project feasibility and level-of-effort analysis by providing findings, with supported evidence, of the best approaches to take.
 Identify and manage risks with timely reporting and appropriately escalates issues.
Communicate solutions, designs, and processes with the QA, Development and launch teams.
Perform QA on developed solutions to ensure quality is as expected, before being reviewed by senior colleagues.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Skills And Experience

A professional with 1-3 years of experience in data analytics, with a strong foundation in analytical capabilities.
A graduate in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python, BigQuery, and BigQuery SQL.
Skilled in predictive analytics and experienced in BI tools, particularly Power BI.

Desired Skills And Experience

Experience with A/B test theory and practice, including different methodologies applied in A/B testing and best practices.
Familiarity with BI UX design, dashboard layout, and chart/card design within the Domo platform.
Experience with cloud platform-based servers and systems.
Experience working with JIRA and Scrum.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Tool Suite (i.e. Google Sheets, Google Slides & Google Docs).
Capabilities in Data Science with Python and experience with Keras/Tensorflow for deep learning applications.
Familiarity with building Machine Learning models and deep learning for Data Science tasks.
Manage multiple priorities and deliver to project timelines.
Proven track record of delivery and cross functional collaboration.
Proven ability to assemble the appropriate resources to resolve issues quickly and innovatively.
Demonstrates 1WS Core Values in Action

Environment

Software: Domo, SQL, Python, Power BI, BigQuery

Benefits

Health-care provision
28 days paid vacation, as well as public holidays, and volunteer time off 
Summer and Winter salary payment
Daily meal allowance per day of effective work 
Employee assistance program, including health and wellbeing support

Additional Details

This is a remote position, with the option to work in the Porto or Lisbon office. with occasional visits to Porto or Lisbon offices. 
This role requires the candidate to have the authority to work in, and be located in Portugal.

Title:
Marketing Data Analyst
Marketing Data Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Role Overview: 

As our Marketing/Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in shaping our marketing strategies through data-driven insights. You will be responsible for tracking and analyzing our lead generation, conversion rates, and overall customer journey. Your work will directly inform and optimize our marketing tactics, contributing to our growth and success in various regions.

Key Responsibilities: 
Design and implement tracking systems for all our marketing activities across multiple channels and platforms. Analyze data on leads, conversions, website traffic, and overall customer engagement to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement. Create detailed reports and dashboards that provide insights into KPIs, marketing effectiveness, customer behavior, and ROI. Work closely with connected teams to refine lead qualification processes, enhance sales funnel efficiency, and improve customer journey mapping. Develop and monitor performance metrics, providing regular updates to the marketing team and senior management. Conduct A/B testing on different marketing campaigns to drive improvements in conversion rates and other key performance indicators.

Requirements: 

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a marketing analysis, data analysis, or similar role, preferably in the fintech or financial services sector. 
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Proficiency in data analytics tools (e.g., Power BI, Google Analytics, Tableau, SQL) and experience with CRM systems. Knowledge of digital marketing principles and SEO strategies. 
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Proactive, critical thinker with a problem-solving attitude and an ability to work in a fastpaced, dynamic environment. 

Here are your perks of joining us: 

Go for challenges, be proficient and committed, and you will grab the fruit of satisfaction, pride and you will be duly rewarded.

Global Career Evolution |NAGA.com grows fast. Turn your passion and dedication into results, and so will you! Bring your enthusiasm to work, be hands-on with your projects, be keen to grow! Our international environment, with its global diversity, will provide you with ample opportunities to learn, perform and make an impact to be proud of. Hard work makes for true winners! 

Professional Hyper Growth | To challenge the future, you need knowledge close-at-hand. We make sure you get the finest trainings and certifications to propel your career. Cross-functional projects lead to cross-functional learning. We work together, we learn from one another.

Connection & Belonging | People who belong together, perform together, and they do it far better! We give you every chance to foster real connection & true belonging through lots of cool activities. Great experiences and quality time enjoyed together drive focus and results.

Reward & Recognition | In a constantly changing world, you‚Äôll need a strong foothold. You will have a fixed income aligned with your professional experience. We have also leveled up the game with performance bonuses to honor your accomplishments. Are you driven and a team player? Let‚Äôs meet and challenge the future together"

Title:
PURCHASING & SALES DATA ANALYST
PURCHASING & SALES DATA ANALYST with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
With presence in more than 20 countries and more than 40.000 employees, we are an international group dedicated to the design, development and manufacture of metal automotive components.

The Group specializes in developing innovatively designed products to achieve increasingly safer and lighter vehicles, thereby reducing energy consumption and environmental impact.

Located in Palau (Europe Division HQ), we are looking to hire a Purchasing & Sales Data Analyst who actively and in a teamwork role gives added value to Purchasing & Sales departments though the following activities:

Monthly update of the Purchasing & Sales activities for follow-up: Review and analysis of KPI, explanation of main deviations and potentials, and analysis of risks and potentials.
Measurement of economic impact for decision-making: Calculate the economic impact of the different solutions and transfer the profitability and economic point of view to any decision with objective data, in a clear and concise way.
Directing management towards economic results.
Control and validate the savings plans proposed by the Factory, Region, and Division purchasing teams.
Implementation of purchasing monitoring and benchmark tools.

Key Qualifications/Requirements

Excel, PPT required

Title:
Stagiair | Junior Data Analist
Stagiair | Junior Data Analist
Job Description:
"About the job
Beschrijving van het bericht

Stagiair | Junior Data Analist

Op zoek naar een meewerkstage waar je als onderdeel van een innoverend datateam impact gaat maken op de duurzame inzetbaarheid van medewerkers? Wordt dan onze nieuwe stagiair Data Analist!

Dit ga je doen

Als Stagiair Data Analist Employee Wellbeing ga je klanten van Aon in staat stellen om data-gedreven te sturen op onderwerpen als vitaliteit en verzuim. Dit doe je door het bouwen van visueel aantrekkelijke rapportages en dashboards in Power BI. Ook duik je zelf in de data om op basis van correlaties, regressies en machine learning tot nieuwe inzichten te komen. Samen met je team werk je aan innoverende oplossingen op het gebied van Employee Wellbeing.

Ook hier word je enthousiast van

Meedenken over hoe we de medewerkers van onze klanten n√≥g beter kunnen bedienen
Innoveren en pionieren: we zijn samen aan het bouwen dus er is veel ruimte voor creativiteit en nieuwe idee√´n
Jonge en gedreven collega's met een focus op het maken van impact


Hier kom je te werken

Aon is wereldwijd een toonaangevende wereldwijde adviseur op het gebied van risico-, pensioen- en gezondheidsoplossingen. We helpen organisaties en individuen om hun volledige potentieel te bereiken door het beheer van risico's, het optimaliseren van hun personeelsbestand en het bevorderen van welzijn en gezondheid. Met meer dan 50.000 medewerkers in ruim 120 landen zijn we toegewijd aan het leveren van innovatieve oplossingen en diensten van topkwaliteit.

Dit ben jij

Bachelor- of master in Information Sciences, Data Science, Statistiek, Computer Science of een gerelateerd veld.
Affiniteit met het werken met diverse datasets en het toepassen van data-analysemethoden.
Motivatie en bereidheid om met Power BI te leren werken. Indien je hier al mee kan werken is dit een enorme plus.
Kennis van programmeertalen (bijv. Python, R) is ook een pluspunt. 
Interesse in welzijns- en gezondheid gerelateerde vraagstukken en trends.
Creatief, nieuwsgierig en in staat om out-of-the-box oplossingen te bedenken.
Teamspeler met een proactieve en resultaatgerichte mentaliteit.


We begrijpen dat een stagiair mogelijk nog niet aan alle kwalificaties en vereisten voldoet, en daarom staan we open voor een flexibele aanpak waarbij we de functie en bijbehorende verantwoordelijkheden zo goed mogelijk laten aansluiten op jouw behoefte4n en talenten.

Dit verzekeren wij

Een stagevergoeding van ‚Ç¨400,- (HBO) of ‚Ç¨550,- (WO) bruto per maand. Mocht er een match zijn kijken we na je stage ook graag naar verdere doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen Aon na je stage.

En nu?

Wil je graag meer inhoudelijke informatie over deze vacature? Dat kan. Voel je meer dan vrij te schakelen met onze Talent Acquisition Business Partner (Early Careers) Dis Gr√∂tzinger via 06-27173154.

Na je sollicitatie:

 Ontvang je meteen een bevestiging in je inbox
 Binnen 2 werkdagen neemt onze Recruiter Dis Gr√∂tzinger contact met je op voor een kort kennismakingsgesprek
 Iedereen enthousiast? Dan plannen we een afspraak in waar ook de manager van deze vacature bij aanschuift


2540577"

Title:
Risk & Compliance Data Analyst
Risk & Compliance Data Analyst with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
The Data Analyst role forms part of the UK Risk and Compliance (‚ÄúUKR&C‚Äù) function. UKR&C reports through to the Global Law and Compliance function. The primary responsibility for this role will be to turn data in to information, turn information into insights which can then support the R&C team to make better business decisions.

If you are excited to work with data, keep on reading!

Aon is in the business of better decisions 

At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.

As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team that is passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.

What Makes This Position Different

This position is critical to the overall success of the Compliance Assurance (CA) team and the development of a Data Analytics capability UK R&C to support ongoing 2nd line assurance activity and improve the insights that can be delivered through MI and reporting.

What The Day Will Look Like

Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems. This also includes filtering the data, investigating missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance.
Transformation of data gathered from various sources across the firm into structured information to provide insights that shape the direction of assurance reviews as well as driving longer term decisions on the ongoing Compliance Assurance plans.
Work with the CA & Analytics Lead and other members of the R&C SLT to determine and prioritise the needs of different teams and enhance the analytical and reporting capability across the function.
Undertake data analysis lifecycle activities on assurance reviews and other data related projects - this covers requirement gathering, activity execution and design planning.
Detect, examine, and decode trends or patterns within intricate datasets. Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyse data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends and produce actionable business insights.
Develop data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision-making across the department.
Convey insights through reports and creation of visual representations of data findings to make the data understandable at a glance.

Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success

English level - B2+/C1 minimum (written and spoken).
Possess a solid foundation in statistics and practical experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS) and mastery in data analysis languages including SQL, Python, and R.
Exhibit exceptional analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, and present substantial data sets with precision and thoroughness.
Sound knowledge of data management and data privacy concepts
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights.
Ability to communicate effectively on all levels. Strong communication and presentation capabilities, adept at simplifying complex data insights for audiences without a technical background.
Experience with Tableau, Power BI or alternative data visualization packages
Solid attention to detail.
Excellent organisational and time management skills, able to cope during times of high workloads. Proactive and able to identify priorities effectively.
Experience of working in an international environment would be an asset.

How We Support Our Colleagues

In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two ‚ÄúGlobal Wellbeing Days‚Äù each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!

Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.

We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com

Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

NB. Dependant on regional requirements, please include specific benefits where applicable and relevant accommodation criteria and enhanced equal opportunities statement.

#businessupport

2544525"

Title:
Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Job Description:
"About the job
For many thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!

Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and French.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of France.
Analytical mindset.
Job Requirements

Must be living in France for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.

Benefits

¬∑ Work up to 20 hours per week.
¬∑ Earn a competitive rate of pay.
¬∑ Develop your research skills.
¬∑ Avoid the long commute.
¬∑ Work from the comfort of your home office.
¬∑ Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!

Apply Online Today!"

Job Description:
"About the job
D√©tail de l'offre

Description Du Poste

Intitul√© du poste

PV Performance Data Analyst

Contrat

CDI

Temps de travail

Temps complet

Description De La Mission

Bouygues Energies and Services is a small branch within the Equans France and we specialize in energy and, more broadly, in electrical engineering for renewable energies. Our job is to design, build and maintain photovoltaic power plants such as shading systems and solar power plants, which can be on land or floating.

Equans France, in general, designs, installs, maintains, and operates technical systems and customized services in over 30 countries. These services enable customers to combine control over their energy consumption with quality of life and working conditions for their users.

Among the 27 000+ employees that are accompanying Equans France on its adventure, 550 of them is supporting the Energy Business of Bouygues Energies & Services.

New job opportunity : Equans Solar & Storage is hiring :

?? The PV Performance Data Analyst is a member of BYES International O&M team managing ca.1GWp of utility scale solar PV power plants. ??

? He/she will be an integral person in the day-to-day operation of solar farms, including assessing the performance of the solar farms, analysing operation data with a view to extract actionable insights, real-time monitoring when required and troubleshooting technical issues with the generating assets when required. ?

Title:
Data Research Analyst
Data Research Analyst
Job Description:
"About the job
Role

Our EMEA Data Team is looking for a Data Research Analyst to process our data across global markets. We are a team of data analysts who have effective relationships with other teams and are committed to deliver best quality data. As a Data Research Analyst in the Data Division, you will work closely with the Global Data Team and Local Business Representatives, taking responsibility for data coverage, quality, and timeliness to the highest standards. The Operation Data Analyst will form closer links with providers related to data acquisition processes and gain knowledge of our database. The position will be based in our Data and Development Center EMEA in Madrid.

Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with the global data teams
Data expert on investment data points, processes, methodologies, calculations & different fund structures
Manage business relationships with fund companies. Connecting with providers & setting up acquisition channels as well as acting as a point of escalation
Meet the predetermined production deadlines for internal and external clients
Continuously evaluate procedures, create and enhance analytical tools, and implement process improvement projects.
Utilize project management methodologies such as LEAN Six Sigma to track, evaluate and determine resolution approach for complex data issues.
Collect and maintain Morningstar data, ensuring high levels of data accuracy, completeness and coverage.
Demonstrate a high sense of ownership of the issues in the data ticket queue to be responsive and provide timely updates, follow-up, expedition, and resolution.
Understand roles, responsibilities, and expertise of internal partners to expedite issue resolution.
Translate requests from internal clients into detailed written specifications and user stories.
Improve and document client use cases to ensure any new functionality meets and exceeds client expectations


Requirements

A bachelor's degree or equivalent is required
Proficient oral and written communication skills. 
Collaborates well in a team environment, have the ability to communicate and work with team members from diverse backgrounds, in a conscientious and inclusive way.
Sensitive to clients' needs
Solid understanding of the financial industry and passionate about investment data.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills, capable of handling high volumes of data and meeting strict deadlines
You will be collaborating with cross functional teams and leading from the front when it comes to Operational data, Performance data, etc, so experience within data methodology/quality and processes is a big bonus.
Previous experience in project management is preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel


Hybrid Work

Morningstar's hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. We've found that we're at our best when we're purposely together on a regular basis, at least three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you'll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

Albourne is a global financial services group of companies. Our objective is to advise our clients to be the best investors they can be. The company‚Äôs main areas of focus are fund research, portfolio and risk advice, FinTech and implementation. The Nicosia office opened in 1998 and it provides back office and IT services to the regulated companies of the Albourne group; it currently has over 300 dynamic employees and we are looking to have more to join our teams across various functions.

Role in Brief

You‚Äôll join a fantastic team that will provide the foundational structure to learn about the business and you will interact with numerous departments across the company. The role was previously pure data entry but has since evolved. As you learn and develop within the job, you will have the opportunity to get involved in other areas.

Insights to the Role

Processing of fund data and other information into Albourne‚Äôs proprietary database on an ongoing basis. Liaising with fund managers and third-party service providers to verify accuracy of information
Data scraping of information into excel-based reports
Answering internal and external queries related to fund data
Checking and importing data into the database which feeds into another teams‚Äô workflow

Who You Are

You should be fluent in spoken and written English
You could be a fresh graduate with a university degree in finance, economics, mathematics, or equivalent subject area
You could already be a working professional, with a minimum of two years‚Äô experience under your belt, working in a related field
You are comfortable working in a big team; able to communicate effectively and balance multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment
You are eager to learn and possess impeccable attention to detail

What We Offer

Support for professional qualifications (such as CFA and CAIA)
Career growth and tools for ongoing learning and development
Medical insurance for you and your dependents
Provident fund
Yearly bonus dependent upon performance and company growth
Opportunity for international travel (i.e., short periods of secondment to other Albourne offices)
5 additional service recognition holidays in surplus to standard annual leave
Albourne Training Days (minimum of 40 hours per year)
Free office parking

What You‚Äôll Enjoy

A supportive, multi-cultural work environment
Freedom to work independently, problem-solve and come up with creative solutions to complete tasks within required deadlines
Explore different roles within Albourne after you master your current role. There are excellent opportunities for horizontal and vertical career progression
Open plan office equipped with kitchen facilities and communal entertainment area
Fun social activities
Charity Day ‚Äì a day in the year to work on a cause you are passionate about
We are supportive of fitness, mental health and wellness; implementing company-wide sessions for people to partake in activities related to these areas
Albourne embraces diversity and equal opportunity for all its employees.
We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of cultural backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Successful candidates would be required to comply with the terms of Albourne‚Äôs compliance manuals and procedures.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted"
